resources.string: I'm sure that even at the height of the fighting, half of Luskan wasn't even aware of it. That's just the way it is.
Aye, I suppose you outsiders wouldn't know much about it, would you? The wizards were killing each other in the tower up until recently.
I don't know what started it, and I'm certainly glad I wasn't involved. The important thing is that it's over, now, though the tower's a mess.
Well... I don't mean to imply that security will be insufficient for you, my <lord/lady>. So many of the wizards died in all the fighting, though.
It's my understanding, too, that in the fighting there was a lot of... accidents. Things that still have to cleared up, you see. That's another reason why it's dangerous for you to roam.
Well, the Archmage used to be Arklem Greeth. He's gone, now, and while I know someone's taken his place, I don't know who that is.
Most likely he died in the fighting, but I don't really know.
No one enters without my leave!
A moment of your time before you enter the tower, please.
Why you has big golem guy?
Why do you have a golem here?
You knows 'bout cult here, maybe?
Do you know anything about a cult here?
You hears 'bout someone named Maugrim?
Have you heard of anyone named Maugrim?
You trusts traitor to lead army, huh?
You trust a traitor to lead the army?
How you knows that true?
How do you know that's true?
What he gives orcs?
What has he offered you?
Who this Obould you keeps talking 'bout?
Who is this Obould you keep mentioning?
Me ambassador, comes from Mulhorand.
I am the ambassador from Mulhorand.
Heh. Me likes you. You gots orc-blood, me sees that. It make you strong, huh? Me full orc, important orc, but yous okay.
It come with room. Wizards say it to protect me. Me needs no protection, though! Me great warrior!
Uh? Me not know nothing 'bout no cult. Not cares, neither. If wizards say they wants to make war, we okays with that.
Traitor, elf, whatever. Maugrim say he has her under control real good, so me not have much worry. If it go bad, orcs kill wizards and go home.
Maugrim tells me himself. Me gots no reason to think he lie. Why tells orc that elf going to leads him? If lie be big, dumb lie.
Hah! Me likes you, but me not tells you that. You get own deal with wizards.
You knows nothing. King Obould Many-Arrows be greatest chieftain of orcs. He have largest clan, he call other clans to come for war! Great army! Wizards be happy if wizards be smart.
Huh. Me not hears of that place. Dumb wizards bring peoples from all over, when all they needs is Obould Many-Arrows. Me tells them this.
You hears 'bout cult here, maybe?
Have you heard anything of a cult here?
What fight you speaks 'bout?
What fighting is that?
Why you gots big golem here?
Why is there a golem in your room?
You knows 'bout somebody named Maugrim?
Have you heard of one named Maugrim?
You trust traitor woman to leads army?
You trust a traitor to lead an army?
How you knows 'bout Aribeth? It true?
How do you know that about Aribeth? Is it true?
What promise he makes you?
What promise has he made you?
Me ambassador of Mulhorand.
I am the ambassador from Mulhorand.
A cult? If these wizards worship anything beyond their own power, I have never heard of it. Perhaps the cult caused the fighting, here, I do not know.
There is one in every room, placed here by the wizards to guard us. The last mage I saw referred to it as a 'shield guardian'.
Do not trouble yourself, <man/woman>. They do little unless they are provoked.
Of course I have. Have you not? It was he who invited me to this tower. The man is the new Archmage Arcane, after all.
If the elven wench steps out of line, she'll not get far. I am assured by Maugrim, however, that this Aribeth is quite firmly under his control.
I have met the elven woman once, myself. She is a fallen paladin... dark and terrible. She will be the wind that blows our blaze across the north!
Hah! I'll suffer none of your lowlander spying. If Maugrim gets what he wants, the Elk tribe gets what we want... that is all you need to know.
If your people chose a simpleton to represent them, then they are fools.
I have never heard of this place you speak of. It cannot be important. If the wizards see you before me, I shall be furious indeed. I have waited almost long enough!
By the gods! What have I summoned!
When Maugrim comes here?
When did Maugrim arrive?
But I... have nothing left, my <lord/lady>. You have taken it all.
Arklem listened eagerly to his promises of power. Maugrim hinted that the mistress he served could bring great success to the Arcane Brotherhood.
Who be this Valinda?
Who is Valinda Shadowmantle?
A young sorceress who was once one of Arklem's greatest supporters. She has much knowledge of the towers, which has no doubt been of benefit to Maugrim.
For the Blood War! Raaaahhhh!!
You no stand in way! Oldest of enemies be here... we must find!
The devils and demons must fight! Must fight!!
Always be the baatezu eternal enemies of the tanar'ri!
You get away! Blood enemies be here!
<StartAction>Leave the brazier alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Put an imp's eye in the flames.</Start>
<StartAction>Put a quasit's eye in the flames.</Start>
<StartAction>Put a piece of rubble in the flames.</Start>
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start><StartAction> Examine the brazier more closely.</Start>
The flames of the brazier appear to be cold, and give off an aura that is unsettling as you draw near. The magic emanating from this device is almost palpable.
You step back from the brazier, the chill lessening the further away you move.
The imp's eye appears to be unaffected by the flames. It does not disappear, nor does it appear to be singed in any fashion.
There is a bright flash as the imp's eye is swallowed by the flames. A moment later the brazier begins to quake violently...
The quasit's eye appears to be unaffected by the flames. It does not disappear, nor does it appear to be singed in any fashion.
There is a bright flash as the quasit's eye is swallowed by the flames. A moment later the brazier begins to quake violently...
You pick up a small piece of stone and put it into the flames. With a small burst of light and the stench of brimstone, the stone disappears.
You can see the faint after-image of the stone beyond the flames, but only for a moment. You likely don't want to place anything in there you intend to keep.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Through the flames, some other strange place can just barely be seen. You can tell nothing else from your examination.
Wherever the flames lead, it is too small to walk into. Something small could be put into it, however.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> There is an image of another place just beyond the flames, making you believe that the brazier may be some manner of portal to another plane.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You believe that the flames form a small, permanent portal to the outer planes... either the Abyss or Baator, most likely. It is, no doubt, the conduit that the imps and quasits have been summoned through.
The portal appears to be two-way, although anything entering from this side would have to be very small. There is no way to bodily move through it.
The brazier is cold, the flames gutted.
<StartAction>Leave the chamber alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Destroy the chamber.</Start>
<StartAction>Put the Golem Replication Rod into a depression.</Start>
<StartAction>Put the Golem Control Rod into a depression.</Start>
<StartAction>Examine the depressions.</Start>
This chamber has been formed of marble and complex crystals within its core, containing two depressions along its edge. It practically crackles with dormant magical energy.
You turn away from the strange structure.
You attempt to strike the chamber, but your blow slides harmlessly off an invisible barrier next to its surface.
The second rod slides into place beside the first, stopping with a faint click. Both rods begin to shine brilliantly, the chamber leaping to life...
The rod slides easily into place, stopping with a faint click. It begins to glow slightly and the chamber hums... though it does nothing as of yet.
The second rod slides into place beside the first, stopping with a faint click. Both rods begin to shine brilliantly, the chamber leaping to life...
The rod slides easily into place, stopping with a faint click. It begins to glow slightly and the chamber hums... though it does nothing as of yet.
One of the depressions has been filled with a small rod. The chamber hums with activity, appearing to await something else.
The two depressions are long and slender, very likely receptacles awaiting something to be placed within them.
This chamber is smoking every so slightly. Both rods in its depressions are blackened, burnt-out husks. Whatever magic fueled this chamber appears to have spent itself.
Your corpse shall join the ranks of my minions, adventurer!
Your head shall adorn my dinner table fool.
Hey Fred I struck a deal with the roaches and they agree we can easily tunnel out of here in under 20 years.
You are looking rather well today Fred, I'm glad to see you up and about.
Shhh, don't talk too loud Fred this side of the cell is working for the Warden.
Just about everything a man needs in this world he can find right here. Food, shelter and regular beatings, that's the life for me Fred!
My oh my Fred how the time does pass when you spend it with good friends.
Ahhh ha ha. Oh Fred you kill me, that's the best joke I ever heard.
All of them are out to get me, they think I don't know, but I do.
They're the ones that got me thrown in here, all them conspired to have me put away.
Soon my revenge will come... very soon.
Never underestimate the power of hate, it keeps a man warm inside.
Everyone around me is a traitor and liar, they steal my thoughts to make me suffer! But I have secret thoughts they will never find!
I see they have finally come to murder me, shut me up, make their problems go away. Well I wont let them, no I will make them swim in their own blood.
Do not enter the portal at this time.
Enter the portal
The portal seems to be inactive, at its center a small hole marks the spot where a portal stone would go.
Through the portal you see the Spine of the World and a small settlement. Do you proceed?
I will feed on your pain and fear.
Death awaits all who oppose us.
Master must be protected.
Make no selection at this time.
A portal is already open, please be patient.
Your soul will suffer at the hands of the master, fleshling.
The Shield Guardian stares straight ahead and does not seem to hear you.
Karcha will see the flesh torn from your bones puny creature.
Baram will pleased with your head on a pike.
Heeheehee! Me kill you manthing! Heehee!
I shall crush you, puny manling!
You die die die! Heehee!
Me need healing.
I need healing.
Who you be?
Who are you?
Me not understand 'bout Stone of Recall and teleport portal.
Teleportation portal? Stone of Recall? I don't understand.
Me need you go over that one more time.
Can you explain that again?
Goodbye.
Me need to return to mission. Me need to go back to place where me died.
How me get here?
I need to return to my mission. I must get back to where I just was.
Send me back.
What should me do then?
What do you suggest I do then?
Me think you're right. Goodbye.
I think you're right. I'll see you later.
Teleport portal? Recall Stone? What you be talking about?
Teleportation portal? Stone of Recall? What are you talking about?
Me want go back now!
Just get me back there.
Me change my mind. Goodbye.
I've changed my mind. I'll see you later.
Yes. Me want to go back now.
Yes. Transport me there now.
How did I get here?
Me no trust you Recall spell! You take spell off me now!
You say me be fully healed?
I don't want your stupid Word of Recall spell teleporting me anywhere. Cancel the spell, right now!
How me get back where me be before?
So how am I supposed to get back to where I was?
You mean I'm fully healed?
Me no remember you cast spell on me.
How come I don't remember you casting a Recall spell on me?
Who you be?
Who are you?
Greetings, my <lord/lady>. Such a hero as yourself is welcome within these halls. Aarin Gend has asked me to aid you in your cause.
I have erected a teleportation portal here similar to the one in Port Llast, and have attuned myself to the Stone of Recall you carry.
I would gladly help you, my <lord/lady>... but most of my power has been used to erect the portal and maintain the spell on the Stone of Recall. I am sure the other clerics here can aid you.
I am Alaya, a cleric here at Luskan's temple of Tyr.
Has this never been explained to you? The Stone of Recall you carry will teleport you and anyone in your service back here to this temple when it is activated.
What is more, when you activate the Stone of Recall here, it will take you and the people with you back to the last place you used it.
It should save you and any companions you may have considerable time in the future should you ever wish to return here quickly.
Do you know where you are? This is the temple of Tyr in Luskan. I have returned your soul from the brink of death, though it was not an easy task.
Farewell, my <lord/lady>. Tyr's blessing upon you.
I can certainly do that, my <lord/lady>... but whatever danger caused you to arrive here still remains where it was. It would be unfortunate to have you return too soon.
Before you say you wish to return, perhaps you might consider getting more equipment? Or perhaps you might take another path that is safer?
Alternatively, you might also wish to take the portal back to wherever you last activated the stone of recall, my <lord/lady>.

It is... odd that you would forget, my <lord/lady>. Has this never been explained to you? The Stone of Recall you carry will teleport you and anyone in your service back here to this temple when it is activated.
What is more, when you activate the Stone of Recall here, it will take you and the people with you back to the last place you used it.
Of course, if you did not know about the stone, perhaps you have never used it. It should save you considerable time in the future should you ever wish to return here quickly.
As you wish. The Dimensional Fold spell will return you to the place where you were called from last. Are you ready?
As you wish. Prepare yourself, my <lord/lady>...
Perhaps you have lost your memory, my <lord/lady>? I do not blame you. The transition can be disturbing, I understand.
Aarin Gend has asked me to use my skills to keep you from meeting an untimely demise. I cast a Word of Recall upon you when you arrived in the city, which returned you here when you fell.
I would not think of telling you your business, my <lord/lady>, but I do urge you to be more cautious. Resurrection carries a price that I am certain you do not wish to pay more than you must.
That... that would be foolish, my <lord/lady>. Were you to perish again, there would be no way for me to aid you, and neither of us would be able to assist your cause.
Yes, of course. I healed you while you were still unconscious... and cast another Word of Recall upon you, should you encounter trouble once again.
You do not need to be present for its casting, my <lord/lady>. Aarin Gend told me your name, which is enough.
I am Alaya, a cleric here at the temple that your friend, Aarin Gend, has recruited to aid your cause. I am glad to be of service.
You are awake, my <lord/lady>? Please, I must speak with you.
We are very disappointed in you, <FirstName>. Your slaughter of innocent people has caused much suffering in a time already overburdened with tragedy.
Were it up to me you would have been left to rot in your grave; however, Aarin Gend has ordered me to resurrect you. Despite your actions, Neverwinter still has need of you.
You will suffer no further consequences for your mad killing spree, but I implore you not to engage in such wholesale slaughter again. Please, focus on the mission you have been given.
This innkeeper keeps a wary eye on the traffic flowing in an dout of his establishment.
This elf seems upset about something, which in this city, really comes as no surprise.
This noblewoman has obviously seen better times. Clothes worn thin, she appears completely despondant.
This gnome has a wary, yet cheerful disposition that seems quite out-of-place in this city.
With the symbol of Bane marked clearly on her armor, this priestess has a cold sneer of disdain etched permanently on her face.
This hound looks lean and mean, trained to maul and kill any who would harm a worker here.
Paranoia and terror seem to dominate the features of this older man.
This noble woman carries herself with an air of superiority, yet a troubled expression clouds her features momentarily.
Marked with the sign of the Black Knives, this patron looks as though he has partaken of the pleasures of this house numerous times in the past.
This beautiful, young courtesan has a bored expression on her face, until she notices someone is looking, then she becomes cheerful and attentive.
Marked with the sign of the Bloody Hands, this patron looks as though he has partaken of the pleasures of this house numerous times in the past.
This patron looks as though he has partaken of the pleasures of this house numerous times in the past.
This young, handsome male courtesan has a troubled look on his face.
This beautiful, young courtesan has a troubled expression on her face.
This brute of a warrior carries himself with the assurance of a man who has won many victories and known few defeats.
Kurth's warriors have seen a lot of action in their days, and they have the scars and skills to show for it.
Voleron
This dark-cowled figure moves with a silent, deadly grace, like the shadow of an owl over a moonlit forest.
This beautiful elf has obviously been mistreated as Kurth's prisoner, as testified by the large bruises on her wrists and neck, and the tender way she moves.
This weasel-faced man seems to command a great deal of power, though it is not clear how.
This female has waxy, deathly-pale skin and a chilling gaze.
This man appears to be very nervous and edgy; working in Luskan often does that to people.
Acolyte of Tyr
The Black Knives are quick, sneaky and dirty fighters, who use every tactic they can think of to kill others without direct confrontation. When they must fight, they show no mercy.
This poor child doesn't look to have eaten very well, or had new clothes in a long time.
Having lost his home in these desperate times, this man snores soundly, seeking blissful refuge from reality.
This outlandishly dressed male, gnome prostitute smells faintly of turnips. Not the earthy, farm-like turnip smell, but like he is wearing some kind of turnip-based perfume.
Paranoia and terror seem to dominate the features of this cringing man.
Having given up on life in Luskan, this woman seeks the safety of oblivion in the bottom of a tankard of some foul-smelling brew.
Tears of terror stream down the face of this small child.
A wary paranoia of others and grim determination seem to grip this guard's demeanor.
Cutlass Guard
This merchant keeps a close watch on his goods; a paranoia bred of true survival instincts here in Luskan.
The Bloody Hand warriors have seen a lot of action in their days, and they have the scars and skills to show for it.
Bloody Hand Archer
Paranoia and terror seem to dominate the features of this cringing woman.
Having given up on life in Luskan, this man seeks the safety of oblivion in the bottom of a tankard of some foul-smelling brew.
Ogre Deathward
This smith has the deep scowl of one who is little impressed by the happenings going on around him.
This gruff and muscular guard frowns as he looks around and the tower and the city.
These guard have the nervous wariness that marks a man who's used to being attacked.
This barbarian woman looks tired, bored and frustrated; a deadly combination in any barbarian.
This elf has a nasty looking weapon which she obviously wields with great skill.
Based on the blood matting his hair, this powerful minotaur looks like he enjoys his control over the prisoners in this area.
Large bruises, cuts and other signs of torture mark this man as a prisoner.
Aribeth stands here, with a blank, passionless, mask-like visage, like armour for her soul.
Gorgoth
There is something very strange about the expression on this man's face. His very presence radiates extreme evil.
This creature radiates a cold, calculating evil presence.
High Captain Suljack
Whatever god this priest serves, the blood and markings on his clothes show him as clearly evil.
This exceedingly beautiful woman looks completely out of place in this evil place.
This large man carries himself with nervous dignity, as if afraid to show his true nature, yet unable to hide it completely.
Zhelhund
This man has a dark, piercing gaze that slides around as if trying to solve some kind of puzzle.
This is a combat dummy, marked up with slashes and sewn back together many times.
Fred
This guard stands at attention, as if his life depends on his being aware of everything, which it is.
Host Tower Guard
Aarin Gend looks like a caged tiger, all of his energy and anger focused inwards, ready to attack at the earliest possible chance.
This well-rounded, worried-looking woman, seems able to cope with the rigorous treatment of the rowdy men in this establishment, with a firm hand.
Greater Stink Beetle
An exhausted priest stands here with a small smile on his face.
Alaya

This is a simple skeleton key designed for opening a large number of similar locks.
This key is covered with Yuan-Ti sigils and looks like it would be able to over come magical wards and protections.
Crypt Key

This amulet has obviously seen better days. It's face is cracked and caked with grime and tarnish, and the metal is dented in many places... obviously it has been gnawed on extensively. Whatever the amulet once was, it still seems to hold some of its power and has a subdued reddish glow when worn.
This key is made of a light metal and, by its severe wear and tarnish, is obviously quite old.

The book is a small journal of sorts that does not seem to have been in use for long. The entries, however, appear to have been made by Lady Aribeth. Of particular note is the last:
"Maugrim has assigned me quarters with the other ambassadors, though I don't know for how long. He tells me that he serves a greater power, and hints that I will come to revere this being far more than I ever did Tyr.
"I do not know if that is true. I am not sure of anything anymore except that I have Fallen. Fallen out of love with my lord, my people and my God. I am alone in a world where there is no justice and no hope and I cannot... I cannot get these thoughts out of my mind.
"They burn my every waking moment and whisper to me in my dreams. I shall go mad, I think, if I am not mad already. To do the wrong thing seems far better, however, than to do nothing at all. I am on this path now, and it goes only forward... perhaps at its end I shall find my own justice and the dreams will stop.
"I can only hope."
This is a simple brass key that smells faintly of sulphur.
This is the head of the very dead High Captain Baram of Luskan...
This ring is a simple golden band. On the inside is inscribed the name 'Erb' in small letters.
This is a simple steel key, without any special markings.
This is the head of the very dead High Captain Kurth of Luskan...
This object appears to be some manner of lever or handle, oddly sculpted and made of a bluish marble material.
This is a lever or handle that might belong to some larger device. The object is made of a light metal and painted to look like gold.
This piece of gnomish machinery might be useful as some sort of lever or handle, perhaps from a larger device.
Written Orders

This letter has been written quickly and is smeared with blood.
"We have taken Burkes mansion with considerable casualties. Burke seems to have been in contact with a being called Voleron within the Ruins of Illusk. There is talk of treasure. Find him, kill him, and bring back all that you find to fund the war effort.
"Signed High Captain Kurth"
By the smell and appearance, this bottle seems to be filled with... sewer water...
This infant human girl is less than a year old, swaddled in several small blankets. Currently she is sleeping blissfully and is unaware that a stranger is holding her... no doubt for the best.
This small, brass key is unremarkable except for the small carving on its surface of a warship... the symbol of the Arcane Brotherhood.
Blood War Research Journal

This thick volume is filled with numerous details on the planar experiments the Arcane Brotherhood has been performing, at the request of Archmage Arklem Greeth.
Most of the entries go into exhaustive detail. It seems the wizards have 'attuned' several portals to the abyssal and hellish planes, attempting to research the eternal Blood War being carried on by the demons and devils.
No conclusion seems to have been drawn, but it is pointed out in several places that one curious property of the portals is that their attunement is easily disrupted by material of the opposing planes. One wizard warns that trying to actually send material from one plane through the wrong portal could be highly destructive.
This small rod pulses with an unknown magical energy. Engraved on one side is a small picture of what appears to be a Helmed Horror.
Journal of Arteno Geth

This is the journal of a minor wizard in the Arcane Brotherhood, Arteno Geth. His notes are sporadic and personal, detailing his dislike of certain tutors, his tribulations in learning certain magics, and his suspicions over Maugrim.
His most recent entry is the one of greatest relevence:
"I should never have joined Rimardo. The Archmage disappeared almost as soon as Maugrim began his campaign in the tower... meaning we were left to fend for ourselves. None of us thought that the man's influence was spread so deeply. Yet it was. After all the fighting was done, I found myself on the losing side. So now I must slave away with Rimardo on these bloody golems.
"Today I finished work on the replication rod, though I surely shall receive no congratulations for it. When it is placed together with the control rod in the replication chamber, the magics start an automatic creation cycle... a golem is formed in a fraction of the time it would once have taken. It is powerful, as well... I've told Rimardo several times that we should be careful to retain control over these golems, lest they break through the magical barrier around the inner sanctum, here.
"He doesn't heed my warnings, naturally. Bah! I would do anything not to have to slave away for that fool Maugrim anymore!"
Golem Replication Rod
This small rod pulses with an unknown magical energy. Engraved on one side is a small picture of what appears to be a Helmed Horror rising out of some kind of circle or hole.
Master Portal Stone
This small magical stone pulses with a faint glow and is etched with the letter X in arcane writing.
Golem Slayer
This eyeball belonged to a small demon from the Abyss, before it was destroyed. Why it remained intact when the rest of the body was turned to dust is unknown.
Letter to Aribeth

This letter is written in a delicate hand:
"My dear Lady Aribeth,
"Master Maugrim has told me that I must inform you on how to move about the Host Tower for when you come.
"I do not know if you are aware, but much of the Host Tower is not connected in the normal fashion. We use a teleporter to move about from area to area... when you are in the ambassador's area, you can find the first teleporter in the far chamber.
"You only need touch the portal and express your desired location, and it shall open the way for you. The second level anyone may reach, but beyond that you must have a runestone which allows your access (for security, of course).
"The portals, once open, remain so for a mere half-minute, my Lady. Hurry on through once has been opened. Enclosed with this letter is a runestone that will allow you to reach master Maugrim's private sanctum. He awaits your arrival eagerly.
"Your servant, Apprentice Pim."
This eyeball belonged to a small devil from the plane of Baatezu, before it was destroyed. Why it remained intact when the rest of the body was turned to dust is unknown.

The Search for the Cult: Solomon's Gift

Jax, an archeologist with an interest in the earliest races of Faerun, believes he is close to being able to prove his thesis and receive the necessary grant funding to continue his research. Convinced that ancient ruins lurk beneath the troll caves along the road east of Port Llast, he has enlisted the aid of adventurers to discover them and return to him with proof that the ruins were a product of the so-called "creator races."
The archeologist's first suspicions appear to have had a grain of truth as evidence found in the troll caves point to there being something even the trolls are frightened of below.

Druids of Aawill's conclave in the Neverwinter Wood all tell of Jaer, the druid responsible for determining the heirarchy within the conclave. Any new druids wishing to join the conclave should speak with him.

Jaer, the druid responsible for determining the heirarchy of Aawill's conclave in the Neverwinter Wood, does so through a process of ritual combat. Druids wishing to join the conclave or improve their rank within it must speak with him. When he deems a fellow druid to be sufficiently skilled to challenge his or her superior within the conclave, Jaer initiates the ritual of the Druid's Circle. Whoever emerges victorious is issued membership of the appropriate rank.

Hand over 50 gold or I'll have you demoted!
What is this, a joke? You can't be serious - I'm just a soldier! You've probably got fifty times the amount of gold I've got.
Besides, I'm saving my wages so I can send them back to Neverwinter to my dear old ma. She's getting on in years and I want to look after her.
No problem - it's like it never happened. So you going up to Beorunna's Well now? It's worth a look, even with those Uthgardt milling about.
Just... just hold on a minute. Here's your gold - I can't afford to get demoted! Not with ma counting on me to support her.
Some hero you are! You're nothing but a bully!
Besides, someone already came by and threatened to demote me if I didn't give them all my gold. I'm flat broke.
Looks like you'll have to find someone else to extort; this sheep's already been fleeced!
Now what do you want? I already gave you your gold - I can't afford anything else.
Just go away and leave me alone.
Me need healing.
I need healing.
Who you be?
Who are you?
Me not understand 'bout Stone of Recall and teleport portal.
Teleportation portal? Stone of Recall? I don't understand.
That be big power magic!
That's some pretty powerful magic!
That's handy.
Me need you go over that one more time.
Can you explain that again?
Goodbye.
Me need to return to mission. Me need to go back to place where me died.
I need to return to my mission. I must get back to where I just was.
Send me back.
What you mean? Why me not want go back?
What do you mean? Why wouldn't I want to go back?
Me need prepare stuff before me continue mission. Goodbye.
I need to prepare before I resume my mission. I'll see you later.
Teleport portal? Recall Stone? What you be talking about?
Teleportation portal? Stone of Recall? What are you talking about?
That's handy.
Me want go back to spot where me almost die! Me want go right now!
I want to go back to the place where I nearly died, and I want to go now!
Me change my mind. Goodbye.
I've changed my mind. I'll see you later.
Yes. Me want to go back now.
Yes. Transport me there now.
How me get here?
How did I get here?
Me no want Recall spell! Me want to control me own fate! Cancel spell now!
Me not feel hurt at all. How me get healed?
I don't want some stinking Word of Recall spell whisking me anywhere. Cancel the spell, right now!
Me not like that! But me accept it. Can you get me back to where me just was?
Fine then! I still need to get back to where I was. Can you help with that?
I don't feel hurt at all. How was I healed?
When you cast Recall spell on me?
Ummm...when did you cast this Word of Recall spell on me?
Who you be?
Who are you?
Greetings, <FirstName>. Aarin Gend has instructed me to provide whatever assistance I can to you in your mission to recover the Words of Power.
However my magic is not of a healing nature. My skills are tied to the teleportation portal in this temple and the Stone of Recall in your backpack. Is there something I can do for you, <FirstName>?
You should speak to Neurik in that case. My abilities are tied strictly to the Stone of Recall and the teleportation portal. Is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
I am Sergol, a priest of Tyr. It is my duty to aid and assist those in the service of Neverwinter, though I am no healer.
My magic is tied to the Stone of Recall in your backpack and the teleportation portal you see in this room. Now, is there something else you need of me?
I thought you would be familiar with this by now. However, it is important so I will go over the use of the Stone of Recall again.
In your backpack you carry a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly teleport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
This will allow you to quickly return to town whenever you need to, saving precious travelling time.
There is more, <FirstName>. Once you have used the stone, go through the teleportation portal and it will instantly send you back to the place your stone was last activated.
Anyone in your service - henchmen, familiars and the like - will also be transported with you. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
You're lucky to be alive. We barely managed to bring you back; your soul had nearly departed to the afterlife.
Farewell, <FirstName>. May the grace of Tyr be with you.
I can help you return to the site of your last battle, but are you sure you want to go back so soon?
Whatever you were fighting will still be there. It would be wiser to find a way to avoid this confrontation, or at least to arm yourself better with supplies from some of the shops in the camp.
Or perhaps you should use the teleportation portal to return to the spot where you last activated your Stone of Recall.
I thought you would be familiar with this by now. However, it is important so I will go over the use of the Stone of Recall again.
In your backpack you carry a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly teleport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
This will allow you to return quickly to town whenever you need to, saving precious traveling time.
There is more, <FirstName>. Once you have used the stone, go through the teleportation portal and it will instantly send you back to the place your stone was last activated.
Anyone in your service - henchmen, familiars and the like - will also be transported with you. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
As you wish. I can use my magic to return you to the site you just came from. This will return you to your last battle. Are you ready?
As you wish. Prepare yourself, <FirstName>.
Hmmm. I thought you would have been familiar with this process by now. Very well, I shall explain it to you myself.
You are one of Aarin Gend's most important agents. After all you have done for Neverwinter he wants me to keep watch over you personally.
Before your mission started I cast a Word of Recall spell upon you, so that whenever you become mortally wounded I can immediately teleport you here to safety.
Just now, some enemy must have struck you a near fatal blow, and so the spell's contingency magics activated and whisked you away to safety.
I can't do that, <FirstName>. You are too important. Neverwinter has need of your skills if we're ever to find the Words of Power. We can't risk an untimely demise.
As soon as your battered body appeared, the other clerics here called upon the healing power of Tyr to bring you back from the brink of death.
You are now as ready as you'll ever be to continue with your mission. The Recall spell will activate again if you are dealt another fatal blow.
The spell doesn't require your presence. I simply needed to know your full name, which Aarin Gend provided.
I am Sergol, a priest of Tyr. It is my duty to aid and assist those in the service of Neverwinter.
Ah. You have awakened. I need to speak with you.
We are very disappointed in you, <FirstName>. Your slaughter of innocent people has caused much suffering in a time already overburdened with tragedy.
Were it up to me you would have been left to rot in your grave; however, Aarin Gend has ordered me to resurrect you. Despite your actions, Neverwinter still has need of you.
You will suffer no further consequences for your mad killing spree, but I implore you not to engage in such wholesale slaughter again. Please, focus on the mission you have been given.
I could surely use him now. Many of the surrounding farms have come under attack from the Uthgardt raiders. Most of our neighbors have fled, but I dare not risk such a journey with my new born baby.
Take whatever you want and go - just don't hurt me or my baby.
I will carry my baby daughter and follow you to the safety of Fort Ilkard. Please don't abandon us - I cannot travel as quickly as you.
I already told you, we have nothing worth stealing. I'm just a poor farm wife.
Search the house and take whatever you want, then please... just go. All I ask is you don't hurt my baby.
Me got to go now.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> You room and board cost gone up. You got to give me 50 gold for pay for it.
Me want ask you stuff.
Me on secret mission. Me can't talk 'bout it.
Gend got me looking for Power Words.
I have to go now.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Room and board costs for all the soldiers have gone up. I'm here to collect 50 gold pieces from you.
It no joke. You give me 50 gold or me gonna get you demoted!
No joke. Give me 50 gold or I'll get you demoted. I can do it, you know.
Okay, me give you a break. You not have to give me gold.
Okay, I'll give you a break. You don't have to contribute.
Everyone got do their part or Luskan is gonna win the war. Then what happen to your family?
Hey, everybody's got to do their part or Luskan will defeat us. Then what would happen to your family?
I want to ask you some questions.
What you think about them Uggarts that help you 'gainst Luskan?
You know anything 'bout the places 'round here.
Me need buy stuff.
What do you think of our Uthgardt allies?
Do you know anything about the surrounding area?
Where can I buy some equipment?
I can't talk about the mission I'm on.
Aarin Gend has me searching for the Words of Power.
Hey there, <FullName>. Glad to see you're still on our side. We don't need somebody else pulling a stunt like Aribeth did, right?
So, what are you doing here? I thought Aarin Gend would have had you busy trying to save us all yet again.

Yusam the druid is telling everyone that we don't have to worry about the Uthgardt Elk tribe anymore. That's a relief, <FirstName> - the Luskan army is big enough without the barbarians joining their cause!
Hey there, <FirstName>. Good to see you again. You know, everyone's talking about how Fort Ilkard nearly fell to those Elk tribe barbarians!
It's a good thing the siege failed. We can't afford to lose Fort Ilkard if we want to win this war against Luskan!
Hey, I know you. You're <FullName>, right? The savior of Neverwinter and all that.
So you here to help us out with this battle against Luskan? Or does Aarin Gend have you on some secret mission?
Oh, sure... I understand. You're a big hero and I'm just a lowly soldier. You've probably got a lot of other things on your mind. Maybe I'll see you around later.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> What? But that isn't... oh, wait a minute. Ha-ha. You almost got me there. I was really worried for a second.
I've got a family to support back in Neverwinter and fifty gold would clean me out. I didn't know you were such a joker, <FirstName>.
What!!?? You... you wouldn't! You couldn't! This isn't... I don't believe this!
Fine - here's your stupid gold. First Aribeth betrays us and now you do this. They just don't make heroes like they used to.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> 50 gold? But... but I can't afford that! I've got a family to support back in Neverwinter!
Thanks, <FirstName>. You're a good <man/woman>, to take pity on a poor soldier like me. So, is there anything else I can do for you?
Fine - here's the gold. But this isn't fair! We can't leave or we'll get hung for desertion. They can't just suddenly start charging us for room and board when we're not allowed to leave!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hey, somebody already came by and collected this extra charge from me. I'm not going to pay this fee twice.
You can go check with my commanding officer if you don't believe me. So, is there anything else I can do for you?
Questions? I doubt I can tell you anything you don't already know. But ask away and I'll do my best.
I guess we need all the help we can get, but I'm glad those barbarians stay up there on the plateau. I don't want a bunch of bloodthirsty savages wandering around down here.
Sorry, I grew up in Neverwinter. I don't know much about the lands outside the city. Anything else I can do for you?
Well, pretty much everything you need can be found out in the camp. Just wander around a bit and you'll find all sorts of places selling equipment. Anything else I can do for you?
Secret mission, eh? Sounds dangerous. I guess that's why you're a hero and I'm just a soldier. So... anything you need from me?
Words of Power? I've never heard of anything like that. Must be some sort of secret weapon we can use against the Luskan army, right?
But you probably can't talk about that to a raw recruit like me. So... is there anything else I can do for you?
I already gave you all my gold, so leave me alone.
Hey, no hard feelings. Bartender - a drink for my friend Lodar, please. I'm buying.
Me need 'nother copy of book.
Can I get another copy of the notebook?
Ah, <FirstName> - I see you are back. But... where is your trial notebook? You agreed to defend Rolgan; without that book no one will recognize you as an officer of the court!
Please, <FirstName>, I know you have much on your mind. But if you are to participate in Rolgan's trial you must keep that notebook with you at all times.
In the meantime, is there anything else I can do for you before Rolgan's trial, <FirstName>?
Of course, <FirstName>. Here is another copy of the notebook. Remember, you must keep it on at all times as a symbol ofTyr's authority.
Without it, no one will recognize you as an officer of the court. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
Neurik at the Temple of Tyr can explain it better than I - I do not understand the ways of your justice system.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Bad news. You wages got cut. You gotta give back 50 gold.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Bad news. Wages have been cut. You have to give back 50 gold from your salary.
Give me you gold or me rip you sore leg right off!
Hand over your gold or I'll rip that injured leg right off!
You all hurt, you keep gold.
Tell you what, since you're injured I'll let you keep your wages.
That not me problem. You give gold now.
Not my problem. Just hand over the gold.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You expect me to believe a story like that? Give me a break.
I have a leg wound, not a head injury. Go sell your story somewhere else. I have to rest up for this trial.
And anyway, you're too late. Someone else already came and took the last of my gold. I don't have a single coin left, so you might as well move on.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> 50 gold? This is outrageous! That's half a month's wages! How do they expect me to survive?
I've got a bad leg. I'm on disability leave right now. They can't expect an injured soldier to hand over that kind of gold, can they?
Well, that's something at least. Now maybe I can get some peace - my leg is killing me and I have to rest up for that trial.
Fine - here's your damn gold. I don't think this is fair, though. And I'm getting mighty sick of being taken advantage of!
I guess it doesn't matter, though. Somebody already came by and took the last of my gold. You'll just have to tell them to dock my wages.
Now maybe I can get some peace and quiet. My leg is killing me and I have to rest up for this trial.
You again? I already gave you 50 gold - that's all I got!
So shove off and leave me alone.
Three squares a day and steady wages - being a soldier ain't so bad. Unless I get killed, of course.
I heard Fort Ilkard is under siege from the Uthgardt Elk tribe! I wonder if they'll ship me up there to help defend the fort?
Thank the gods the siege at Fort Ilkard's over, or I might have been shipped to the front to help defend the fort!
Rolkid's a hell of a general! With his battle plan and heroes like you on our side we'll drive those Luskan dogs back!
Them Uthgardt are a bunch of savages! One of 'em killed Griff, you know!
Seen that Uthgardt's body on the spike out by the Temple? That should keep them savages in line!
I don't trust those Uthgardt - but I guess we need their help in the war against Luskan.
This war is my big chance! If I do something heroic, I'll be famous - maybe even as famous as you, <FirstName>!
Check out this armor Rolkid gave me. I can't wait to test it out in battle!
You heard the news? We don't have to worry about the Elk tribe fighting against us anymore. At least, that's what that druid up on the plateau is telling everyone.
Rolkid's done a great job training me for battle! I wonder when they'll ship me up to the front?
Hey, you're <FullName> - the hero of Neverwinter! I'd buy you a drink if they weren't so expensive in this dive!
Word around the camp is that Fort Ilkard is under siege by one of them renegade barbarian tribes. I reckon they'll send some of us up there to join the fighting soon enough.
Heard the news? Fort Ilkard isn't under siege anymore! They were just about to send me up to join the fighting, too. I think I'll have a drink to celebrate my good fortune!
There's nothing to do in this camp but drink and wait for our orders to head up to the front.
I heard one of the Black Lion warriors was executed for murder. I sure hope the Uthgardt don't turn us because of that.
Can you believe the price of ale in this place? It's a crime!
What are you doing here, <FullName>? I thought a big hero like you wouldn't waste <his/her> time in a crowded dive like this.
I don't know which is worse - the Luskan invaders, or those bloodthirsty Uthgardt savages we're forced to fight alongside.
Heard the good news? Yusam the druid is telling everyone we don't have to worry about those Elk tribe barbarians anymore!
I heard the war isn't going well. Seems the Uthgardt Elk tribe have joined the Luskan army. I wonder when they're going to call my unit up to the front as reinforcements?
This tavern ain't much, but at least we got somewhere to come and unwind after a hard day of drills.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Me come to say you need pay war tax if you want stay friends with Neverwinter guys.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> I've come to tell you that as our ally you have to pay a war tax to the Lords' Alliance.
Give me 50 gold or me kill you and you tribe need new chief!
Hand over 50 gold or your tribe will have to find a new chieftain, old man!
Me not mean for insult you honor. Nevermind.
I didn't mean to insult your honor. Just forget about it.
Me not care. Give me 50 gold or me make Neverwinter army wipe you out!
Not my problem. Give me 50 gold or the Lords' Alliance army will wipe you out!
Me want ask question 'bout Rolgan.
I want to ask you some questions about Rolgan.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> War tax? The Lords' Alliance made no mention of such a thing during any of our councils.
We have already given the lives of many of our warriors to this cause. Now you come here to try and deceive us in this matter? You insult my honor!
I suspect you are trying to fool us into giving you gold, but if so you are too late. Another of your kind has already taken what little gold my tribe had.
If you are not trying to deceive me, I apologize. In that case, you will have to simply tell the leaders of the Lords' Alliance that we have no more gold to give.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> We have given the wisdom of our council, the use of our sacred land and the lives of our finest warriors to the cause of the Lords' Alliance. You would think this would be more than enough.
Must you strip us of the little wealth we have collected as well? This is an insult to the honor of my tribe!
I thank you for seeing reason in this. These are difficult enough times without increasing tensions between my people and yours.
Here is your gold. But you have shamed yourself in the eyes of our tribe. Begone - I will speak with you no more!
However, you are not the first to demand this war tax; another of your kind has already collected it from me. I will not pay the tax twice. Return and tell this to your Lords' Alliance.
Once the Elk tribe stood with the enemy, but Yusam the druid has told me we no longer need to fear the children of the Elk. Never again shall their spears threaten the Lords' Alliance.
There is little I can tell you of Rolgan, save that he is falsely accused of murder. Rolgan's wife could tell you more of this.

Her name is Vanda - since Rolgan was seized she has spent all her time wandering on the sacred grounds of this plateau, praying for her husband. But I sense there was another reason you came to speak to me.
Your greed and lust for gold has shamed you in the eyes of our tribe. Begone - I will speak with you no more!
Yusam has told us the Elk tribes spears no longer fly against the Lords' Alliance. Perhaps this will ease the hatred of the soldiers in the camp toward us.
The Elk tribe no longer fight alongside the Luskan horde, yet the soldiers in the camp still eye us with suspicion.
There's a lot of soldiers here. You wouldn't be selling drinks to them while they're on duty, would you?
There be lots of soldiers in here. You not be selling them drinks when them is on duty, is you?
Give me 50 gold or I'll tell everyone you're serving soldiers on duty and run you out of business!
Sorry. Forget I even mentioned it.
Me sorry. You forget me ever say anything 'bout this, 'kay?
You gotta give 50 gold or me tell everyone you give drinks to soldiers on duty and they put you out of business!
What? No, I'd never sell a drink to a soldier on duty. They'd take my license if I did that - I'd be ruined!
Don't be going around spreading rumors like that now, my <lord/lady>, even in jest. We're talking about my livelihood, after all.
Of course, my good <man/woman>. It's as if it never happened. Now, can I get you a drink?
What? You mean... this is a shakedown? I thought I'd gotten away from this kind of extortion when I left Westgate! You're as bad as those damn Nightmasks!
Fine - here's your gold. But now that I've given my share, you've got to leave me alone! In fact, get out of here. You're not welcome in my bar!
Sorry, but you're too late. Somebody's already come by and put the squeeze on me here at Beorunna's well.
I've already paid my share to you shakedown artists and I can't afford anymore, no matter what you threaten me with. You can't get blood from a stone.
Sorry, but that's the hard truth of the matter. But maybe you want to drown your sorrows in a nice drink?
You again? Look, I've already paid you off once - I can't afford to give you another 50 gold! You can't get blood from a stone.
If I wanted to deal with these kind of constant shakedowns I would have stayed in Westgate and given my gold to the Nightmasks. So go on, you - get out of here.
Me looking for Power Words. You know where they be?
You wouldn't happen to know anything about some ancient artifacts known as the Words of Power, would you?
I'm just an enlisted man, they don't tell me anything. Maybe you should speak to Commander Damas about that - if that jerk will even talk to you.
But all he cares about is his little war with the Uthgardt. He doesn't give a damn about anything else - not even the men under his command!
Me look for Power Words. You know where they be?
You wouldn't know anything about some ancient artifacts know as the Words of Power, would you?
Oh, yeah - they're always telling us run of the mill soldiers about things like that. Hmph! Get serious. Commander Damas doesn't tell us anything.
You can ask him about those Words if you want, but I don't know if he'd be any help. He's nothing but a pompous, self absorbed jerk!
My farm is down in the fields to the west of Fort Ilkard. It shouldn't be hard to recognize my wife - I don't think there are too many other gnomes living as farmers in the area.
Me no care 'bout Elkies, but me want get gold from this somehow.
I don't care about the Elk tribe, but I want to profit from this somehow!
Me change mind. Elkies not deserve this. You give me plague cure right now!
I've changed my mind. The Elk tribe doesn't deseve this. Hand over that plague cure.
You give me gold and me not tell nobody 'bout you plan to make all Elkies sick.
You buy my silence and I won't tell anyone about your plan to infect the Elk tribe with the plague.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Make it 200.
Forget it.
Deal.
You know stuff 'bout Power Words?
Do you know anything about the Words of Power?
Me already go there.
I've already been there.
Ruins?
I see you have returned, my <Lord/Lady>. Is there something further I can do for you?
I admire a <man/woman> who would be willing to let the entire Elk tribe die from the plague in exchange for a simple payoff.
But just because you and I think alike doesn't mean I'm going to hand over my gold to you. Why would I want to do that?
Even if you tell people what I did, it's not going to change anything. I might get a reprimand from the higher ups, but there won't be any real consequences.

Still, a reprimand would mean a lot of paperwork I can do without. Tell you what - you give me those blankets and keep my little plan to exterminate the Elk tribe secret and I'll give you 100 gold pieces.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I think you underestimate how little I really care about this. I want to avoid some inconvenient questions about my activities, but I'm not going to give away a fortune to do it.
If you don't want my gold you can keep those blankets. I really don't care. So I'll give you one last chance to accept my offer. Do you want the 100 gold pieces?
If that's the way you want to be, fine. Keep the blankets.
A pleasure doing business with you, <sir/madam>. I'll make sure these blankets are burnt and nobody will ever have to worry about them again.
Now is there anything else I can do for you? If not I should really get back to my work. This fort doesn't run itself, you know.
Ah, you must be one of Aarin Gend's agents. Got you traipsing all over the countryside searching out these mysterious lost artifacts, doesn't he?
Sounds like a fool's errand to me. This war will be won with soldiers, not these so called Words of Power.
However, I wouldn't want anyone to think I'm being uncooperative with one of Aarin's agents. Have you searched those old ruins to the south? That's your best bet.
Really? Well, then I guess I can't be much help to you then. Those old ruins way to the south are the only place I know of that might have some kind of ancient magic.
So, I guess you'll be going now and letting me get back to commanding this fort.
There's some deserted ruins in the land to the south of this fort. One of my scouting parties was down there and they came across some strange columns of magical light.

Nearby they found a glowing cave entrance, and inside were some ancient ruins. Nobody seems to know who built them, but according to my scouts they didn't look like dwarven, elven or human architecture.

Like I said, I think these Words of Power are a waste of time. But if you're determined to search them out I'd suggest you head south until you see those pillars of light. The glowing cave entrance should be just east of there.
Enough yapping. It's time for you to die.
Enough talk. Me just gonna kill you now.
How dare you speak to me like that! I'll scratch your eyes out!
Me think it be fun if me just kill you now.
I think it might be fun to slaughter you like a hog.
What? No - I won't die without a fight!
Me got some questions.

If you had a time crystal you would just use the special property of the time crystal and target the effect on the sun dial to be sucked back into the past. To come back, just use the crystal again on the sun dial and you'll be transported back to the present age.
Of course, <FirstName>. What do you wish to know?
You won't get very far if you don't know how to use the sun dials.
Guess what - this isn't a rescue. I'm just here to kill you!
Me got surprise for you. This not be rescue. Me gonna kill you now.
A warrior of the Golden Eagle will not die without a fight!
I think I feel like killing you now.
Me think me want to kill you now.
Then you shall feel the wrath of the Golden Eagle!
Great - another gold grabbing mercenary here to bleed Gend's coffers dry.
Out of my way! I'm shipping to the Luskan front tomorrow, I don't have time for the likes of you.
First Aribeth betrays us, then we have to ally ourselves with the likes of you. Grim times.
I know we need all the help we can get, but I don't trust them Uthgardt up on the plateau.
I can't believe Aribeth betrayed us!
I can't talk right now. I've got to get my stuff ready - I'm shipping out to the front tomorrow.
I'm sorry, I can't talk right now. I've got to get my stuff ready - I'm shipping out to the front tomorrow.
You look like you're a cut above the usual rabble serving the Lords' Alliance. Good to have someone competent on board!
You must be one of those mercenaries Gend has hired to search for the Words of Power. I wish you luck.
(sigh) I'd take you back to my bunk, handsome, but I don't think my seargent would let me keep you.
You look like a take charge kind of guy. You here to search for those Words of Power I heard about?
My, my. Hello there, handsome. You come to save us from the big, bad Luskan army?
You're a sight for a soldier's sore eyes, miss. Most of them other female mercenaries ain't got much going in the way of looks.
Nothing like a pretty lady to remind us soldiers what we're fighting for before we ship off to the front.
Hello there, miss. What's a pretty gal like you doing in this stinkhole of a camp?
I'm glad you're standing with us against Luskan, <race>. We need all the help we can get.
Another <race> mercenary in camp? Gend must be paying you guys a fortune.
Another <race> type wandering about? You'd think after what Aribeth did they'd be more careful with relying on you non-humans.
A word of warning to a fellow <race> - since Aribeth's betrayal people around here ain't too fond of us non-humans.
Good to see another <race> face around here. We've got to stick together if we want to beat those Luskan dogs!
I didn't expect to see another <race> in these parts. You here to look for them Words of Power.
This place is crawling with barbarians and Uthgardt. You're probably a pagan savage, too, ain't you?
Shouldn't you be up on the plateau with the Uthgardt? We don't much like barbarians here in the camp.
Geez, another barbarian in our camp. As if those Uthgardt savages aren't bad enough.
You gonna use your crystal ball to find those Words of Power for Aarin Gend? Hah!
You spell casters ain't too popular among the soldiers' barracks. They ain't forgot that Luskan is run by mages!
Keep your distance. If we can't even trust a paladin like Aribeth, how can we trust you spellcaster types?
You're a holy <man/woman>, aren't you? I'm shipping to the Luskan front tomorrow - say a prayer for me.
I know the paladin Aribeth betrayed us all, but I still have faith in you holy types.
Good to see some holy folk around here. You gonna do something about them pagan Uthgardts on the plateau?
