Hmm... I recognize you. You are one of the new recruits under Aribeth, are you not? I'm sorry, but this is the spellcasters' guild. It will not interest you.
Hello, again. Are you back to continue on with our next round of challenges? Or did you have something else in mind?
Well, hello. I had heard there was a new magic adept in service to the city. The guild of the Many-Starred Cloak welcomes you.

Welcome to this rather temporary branch of the guild of the Many Starred Cloak. Rest assured that even here your membership cloak will grant you all the priveliges you have come to expect from our guild.

Welcome to this rather temporary branch of the guild of the Many Starred Cloak. Normally the arcane knowledge of our guild is restricted to members, but Aarin Gend has asked me to forego that formality under these circumstances.
Greetings. Normally I don't deal with those who have no experience in the arcane arts, but Aarin Gend has asked me to make my inventory available to everyone if it will help the war effort.
I, Andar Heartfood of the Red Tiger tribe, greet you. Your name is well known among us, for it was you who stood forth to defend Rolgan at his trial. You bring honor to yourself and your ancestors.
You are not welcome among this tribe. You promised to defend Rolgan, yet he is dead. You have broken your vow, you have dishonored yourself and your ancestors!
You are a good person to defend Rolgan. I, Andar Heartfood of the Red Tiger tribe, greet you with honor.
Hail and well met. I will need to see your pass, if you would be so kind.
I wish ye good luck. Hopefully ye finds what ye're searching for.
Leave me be. We have nothing to talk about.
Eh? I suppose you're here to sign up, are ye? I've no time for a new apprentice, however, so off ye go.
Aye? Something I can do for ye? Has ye business with the guild?
Tis good to see ye again. Have ye had any luck tracking down the bounties?
Hmm... do I know you? You wear the uniform, but I don't recognize your face. How long you been a Bloodsailor?
Greetings. Ye're one o' the heroes Lady Aribeth brought here along with that other one I talked to, aye? Have ye had any luck with the bounties?
You're with that other one, aren't you? I tell you, that was one tough nut. Damndest thing I ever saw. Right, Christov?
You have heard my sorry tale, is that not enough?
Please forgive me, but I am in no mood to speak. I am sure others here will accomodate you.
I beg you to leave me be. I have nothing to say and nothing left to steal, I assure you.
Please leave me alone. I do not wish to speak and I have nothing left to steal, I assure you.
Welcome back. It's my pleasure, as always, to welcome you to Tyr's temple, now that things are as they belong in Port Llast.
Greetings - once more I must thank you for planting the Ultarg seed trees for me. Or is this the first time I am thanking you? No matter - I am grateful in any case.
How... how do things progress? Is Alhelor - the Black Wolf - dead? I don't think a single soul within Port Llast has stopped to take breath.
Back again, <FirstName>? You need to buy some equipment, or is there something else I can do for you?
Well, if it isn't Too Damn Stuck Up To Give Me Their Name! What do you need this time?
Hello there. Is there something the matter? Did you have something to ask of me?
Word has come to us that you have found the knight, Sir Karathis. Tell me, how did this meeting go? What have you learned?
As for you... you did your part. You freed me, and the reward is yours by right. Take this item and go.
I will not be questioned any further. I am sure you know more than enough... now destroy the brazier before I grow impatient.
Port Llast is seeing its mysteries resolved - the werewolf forms of Urth, Bran, and Geth are no longer. But still - there's no news on Karathis or the Black Wolf. Is there anything you know?
Mmmm... a rather delicious looking <race> man, is it? What a treat. Please don't tell me you're one of the fools toadying after Maugrim.
Greetings to you. I was just getting packed up in the hopes of leaving soon. How may I assist you?
You've returned! You have been more successful, already, than we have right to hope for, but hope we do. Now, what word do you bring?
Back again, <FullName>? Is there something I can do for you?
I have not forgotten how you threatened me! I have told no one, but you shall receive no services from me!
Greetings, I am Master Ford, head archeologist of Neverwinter. Lord Nasher mentioned someone might be coming to investigate the Source Stone.
How do you do? Have you had any luck acquiring the gems? Or is there something else you need?
You are an evil person and you are not welcome here! Get out of my sight!
Greetings, to you. It is rare we see new faces come to drink with us at the Alliance Inn.
You were called upon to do your duty in administering the justice of Tyr's Court. The church is grateful you answered the call.
Ahh, you must be with that other person. Will you need me to repeat what they asked me about?
It's about time you showed up, recruit! My name is Herban - but as far as your worthless hide is concerned you can just call me Sir!
Oh! Greetings. It's me, Neurik. Remember? I was serving in Tyr's church in Port Llast until Aarin Gend asked me to come and oversee this temple here at Beorunna's Well.
Thank you. Thank you for bringing me back my little Leesa.
Greetings again. Nature welcomes you. I hope the day has held you in better health than those poor creatures in the Blacklake zoo.
Please, I beg of you, help my sister. Leesa's just a little girl.
Greetings. Are you with the person I spoke with previously? The fight against the zoo in the Blacklake could use whatever help is available. The animals suffer so.
I'm sorry, but I can't speak with you right now. I have to keep an eye on my little sister.
Greetings to you again. It is good to see you return to this house of Tyr.
You training here is complete. You should proceed to the south assembly hall to receive blessings and congratulations from Lady Aribeth.
Greetings. Are you with the one I spoke to previously? I am curious as to how the search for Halueth Never's tomb is going.
I hope there is nothing amiss. I see you have not completed the trials of faith. Would you like me to describe the tests once more?
You have returned. Are you prepared to face the trials of faith? By completing them your training here at the Academy will be at an end.
Hail! You have provided a great service to all of Neverwinter in these trying times.
Greetings once more. I am surprised to see you back, although you are always welcome. How may I be of aid to you?
Please try to keep this conversation short. There are more dead and dying here than I could cure in a lifetime...
Greetings and well met. I am Elynwyd, faithful servant of Tyr and devotional leader here at the Academy.
Ahhh, h-hello there.
Ah... Greetings to you. You are... with the other person I spoke to, yes?
Someone has had the Moonstone Mask shut sown. I would suggest you finish your business here and leave.
You training is done. You should go to the south assembly hall to receive a blessing and congratulations from Lady Aribeth.
Is something wrong? I see you haven't finished the Mage's Challenge. Do you need me to go over it one more time?
Greetings to you again. Have you come to sample the delights of our company in the backroom, or is this about... business?
Well, have you decided to take the Mage's Challenge? It's the final step in your training here at the Academy, after all.
Greetings. Are you with... What was the name...? They were the only other new person I've spent much time with lately. Is this visit for pleasure or business?
Hey there, welcome to my little corner of the Academy. I'm Jaroo, resident Master of the Arcane. It's more a ceremonial title than anything else. I'm really just your run of the mill wizard.
Ah, I didn't expect you to come back. What can I do for you?

My, oh my! I can't remember the last time I saw another one like me in these parts! So good to meet you! Come, now... I haven't my full selection available, but what wares I have will still dazzle you!
These are strange times. The beds in the Moonstone Mask being filled by wounded soldiers - who could have imagined?
Ah... er, hello there! Most of my finer items have already been stolen, but you're certainly welcome to try your hand at stealing what remains! That is... if you're here to steal at all.
Your face is a frightful mess! Those Luskanites really did a number on... Oh! I'm so sorry, I thought you were one of the wounded.
Hello there. Come to get yourself some supplies from old Olger, have you? Good idea - can't have you wandering about the streets naked. Might give the Academy a bad name.
Welcome back. So what can old Olger do for you? You want to take a peek inside my shop, or is there something else?
Home! This town means everything to me! Thank you for saving me, <FirstName>. I will never do anything so foolish again!
What are you doing back here? You're done, it's over, you made it! You better get down to the south assembly hall if you want to get that blessing from Lady Aribeth.
I'm on the prowl. Stay out of the way.
I see you've got the key on you. Well done! Let me be the first to congratulate you. Your work here at the Academy is all but done.
Back again? So, you ready to test your mettle against one of my challenges? If you can pull off this job you're finally free, and your sentence here at the Academy will be at an end.
Keep your hands where they belong.
Is there a problem? You having a little trouble with the challenge? You want me to go over it one more time?
I, Zokan Thunderer, thank you for saving my people from the Wailing Death. You are a hero to us.
Back again? Not sure what you need. You're no rogue, so there's not much I can teach you in that department. So what do you need?
Hi there. My name's Ketta - head of Security, Espionage and Intrigue here at the Academy. No need to tell me who you are - my sources are way ahead of you.
The plague that ravaged my people is no more. The people of the Elk Tribe owe our lives to the one who brought us the cure.
I bid you welcome once again.
I am Arwyl, leader of the dryads. I bid you welcome. Your kind is strange to us - we are used to seeing only the dwarves who attack us on sight.
I have prayed to the great oak for a savior! Are you to be it? Shall I be freed at last to rejoin my tree?
And I thank you. You are a true friend of the Uthgardt people, and the Red Tiger Tribe speaks your name with reverence.
Oh, please let this servant of the oak be free at last! Are you kind, or but another captor come to torment me?
You...have a fearsome countenance... have you come to free this servant of the oak? I beg you not to harm me!
You are a companion of the other one I spoke to, then? Yes, so it must be.
Oh, my! You don't strike me as the type to be one of Maugrim's followers. You're not, are you?
Welcome to my home. Is there something I can do for you?
Help! Attack! What? Who? Er... oh... um... you don't look like... nevermind.
Who are you? One of the city guard, I suppose. What do you say? Don't you think Meldanen should be forced to stop his hoarding and give up his stores?
Ah, yes...you are with that other person I spoke to, correct? I'm glad that more could join on this quest.
So you're back, are you? Have you changed your mind? Will you help me get the key and end Meldanen's life?
So you have returned. Do you have news?
Not bad. But since you are a different class type than I'm used to, you should be training elsewhere.
Once more you return to speak to me. I have given you the Word of Power - what more do you desire of Klauth?
Well, I was going to give you additional lessons on how to Level Up, but you have already managed just fion. I have nothing more I can teach you, <FirstName>.
Why do you come to speak to me? You are too late to gain the Word of Power - I have already given it to another in exchange for the eggs of another dragon.
Greetings once more. I see you have not yet leveled up. You must do this before you can pass through the south door.
As director of the Academy let me offer you congratulations on completing your training.
So at last you have come. I assume my fire giant servants are dead. No matter, they are of little consequence to me. I can find other servants. Perhaps even you will serve.
Please... spare my life! I shall give you whatever you like...
Hey, this is the Commander's quarters! I don't want you enlisted men trapsing through... oh, sorry. I thought you were one of my soldiers.
I really must file my report with Lord Nasher. Excuse me.
So you return.
Hey, there. You're one of the students here at the Academy, aren't you?
Back again? You want me to go over the tutorial on how to use your map and journal?
You are not one of my slaves. It is strange for me to see one who does not cower and flee in terror at my presence. I find your courage... intriguing.
Welcome back. I hope your search for my missing snow globe is going better than my search for a decent glass of wine in this place.
Yes? Are you ready to enter the dungeon?
You hads your chance, fool! Now Ebrax shows you what's what! We calls Elminster. Ebrax says you better start running now!
Well, you must be the one Aribeth has told me of. I must say that I appreciate what you have done.
Yes, it is best that we commence with the ritual. Ready yourself, the plague ends with this.
Farewell. Once again, I am grateful for your service to Neverwinter. There are very few who could have done what you did.
Hello there to you. My name is Ballard. I am looking for someone interested in a dangerous mission. Might you be interested?
Thank you, but that will be handled by Aribeth, Fenthick, and Desther. The details of it need not concern you.
Vengaul? Yes, I had reports of his activity in the Docks. We used to clash during my adventuring youth but... things have changed.
Well met. Have you had any progress? Have you found Neva yet?
I've had some association with the scoundrel, but this is not the time to discuss it. The plague is not his style. He would be disgusted by it.
Hello, are you with that other one I spoke to?
Greetings. I can spare a moment, but I don't have much to say. You should speak with everyone else so we can begin the ceremony.
You must bring Desther to justice. We must find him and demand his explanation! Fenthick's as well!
Neverwinter is a fair city, but tragedy like this can change much. The citizens will demand justice. They will want the head of their enemy on a pike.
What's this? I was expecting Aribeth, not some wet behind the ears whelp!
These are strange times. My city is in ruins and all but overrun by Luskan forces, and yet Aribeth, the leader of our enemy, sits in our dungeons awaiting my judgment.
Were things not so grim I might laught at the absurdity of it all. **sigh** What is it you need of me?
Well met. Have you had any progress? Have you found Neva yet?
I'm sorry, I assumed you would have heard the news by now. Aribeth has surrendered herself to us - she seeks atonement for her crimes against Neverwinter.
We meet again. As you know, I am Nasher Alagondar, Lord of Neverwinter. I was once an adventurer like you - though that was long ago.
Enough, Aarin. Now, if you want to speak to Haedraline you are free to do so. But I will not release her from the dungeon while an enemy is within our city gates.
After all you have done for the city, the least I can do is answer your questons, although Gend probably knows more than I do.
I'm sorry, but I won't do that. Not while there's an enemy inside the city. She might be an ally, but it's just as likely she's a spy.
Hello, are you with that other person I spoke to?
That is what I tell myself over and over, but the words are hollow to my own ears.
And so she shall have it, <FirstName> - but now is not the time. We are fighting a war, and Aribeth can give us much information about our enemy.
Hello there. I'd warn you to be careful of danger near these roads. You look like you can handle yourself but better safe than sorry. Listen to old Gerrol, then and watch out.
Rest assured, justice will be served when the time comes. Is that all?
Aribeth's crimes cannot simply be forgiven with a wave of the hand, and yet... there is truth in your words.
Hello there. You best be careful treadin' the road 'round these parts. A dangerous place, these days. Listen to old Gerrol.
I fear it is too late for that, <FirstName>. Fenthick is dead and Aribeth... Perhaps if I were given the chance to pass judgment again I would act differently. More mercifully.
Welcome again. I will always be grateful to you for your aid in the difficult matter of the Elk tribe.
I understand you have an interest in her fate, and I see you will not be satisfied until I answer your question.
I... I do not wish to discuss this anymore. Aribeth's fate is not ours to decide, and I have no time for philosophical debates. Is there more I can do for you?
Once I was an adventurer like you... Were the situation not so desperate I would call upon the court bards to sing you tales of my exploits.
I am Fenthick Moss, priest of Tyr and companion of the Lady Aribeth. You must be the student Aribeth told me about.
I miss those days of glory and heroism, but I gave them up to serve the city I love. Alas, my sacrifice was all in vain. Neverwinter will fall and I can do nothing about it.
You were quick to answer the summons. Allow me to be the first to welcome you to the Halls of Justice.
Of course, of course. But before you go... maybe Gend is right. Maybe you should go speak to this Haedraline creature.
Come and go as you please. You've earned that right. Perhaps if Neverwinter had more people like you things wouldn't look so bleak.
Greetings. I must congratulate you on capturing the first Waterdhavian creature.
You should quit wasting Gend's time. Go speak with Haedraline if you think the Word is any use.
You must be with that other person I talked to. Do you need a recap of what I told them, or have you something to report?
Have you heard? The first of the Waterdhavian creatures has been recovered by another recruit.
Spare me your sarcasm! **hiss** You are as big a fool as Maugrim!
Thanks to you we have now recovered two of the Waterdhavian creatures, and are halfway to a cure for the Wailing Death!
There is only one name that mattersss to me among your kind - Maugrim. **hiss** Tell me - do you serve Maugrim?
I have good news to report! The second Waterdhavian creature has been recovered by another recruit. We are halfway to a cure!
I see you speak the truth. This is good.
Your lies are known to me! **hiss** I sense that you seek Maugrim's defeat! This is good.
Well done. I heard you found the third of the creatures from Waterdeep. A cure is all but within our grasp now!
Foolish one! **hiss** You cannot slay a projection!
The fourth Word was recovered by another like yourself from Maugrim. **hiss** All four are necessary to enter the Source Stone.
Well met. Have you heard? The third Waterdhavian creature has been found. A cure is all but in our hand!
If this is your choice, then I can do nothing. But it is a foolish choice. **hiss** Speak to me again if you come to your senses.
Hello again, and well met as always. Is there something I may do for you?
**hiss** I have been waiting for you. These other warm bloods are weak. **hiss** I do not trust them.
You must hurry. **hiss** With each passing hour Morag's power grows. Soon I will not be strong enough to stop my Queen from awakening her people.
You must trust me. **hiss** If not, Morag will awaken the Old Ones and Neverwinter will be destroyed.
We hears you is wise for your kind, so accept offers of surrender from goblin, yes? You comes to talk with us, works out deal, maybe?
Your kind are ever curious. A curse of your warm blood, perhaps. **hiss** Our time grows short, but I will answer your questions.
Chief of goblin sees you. What you want now? You gots news for us?
The other warm bloods are weak in spirit and will - I do not trust them. **hiss** If you come to your senses, come and speak to me again. **hiss** Only you can stop Morag.
Most pleased to see you, we are. You make goblin king of caves, you have! We not fights no more with bugbears and orcs!
You have returned. You must listen to my words if Morag's rebirth is to be stopped.
You are back. **hiss** But I do not feel the presence of the final Word of Power.
I sense you have the Word of Power. **hiss** But you have come too late - Morag has grown too strong.
I am only a Word Slave, I can do nothing against the growing power of my Queen. **hiss** But where I have failed, you may yet succeed.
Fool! **hiss** Morag's return means slavery and torments for me beyond any you can imagine. This is no betrayal on my part.

Available to Clerics of the Death Domain. The cleric is able to summon a shadow that gains in power as the cleric advances in level.

Available to Clerics of the Trickery Domain. Bonus to Hide, Persuade, Search, Disable Trap, Move Silently, Open Lock, Pick Pockets, and Hide checks equal to the 1 per 2 levels. This effect lasts for 5 turns + the cleric's Charisma modifier.

Available to Clerics of the War Domain. The clerics gains a bonus of 1 + 1per 5 levels to Dexterity, Constitution, Attack Rolls and Damage. As well this bonus modifier is used to grant the cleric damage reduction in the amount of bonus / +5. The effect will last for 5 rounds + charisma modifer.
Available to Clerics of the Strength Domain. The cleric gains a bonus to Strength equal to 2 + 1 per 3 class levels. This effect has a duration of 5 turns + the cleric's Charisma modifier.

Available to Clerics of the Protection Domain. The cleric is able to cast an improved form of Sanctuary that sets the save DC at 10 + Chr Modifier + Clerical Level. The effect has a duration of 1 round per caster level + Charisma modifier.
Provides a temporary +5 bonus to Open Locks and +10 bonus to Search, Disable Trap, Move Silently, Pick Pockets, Set Trap, and Hide.

Provides a bonus of 2d4 +1 to the listed ability score. OnPlayerLevelUp
: Threat Roll: <CUSTOM0>
Please now, I already told you that I didn't mean to step on your cat, it ran right in front... oh, you're not that other one.
Hello! I had hoped that you would show up here, my friend. I heard that Aribeth recruited you to stamp out the evil cult that was responsible for the plague.
Greetings and well met. I know you, don't I? You saved the city of Neverwinter. I heard the tales of your deeds as they were sung by a bard. It's wonderful to meet you in person.
Hello again. I do hope you remember me. I'm Linu La'neral, cleric of Sehanine Moonblade.
My dear friend. It warms my heart to see your face again. Aarin Gend must have brought you here to help search for the Words of Power.
Hello there. The bards sing of your exploits in the taverns these days. It's a thrill to finally meet you.
I see we meet again. Would you be looking for a powerful healer? I would gladly join in the search for the Words of Power.

I can still feel my death, hanging on me, cold and eerie. I am glad to be back in this mortal realm again. Now that I know how it feels, I will struggle even harder to keep you from that fate. May I join you again?
Yes? Is there something you need?
So we meet again. The others had told me Aribeth had recruited you to find the cultists... I can't say I'm surprised. You've acquired quite the reputation for yourself, haven't you?
Well, well, well... you must be the one I've heard of, correct? The legendary savior of Neverwinter? I've heard a couple of ballads written about you, already.
Hello again. I trust you remember me, yes? The bard, Sharwyn?
Hah! Somehow I knew you couldn't be far. As soon as Aarin Gend mentioned why we were brought here, I began wondering when you would pop up.
Greetings. You're the hero, correct? I've heard much about you. Savior of Neverwinter, hero who routed the cult... all of that, if it's true. Is it true?
Hello again. Have you need of my skills? I'd rather not stand around this place any longer than I must.
Greetings. I see you are not yet infected by the plague that ravages Neverwinter. Among such suffering and misery, we who are not yet afflicted must be grateful for our health.
I see you have returned. What brings you back to the Trade of Blades?
It is a pleasure to see you again, though not altogether unexpected. I had heard that Aribeth recruited you to stamp out the foul cult that was responsible for the plague.
Greetings and well met. You are the one I heard of, aren't you? The one responsible for saving the city of Neverwinter. Your deeds have become something of a legend.
Greetings once more. It is I, Daelan Red Tiger, warrior of the Uthgardt Red Tiger tribe. Remember?
Greetings and well met. It is good to look upon you once more. No doubt Aarin Gend has brought you here to aid in the search for the Words of Power.
I bid you welcome. I have heard many tales of your exploits in Neverwinter and Luskan. You are truly a person of great honor.
I bid you welcome once more. Have you need of a skilled warrior? I am eager to join in the search for the Words of Power.
I found passing from this world unsettling - as was my return to life. Yet I sense there has been no permanent harm done. Do you need me to join you once more?

The Frozen North: the name given to the stark and unforgiving frontier that lies beyond the High Moor of Faerun... A bleak wilderness where barbarian clans and tribes of giants roam the land and fierce dragons rule the skies.
But amidst the frozen savagery stands a bastion of civilization: the city of Neverwinter, jewel of the North.

Behind the city’s high walls those both hardy and brave carve out an existence from this bleak land under the guidance and protection of the legendary hero Lord Nasher Alagondar... Yet there are some things that all the courage in the world cannot stand against.
A virulent plague swept the city, a terrible affliction that began in the Beggar’s Nest. Soon all of Neverwinter would feel the touch of the Wailing Death.
The disease could not be cured. Panic ensued; the streets erupted into violence. The Jewel of the North was brought to its knees.
To save Never Winter, Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande, Paladin of Tyr and Lord Nasher’s right hand, put forth a call for a champion.
A rush of would-be heroes answered her call: some drawn by promises of grandeur and glory, others by the lure of gold.

Why, hullo there! You have the smell of a prospective employer about you. Not that it's easy to smell anything with all the burning corpses in this city, mind you. Never seen this many flies outside of a Calimshite alehouse.
So you've come back! Looking for a short lad to tickle your feet? Or did ya change your mind about needing a rogue at your side?
Well, now, if it isn't you! Glad I am to see you! Isn't the country wonderful this time of year? So much better than the city with all that... umm... burning and dying. You know.

Those with the greatest potential were initiated into the Academy to train and study under the greatest minds of Neverwinter, all in the hopes a champion might emerge to save the city from the Wailing Death... and whatever sinister force might be behind it.

In one brutal attack the promise of those at the Academy had been all but snuffed out. Hope disappeared with the Waterdhavian creatures, and the weight of the terrible sickness pressed down on the city once more.
Even more chilling, the whispered rumors of enemies seeking to destroy Neverwinter from within had proved true, but the identity of those responsible for the slaughter was as yet unknown.
Still, a flicker of hope yet remained. From the bloody carnage at the Academy a survivor had stepped forward, a champion to carry the torch in this darkest hour...
Desther’s punishment was brutal, but his death brought little satisfaction. The horrors of the Wailing Death could not be undone with his execution. Those that had suffered now turned on each other.
They looked for someone to blame, and found it in Desther’s closest friend – Fenthick. The letter of the law found him negligent and he was hanged as a sacrifice to appease the bloodthirsty mob.
If any thought the sentence unjust, they remained silent. Duty required all to act as one-- it was not the time for divided loyalties. The cult behind Desther’s treachery still had to be found.

The hunt led to the city of Port Llast on the shore of the Sea of Swords. From this coastal town the heroes of Neverwinter would continue the search for those behind the Wailing Death... and vengeance would be taken.
The hunt led to the coastal town of Port Llast. From here the heroes of Neverwinter would continue the search for those behind the Wailing Death... and vengeance would be taken.
Within the Host Tower of the Arcane the enemy was finally revealed: Maugrim Korothir; madman, prophet, the one responsible for the Wailing Death. And with this revelation, a second betrayal...
Aribeth, driven mad by her lover’s execution, sought vengeance by joining Maugrim’s cause. Together they roused a fearsome army and prepared to descend upon Neverwinter.
But an even greater evil threatened the city: the Words of Power, remnants of ancient magic long forgotten, were being sought by Maugrim’s followers to bring devastation to the North.

Neverwinter’s champions were sent to the northern wastes of the Uthgardt tribes to unearth these lost artifacts. For if Maugrim were to find the Words of Power first, the city of the North would surely fall.

The Words of Power, the tools of a Creator race; Haedraline spoke of them as though they could shape worlds, and perhaps they had. With these in hand, victory would not be far behind... or so it was thought.
While Aarin Gend searched for the ancient relics, Maugrim’s army pressed their attacks against Neverwinter. Their dark magics and sheer numbers soon overwhelmed the defenders.
The betrayer -Aribeth- was at the forefront when the walls were breached. The Words of Power, once thought safe within Castle Never, were in danger of falling to the enemy.
And behind the invasion an even greater evil: Morag, Queen of the Old Ones had awoken.
In the end... victory. Without Morag, the Source Stone crumbled, and the great empire of the Old Ones was finally laid to rest.
The deaths of these ancients could be felt throughout Neverwinter. Deprived of Morag’s influence, the invading army faltered. The siege was soon turned.
The toll of the battle had been high, but Neverwinter would not be consumed by grief or regret. Too many had already made that mistake. The city would rebuild and move forward.
And what of the honored champion who had fought so hard while others fell? Their story does not end here. For this is a world of infinite tales...
New Adventures still await and new Legends are yet to be forged.
Hullo there! Wow... the savior of Neverwinter! Would you sign my napkin? It's a bit greasy... and mind the chicken...
Heya! Decided to wander back to Tomi Undergallows once again, did ya?
Nice to see ya again. That cheerful Gend fellow brought you here, too, huh? Looking for some Words of Power or sommat?
Heya. You're that champion, ain't ya? Mister Gend told me you're some kind of hero, the savior of Neverwinter or sommat.
Hullo again. Decided you gots need for a sneak-thief to accompany you now, huh?
It was so strange, ya know... there was this bright tunnel, and my mother was there... and then it was like 'yoink! Not yet, stupid!' and I was back here. Weird, huh? So do ya need my help again?
I figured they'd drag your carcass back here eventually. You need me to come with ya again?
You are back. The blood from those slaughtered at the Academy may be washed away, but I still recognize the mark of Death upon you.
Sound
Door
Store
We meet again. I taste a storm of slaughter on the air; I'm not surprised to find you here at the center of the whirlwind.
I know you. You are the one who emerged from the corpse clogged streets of Neverwinter to save the city from the horrors of the Wailing Death.
We meet again. It is I, Grimgnaw of the Order of the Long Death. Surely you must remember me.
The fires of war are burning on horizon. Why am I not surprised to see you here to forge your blood drenched legacy in the furnace of slaughter?
I know you. I know of your deeds. I know how many thousands of people hail you as a hero - and I know how many more have died screaming at your feet.
You have returned. Are you looking to join with a servant of the Long Death?
To be torn from the embrace of the Silent Lord is... unsettling. Yet my time to bow down before him for all eternity is not yet here. Do you need me to join you once more.
Is there something you need?
Hello there. You don't have the look of one of those Neverwinter soldiers about you, neither do you show any evidence of having contracted the plague.
You are back. That would lead me to conclude that you require some assistance from me. How can I be of service to you?
Good to see you again, though in actual fact I cannot say I am really surprised.
Greetings to you. Forgive me for being so bold, but you are the one being called the Champion of Neverwinter, aren't you?
Well met. It is I, Boddyknock Glinckle from the island of Lantan. I trust you remember me from our last meeting.
Hello, it is I, Boddyknock Glinckle. It is good to see a friendly face in these unfamiliar surroundings.
Greetings to you. Forgive me for being so bold, but you are the one being called the Champion of Neverwinter, aren't you?
You're back. Obviously there must be something you need. Dare I speculate and suggest you are seeking aid in recovering those Words of Power for Aarin Gend?
Yes? Is there something you need?
Thank the Gods you're here. I thought those goblins were going to be the death of me!
Okay then. You've had a chance to try all three camera modes now. You can choose between them by selecting "Controls" from the "Options" menu.
I saw you talking to my brother, Pavel. My name is Bim. If you want, I can give you a short tutorial on adventuring.
Hello again. I'm surprised you're still here - I thought you'd be anxious to go see Olgerd in the next room so you can finish your training.
I'm no hero. I just want a nice, quiet life. I doubt our paths will cross again anytime soon. Goodbye and good luck.

This fine powder appears to be a very fine, very light metallic dust. A creature touched by the dust becomes invisible. Dust of appearance reveals people made invisible by dust of disappearance. Other factors, such as sound and smell, also allow possible detection.
You are powerful, for a slave. You have slain Maugrim, the prophet who heralded my coming.
I see Morag was right - Aribeth was not strong enough to defeat you, but she has served her purpose.
This is a mistake, Fenthick. We know nothing about this whelp! How can you so blindly trust them?
I can spare no time for your idle chatter. I must coordinate the search of my Helmites as they try to recover the missing Waterdhavian creatures - thanks to Aribeth!
The results of her actions are plain for all to see, yet even now she would rather trust a whelp such as you than rely on my Helmites!
You should spend your time more productively. Instead of speaking with me you should be out looking for the missing Waterdhavian creatures.
I suspect my Helmite brethren will prove far more useful in this task than a mere hireling. But who am I to defy the desires of Lady Aribeth?
Well, hello. I imagine you are well pleased with yourself? This is your doing, after all.
Nasher will want me alive, fool. Speak to me so we may settle out business, and then you can deliver me to the old man like a good little servant.
(sigh) As you wish, my friend...though I'll not be held responsible should you nod off during the telling of it.
Let me see... perhaps it is best if I ask you a question, first. You are a person of nature and the wild, are you not?
I am not proud of what I did. It is very easy to say that the man deserved it. Deserved it more than my mother did, at the very least.
And thank you for listening. As I said, it is not a tale I tell often.
Let me see... perhaps it is best if I ask you a question, first. You are a person of your god, are you not?
Let me see...perhaps it is best if I ask you a question, first. You are a person possessed of wondrous magics, are you not?
Let me see... perhaps it is best if I ask you a question, first. You are a person of great fighting prowess, are you not?
Let me see... perhaps it is best if I ask you a question, first. You are a person of great skill, are you not?
No, I do not think so, my friend. You have far more important things to focus on other than I. Ask me another time, perhaps.
I am no longer in the mood for tales. It is enough for you to know that I came to serve Lord Nasher after that.
Randall was no true friend. He made use of me, and I had needed him. It was a choice I had to make, and it was no easy one.
I am not here to amuse you, nor are you here to amuse me. Ask me of something other than myself.
(sigh) I suppose one cannot leave the story unfinished. As you wish, then, my friend.
Thank you. I have...never told another that tale.
You do not have the proficiencies required to equip that item.
Perhaps in time we might get to know one another better. As...as good friends. Would you...would you care at all for that?
There are few that I would call friend. I would be pleased to name you amongst them.
No, I...have no desire to speak of her. It is no fault of yours. Perhaps another time.
You are too small to equip that item.
I appreciate your kindness. Perhaps another time I will be more willing to speak of it.
Do I seem uncomfortable to your eyes? I shall amend my stance, then, for I do not wish you to feel ill at ease.
Weapon equipped as a one-handed weapon.
Weapon equipped as a two-handed weapon.
Take this. It was given to me by my mother long ago, so that she knew I would always find my way out of the shadows. Take it and be reminded that there is one who prays for your safe return.
Then say nothing. Take it in the spirit with which it is meant.
Equipped item swapped out.
Now you make fun of me. So be it, I shall speak plainly.
Aye? What would you have of me?
I...would not normally speak of this, but I am told that you and the lady paladin have formed a bond of friendship.
I had full confidence in your ability to do so. Bring the information to Aribeth quickly...she will be eager to see it.
I shall await your return, then. Be safe, and godspeed.
So impatient to get on with business? You are obviously a in need of action and are courage. Only one such person is needed to change the world.
I must admit, I was glad when Lord Nasher informed me you would be coming on this mission as well. The thought of being apart from you was... unpleasant.
Neverwinter has need of me - and of you. We must all do our part if this latest threat to the city is to be thwarted.
Neverwinter has need of all her allies now - whether they serve for honor, duty or gold.
But Aribeth and the Luskan army are best left to the generals in the field. You have a much more important mission.
It has not been easy to gather information on Maugrim's cult - but we know they are frantically searching for the ancient artifacts known as the Words of Power.
You must find these ancient Words before Maugrim does. If you do not, then I fear any victory by the Lords' Alliance will prove meaningless.
I wish I had more guidance for you. Perhaps you can learn mroe from Lillian Cambridge, an expert on ancient artifacts who claims to have some knowledge of the Words of Power.
I know this may seem an impossible task, but I can think of no other person I would rather have undertaking this mission than you.
Good luck, and be careful. I would hate to lose you.
I wish you luck in your mission. The very survival of Neverwinter may depend on it.
Of course. I shall get right to the point.
It is a pleasure to see you again, as always. It is unfortunate we cannot spend more time together.
Is there anything I can do for you? Uh... to help you in your quest, I mean.
You are back. Have you something to report?
You are truly a remarkable woman, though I knew this already. On behalf of Lord Nasher and Neverwinter, please accept this reward of 3000 gold pieces.
Neverwinter could use more people like you. I am honored to offer you this reward of 3000 gold pieces in exchange for the Word of Power.
If my sources are correct, there are still several more Words of Power yet to be found. I hope your success at locating the Words continues.
This must be that Haedraline you mentioned. I will need to consider this new information carefully. But this is not your concern. You must focus on finding the Words.
I wish you luck in your mission. Return to me once you have another of the Words.
I thought I knew you. I see now you are not the woman I thought you were. Very well.
Your point is well taken - and you surely know I could never refuse a woman such as you.
I think I take the real meaning behind your words. The Lord's Alliance has given me an emergency fund to be spent in the defense of Neverwinter.
Times are difficult - I know this better than anyone. But the resources given me by the Lord's Alliance cannot be squandered recklessly.
No doubt you are here to aid us in our mission. I have already given out the information my reconnaisance operatives have acquired.
The city of Neverwinter is forever in your debt for recovering the first Word of Power. We hope you will have continued success on your mission to thwart Maugrim and his followers.
I... I'm sorry. I wanted you to have the amulet. It was special to me - as are you. But after I gave it to you, I didn't know what to do next.
And even my relationship with Calli began as part of my service to Neverwinter. You are different. I... I want to be with you.
I suppose you are right. I do not want to throw away what we share.
Promise me... promise me that we will be there for each other, no matter what happens. Promise me we will see this challenge through to the end.
If it were possible, I would go with you on your journeys. But my skills are in information and analyzing reconnaisance. I am needed here.
But even though I cannot go with you in your quest for the Words, know that whatever trials you face my spirit is by your side. Strref: 43096
I'm sorry, I had no right to make such a demand of you. I suppose all we can do is wait and see what fate will bring us.
You're right, I guess I am so used to being alone, to relying on myself, that I have forgotten how to ask for help.

The Lords' Alliance is grateful to those who provide a shining example in these dark times, and Neverwinter is generous to her champions. I have been authorized to grant a reward of 3500 gold pieces to you for this task.
You have done well. The Lords' Alliance and Neverwinter are grateful for your efforts, and on their behalf I would like to give you this reward of 3000 gold coins.
Despite my initial unfavorable impressions of you, you have proven yourself worthy of my respect. Allow me to express the gratitude of Neverwinter by giving you a reward of 2500 gold pieces.
How can I say no to one as beautiful and talented as you? And you do have a good point.
I suppose you have a point. If we expect you to succeed in recovering the remaining Words of Power it might be a good idea to equip you for the mission.
I wish I had something to spare, but the few magical items donated by the retired heroes of the Lords' Alliance are required in the defense of Neverwinter. I have nothing to spare, I'm sorry.
But I would wager my life on the fact that whatever they are up to will spell disaster for Neverwinter. We are counting on you to stop them.
The city itself still stands undaunted - for now. However, if you fail in your mission, I fear our cause will be lost.
Do not judge her too harshly. Love and hate are two sides of the same coin; both are emotions we have little control over.
I know what it is to have someone you can not bear to lose. If Lord Nasher had executed *you,* perhaps I would have fallen under the same madness as Aribeth.

The first Word of Power has been taken to the safety of Castle Never, thanks to the efforts of one of your fellow adventurers in the service of the Lord's Alliance. I hope this small victory is the first of many such successes.
Take this reward of 5000 gold coins - along with my thanks. And know that whatever awaits us, I am glad that we will face it together.
Whatever awaits us, I just want to tell you that I have been proud to serve at your side. I have 5000 gold pieces here - take it. You have truly earned it.
And there is more where that came from, if you accompany me to Neverwinter to aid in defending the city. The Lords' Alliance desperatly needs someone such as you.
All our weapons and armor have been sent to the battle fronts, unfortunately. The only thing I have left are these potions.
I wish I had something to give you, but all such items have been sent to the battle fronts to aid in the war effort.
You have done well. Take this reward of 4500 gold coins. You have earned it.
I will admit that I never had much faith in you. But you have proved me wrong. Take these 4000 gold pieces as a reward. You have earned it.
Have you heard the bards practicing their snippets of song about the legend of how our champion recovered the second Word of Power? I only hope we all live long enough to hear the finished product.
As a spy master I normally pride myself on keeping my feelings well hidden. Do you know me so well you can already see through my emotionless facade?
I... I suppose I could blame it on the failing war effort. However, I feel I must speak freely with you. I owe you that much, at least.
I... I care for you. But I also have a sworn duty to Neverwinter, and in my experience you cannot mix love and duty.
I'm... I'm afraid to love you. I am afraid to let myself love you, because of the consequences when I must choose between love and duty.
Is this what awaits me? The choice of murder in the name of duty, or betrayal in the name of love? I do not know if I can bear to make such a choice again.
I know you are right... but I am still afraid. I don't know if I can bring myself to say the words I want to say to you.
Your words... you words give me strength. They sound **right**. I was a fool to hide from my true feelings.
You're right. Only a fool would refuse to build a house for fear it might burn down!
I love you. I love you with all my heart. I was afraid to admit it before, but you have given me the courage to open my heart.
I... I'm sorry. I can't promise you will always be first in my life. I wish I could, but... I just can't.
You want what I cannot give, and I am afraid to take what you offer. Perhaps... perhaps it would be best if we did not pursue this further.
I will not trouble you with by bringing this up again. We have a job to do. We must stay focused on saving Neverwinter.
And what of Aribeth? She chose duty over love, and it destroyed her. Look what she has become now--a traitorous creature of hate.
Just friends? Oh... I... forgive me. I just thought... I thought we were more.
Damn it, Aarin - you're a bloody fool! I'm... I'm sorry. I won't embarass either of us by bringing this up again.
The bards among our camp are already composing tales about how you recovered the second Word of Power. I only hope we all live long enough to hear the finished product.
Perhaps Haedraline will speak to our champion. She has spoken with them before.
I normally consider myself well informed, particularly when it comes to matters directly concerning the defense of Neverwinter.
Organizing our remaing troops to withstand the next Luskan assault requires all my attention. If the enemy breaches the City Core we are lost.
Some of my operatives reported that you had recovered the fourth Word of Power. I wasn't surprised, given all your previous accomplishments.
No - but I suspect Haedraline understands their mysteries. She might be willing to share her secrets with our champion.
I am afraid Lord Nasher is right - you should speak to Haedraline about this. Is there anything else you need?
Is there something else you need? If not, I should get back to my reconnaisance reports.
I am more than just a spymaster now. I am responsible for coordinating the entire defense of Neverwinter. I will not risk alienating a potential ally in Haedraline.
I trust you, and I suspect that whatever information Haedraline has shared is something I cannot help you with in any case.
You will have to act on Haedraline's information on your own, I'm afraid. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Why is life so unfair? We have only just found each other, and now events seem as if they might tear us apart.
I am glad you stand with me in this. But if we are to save Neverwinter we cannot let our feelings for each other distract us. We must stay focused on the task at hand.
When this is over maybe we can finally be together, but until then we each have our part to play. I must stay here with Lord Nasher to oversee the defenses of the city.
These are indeed dark times, though not so dark as Lord Nasher portrays them. The people of Neverwinter are made of sterner stuff than any of us imagine.
Surely you must feel it? There is a shadow over Neverwinter, a curse that drags down morale and inspires our enemy.
It's one thing to say the law is always right, but there are exceptions to every rule.
You cannot let your emotions get the better of you. Aribeth has detailed information about the enemy that we need.
I agree with you... but it is not as simple as that. Aribeth's crimes cannot simply be ignored. Be glad we are not the ones who must decide her fate.
For all our sakes, I hope he is given that chance. Is there something else I might do for you?
I understand your concern for her, but I do not know what to tell you. Her fate has yet to be decided.
Heavy is the head that wears the crown, they say. There is little we can do for him, other than trying to save the city. Is there anything else?
You should speak to Haedraline before you go. Maybe she will tell you something about the Source Stone or the Words of Power.
Yes, there is still much that must be done if Neverwinter is to be saved.
You must speak with Lord Nasher first.
Welcome to you. I regret I did not get a chance to introduce myself properly to you while you were training at the Academy.
I have been following your progress since your early training at the Academy. Neverwinter has need of one like you if we are to survive the Wailing Death.
The attack on the Academy doused the one faint spark of hope the city had. I need you to help recover that which we have lost.
I knew I could count on you. There are many rumors about the plague, but if you are to aid me in this it is important you know the truth about the Wailing Death.
You were there. You saw the slaughter. The attack caught us unprepared. You are one of only a handful of survivers from the carnage of the Academy.

Your task in this is twofold. First, find the Waterdhavian creatures and bring them back to me - at any cost. We need to harvest components from these creatures if we are to concoct a cure for the Wailing Death. This is your most important duty.
You proved yourself during the attack on the Academy. Your bravery and skill are obvious, and I know you are not in league with those who seek to destroy Neverwinter.
I ask for your discretion in this matter. News of the attack and strange creatures roaming the city will only add to the panic and chaos already in the streets.
Farewell. May Tyr guide your steps.
I will do my best to answer what questions I may.
Is there something else I can help you with?
I will do my best to answer your questions.
There are many rumors and I would not like to give you any false leads. However, there is something that seems reliable.
I am not one to boast of my accomplishments. Suffice to say that I am a Paladin of Tyr and I am honored Lord Nasher has placed me in charge of finding a cure for the Wailing Death.
Is there anything else?
You will answer only to me - and I will give you free reign in your tasks.
Ah, dear Fenthick, the love of my life. He has been my rock during these troubled times. But even he cannot help me with this.
Welcome. Do you have news of the missing Waterdhavian creatures? Or is there something else you need?
Of course. I will do my best to help with whatever you need to know.
Well done! I knew you wouldn't let me down!
Where others have found only failure you have discovered shining success. Neverwinter is in your debt.
Is there something else you need?
Your charity and selflessness are an example to us all. I only wish more were as noble as you.
Were it up to me, you would have a king's ransom for all you have done. However, the coffers are all but bare. The quarantine has been costly for all within the city.
But you must hurry - Neverwinter has suffered long enough. Return and speak to me when you are ready to go on.
You truly are remarkable. If nothing else you prove that wit is no match for courage and skill!
Is there anything else I can do for you?
Welcome back. You have done a great thing in recovering the first of the reagents for us.
Have you heard? Another recruit has recovered the first of the missing Waterdhavian creatures!
One of the bards here in Castle Never is composing a song to honor your adventures during the recovery of the second reagent.
I believe I heard Lord Nasher himself humming the tune in the halls. People are beginning to take notice of you.
I have glad tidings to report. Another recruit found the second of the Waterdhavian creatures. We now have two of the four components - we are halfway to a cure!
You are a welcome sight, as always. Is this visit in regards to the fourth Waterdhavian creature?
Truly the heart of a hero beats within your chest! Of all who have sought the creatures, you have proven yourself above everyone else!
We are but one reagent away from our salvation! Thanks to another recruit we only need to find the fourth and final reagent from the missing Waterdhavian creatures!
We have all four reagents now. Quickly, time grows short.
There is little else I can tell you about this mission. Whenever you need provisions come speak to me again and I can sell them to you through the store here at Tyr's temple.
Greetings to you. Preparations are well under way for the ritual. If all goes well, we will have the cure in just a few moments.
I must say, I knew you would be instrumental in this cause. You've always presented the confident look of a person called to action.
Oh sure, the container we've provided is nice and shiny. Now, have you any more brilliant questions to ask?
We are very near our goal but... I can't help but worry about the effects of the plague. There is a great scar across Neverwinter.
It's not really appropriate to speak of these things right now. It's not important. We will deal with everything as it comes.
Hello again. I have a moment to talk, but as soon as you have finished speaking with everyone we can begin the ceremony.
The fate of Neverwinter depends on you. This key will open the door. May Tyr be with you!
Listen to me, there is not much time. I fear this is no random attack we have suffered.
You must protect the Waterdhavian creatures! They must not be allowed to fall into the enemy's hands!
You must do this alone. Go back through the hallway leading to this room and take the corridor to the east. It leads to the chambers where the Waterdhavian beasts are being kept.
Take this key - it will open the locked east door back in the hallway leading to this room. I will stay here; hopefully my presence will draw the enemy away from the creatures they seek.
I have been looking forward to meeting you. The instructors here at the Academy speak very highly of your skills. I am Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande.
Perhaps after the graduation ceremonies we can speak in private. Neverwinter can use someone like you.
Perhaps after the graduation ceremonies we can speak in private. Neverwinter can use someone like you.
We should arrange... wait! What was that? Did you feel it? Brace yourself - we are under attack!
It is possible that the cult may be behind some of these activities, allowing us to track them down and mete out the justice they deserve. Your aid in this will prove invaluable.
Of course. Ask what you will of me.
Regardless, we will do all that we can to help you. Do not think your efforts go unrecognized.
The search does continue within the city. Indeed, Lord Nasher is having Neverwinter scoured thoroughly for more traces of the cult.
You have? Excellent work. You have justified Lord Nasher's faith in you, and more.
Both Aarin and I will join you in Luskan, of course. Aarin will be there to help you enter the tower. As for me, I have... other plans.
I wish I could tell you, but I cannot. I have... little choice in the matter. Please just... do as you are asked to.
I am sorry, but I... cannot tell you. Please do not ask me to.
My plans are my own. You have your own mission to worry about.
Go, then, and speak to Aarin. I hope that... I wish... no, nevermind. Be safe.
Very well. Go and speak to Aarin, then. May... Tyr watch your path. May Tyr watch over us all.
It... ah, but I should not be distracting you from your task. My own problems are unimportant and of no interest to you, I am sure. Please forgive me.
It... it is just that Fenthick's fate could have been mine. Or yours. Or anyone's. How do you know that the path you walk is the correct one?
I have never questioned my faith or my duty before. But neither did Fenthick. I feel... doubt, and I am ashamed to admit it.
Yes, I... I suppose you are correct, this is getting me nowhere. I should put these questions out of my mind for the time being.
No. No, it is selfish of me to dwell on my own concerns. Let us return to the subject of your task, please.
That is a relief. What else did you wish of me, then?
Let us return to the matter at hand... namely, your task. That is far more important and I will not distract you from it further.
I... thank you. That is kind of you to say. My own loss seems insignificant, however, compared to Fenthick's disgrace.
Naive, am I? I am a paladin, and my duty is part of who I am, not some trivial preoccupation!
I am not blinded. If anything, my eyes have been opened. You judge Fenthick just as everyone else has.
Is it I who am blind? If I am, to which truth am I blind about? Fenthick was hanged for treason, but I know there was no treason in his heart.
No, of course not. Nor would I expect you to. Please forgive me... I have a duty of my own to attend to, and I should remain focussed on it.
My strain should not surprise you. My only love lies dead, and while it was my lawful Lord who executed him, his true murderers remain beyond my reach.
Would you not feel the same? I remained passive while my love was executed, and this wretched cult remains invisible and impervious to my wrath.
Why do you ask me that? The spymaster put you up to this, didn't he?
After all that has happened with the plague and... and Fenthick, I think a disturbing dream or two is not so surprising, wouldn't you agree?
Let us return to the topic of your mission, and speak of this no more.
(sigh) Perhaps you are right. Having the perspective of another on these dreams may not be a bad idea.
These... these are my dreams. Perhaps now you can understand why I have not wished to discuss them. I am... frightened... of what they may mean.
That's kind of you to say. I am glad I told you, at least... it makes the dreams seem a bit smaller, now.
No... I'm sorry. I should not be so... quick to find my temper. I do want you to be honest, and it is good to talk about the dreams, at least.
It's all right. There isn't much that can be said, is there? But... I am glad I told you. It makes the dreams seem a bit smaller, somehow.
No. I appreciate the offer, but I would not feel... comfortable... discussing such a personal matter with you. I am sorry.
I did say that, didn't I? Are you sure you wish to hear the tale? It is not an exciting one, and I would not wish to bore you.
No, I... thank you. Thank you for listening to my tale. You have been a great comfort to me.
I would be glad to call you a... a friend. Tyr only knows that finding a friend in times like these is difficult enough. I hope you feel the same.
Oh, I meant no... no disrespect! I was suggesting only... that is, I only was... oh, do not mind me. Let us forget I said anything, please.
I do not know. Not yet. But... I thank you for listening to my tale. You have been a great comfort.
(sigh) You did ask to hear this. Do you want me to stop?
Shush. I have barely begun my tale. Control your attention span for a moment.
Discarded. Discarded by his liege lord to appease the witless masses, discarded by his god for one foolish mistake. Tell me why I shouldn't be angry!
I... I don't know. Tyr brought me here, put me on this path. I want to know why. Why teach me true justice and then throw it in my face?
Perhaps it is just... the dreams. They continue to come, and get worse each night. I hear voices crying out, so many voices...
Promise me... promise me as my dearest friend that you will find this cult and visit upon them the vengeance that I cannot!
You have been a fine friend. Here... take this. It is a ring that belonged to my father. I want you to have it.
Let us speak more later. Go... find where the heart of this cult resides and return to me. I wish you luck with all my heart.
Leave me be, then, and return to your mission. We need discuss my feelings no further.
And what *is* like me? Tyr brought me to this place and put me on this path and taught me the meaning of justice... only to throw it in my face. I want to know why!
I wish there were better leads we could send you on to track down the cult... but Aarin's information is the best we have.
Go with Tyr's blessing, then... and be safe.
Then I wish you luck.
How I feel is... unimportant, next to the mission we have been given. Please, allow me to explain what is required of us.
It is of vital importance that you complete Lord Nasher's mission. Much depends on you discovering what else Desther's allies have planned.
It is good to see you again. At times I worry that you have taken on too much responsibility yourself, yet always you surprise me with your resourcefulness and success.
It is good to see you again. When I surrendered to Lord Nasher I was certain my execution would be swift.
Please, we have both made our feelings toward each other clear. But Morag still lives; now is not the time for this discussion.
I am at peace, for the first time since Fenthick's death. And I have you to thank. You saved me.
I no longer fear my fate. When Fenthick... when Fenthick was executed I thought I had lost everything. But now I see this is not true.
I have you. You were there when I was in my darkest hour, you were there when I needed you - but I was too blind to see.
But you never gave up on me. I have found myself again. And I finally see how... how special you are to me.
They say it is better to have loved and lost than not to have loved at all. I never used to believe that... until now.
Forgive me for speaking so frankly about this. My heart could not stay silent, but I should not have burdened you with this - not while you still must face Morag.
I understand, you have every right to feel that way. I only wanted to tell you the truth that is within my own heart.
I have you to thank for this. Without your intervention I would never have found this peace.
I may yet be given the chance to make amends for all I have done, though I know I will never be able to fully atone for what I have done.
I am ready to meet my fate. There is a great peace upon me now.
I understand. There is still much that must be done if Morag is to be defeated. I wish you luck.
This I cannot do. Even if Lord Nasher chose to release me from this cell, I would have to refuse your request.
You... I am not surprised to see you here. You have become quite the thorn in Maugrim's side. Though he would never admit it, I believe you have impressed him with your accomplishments.
I, however, am not too proud to admit my respect for you. You have thwarted us at almost every turn. Yet in the end Morag's will cannot be denied.
You have already lost. My troops control the city; soon even Castle Never will fall. The streets will run red with the blood of Neverwinter's children.
I was about to make you the same offer, though I suspect Maugrim would rather sacrifice you to his new Queen.
His blood is on their hands. We are all guilty here, and we are all deserving of death.
My position at the head of the armies only hastened the inevitable end. Neverwinter was doomed as soon as Maugrim unleashed the Wailing Death.
There is nothing more to say. It is too late for words. We must settle this in blood.
You have come far since our first meeting. I can no longer stand against you.
Tell me how can you go on, knowing you fight for a city that is doomed to fall when the Old Ones return?
I have seen the future in my dreams. Neverwinter will vanish in a blaze of flame when the Old Ones are reborn - it is inevitable.
I am at your mercy. Ask your questions and I will answer them.
Maugrim has the Word of Power in his room - through the door to the south. We knew you were coming. That is why I am here rather than leading Luskan's army.
I... I am simply telling you what happened. How I... how I came to break my vows and betray all that I stood for.
Look around you. Look at the death and destruction I have brought to Neverwinter. I can never make up for this.
Do you think I am a fool? I know Lord Nasher too well to believe such tripe!
I should sacrifice myself for the sake of the people who demanded Fenthick's blood? Do you really believe me capable of so selfless an act?
Once I would have gladly sacrificed myself for this city. But I have changed. I am no longer the Aribeth you knew. Now I walk a different path.
I... I am not who I once was. I... I cannot... it would not be possible... I cannot go back. Not after what I have done.
Your words are... wise. Perhaps... perhaps I can set aside my hatred.
There... there is a part of me that still weeps when I see the destruction of Neverwinter. Perhaps... perhaps you are right.
Your words are... wise. Perhaps... perhaps I can set aside my hatred.
But you... you will have to trust me in this. Maugrim waits for you behind this door, you must face him now - time is of the essence.
I am grateful to you for this... this chance to... to do what is right. I wanted you to know that before I go, in case... in case Lord Nasher has me executed before you return.
Lady Aribeth? It has been a long time since anyone called me that. Thank you.
Your words are kind, but I am ready for whatever awaits.
No, If I run away it will mean I have learned nothing. I am ready to accept the consequences of what I have done - whatever those consequences may be.
I... I must go to Lord Nasher now, while my resolve is still strong. You must face Maugrim without me. Goodbye... and good luck.
You are wasting your time. I am beyond your power to save.
There... there is a part of me that still weeps when I see the destruction of Neverwinter. Perhaps... perhaps you are right.
Perhaps... perhaps you are right. Perhaps, had I acted differently... but it is too late for me now.
I know this. And yet, I would speak with you before you end my life. So you might understand why I did what I did.
Let me live? You can do no such thing. You serve Neverwinter, you have no choice but to end my existence.
Come then, deliver me to the fate I have brought upon myself.
Lead on, Asheera of the Shining Order will follow you as long as she draws breath!

Horn of Blasting
This horn appears to be a normal trumpet.
This horn appears to be a normal trumpet. It can be played to create an ultrasonic burst of sound as with the spell sound burst.
Horn of Goodness/Evil

This trumpet has two distinct tones that it can produce. The high ringing peal creates a magic circle against evil effect. The low rumbling moan creates a magic circle against good effect. In either case, the horn can be blown once per day.
Lantern of Revealing
This lantern operates as a normal hooded lantern. While it is lit, it also reveals all invisible creatures and objects nearby, just as the spell invisibility purge.
Lens of Detection

This circular prism enables its user to detect minute details, magically revealing all nearby traps to the user as per the spell find traps. The lens is about 6 inches in diameter and set in a frame with a handle.
Elixir of Horus-Re
When consumed, this elixir allows the imbiber to glow with mystical light that is released as a powerful sunbeam.
Golden Chalice of Lathander
This pure gold chalice is finely worked and bears the symbol of a sun rising upon a blooming rose.

This pure gold chalice is finely worked and bears the symbol of a sun rising upon a blooming rose. On command, it sheds a bright light equal to a light spell. The chalice can be commanded to create a healing circle, which uses one charge. When all three of its charges have been used, the chalice retains its light ability.
Fochluchan Bandore
A simple but well-crafted lute.

A wise and powerful bard in the Moonshaes named Falataer created the first of these instruments, using them to test and reward the student of his bardic college. Others have since copied the designs, keeping the name Falataer gave them to honor him.
This 3-stringed masterwork lute can be played to produce light once per day.
Mac-Fuirmidh Cithern

A wise and powerful bard in the Moonshaes named Falataer created the first of these instruments, using them to test and reward the student of his bardic college. Others have since copied the designs, keeping the name Falataer gave them to honor him.

A wise and powerful bard in the Moonshaes named Falataer created the first of these instruments, using them to test and reward the student of his bardic college. Others have since copied the designs, keeping the name Falataer gave them to honor him.

A wise and powerful bard in the Moonshaes named Falataer created the first of these instruments, using them to test and reward the student of his bardic college. Others have since copied the designs, keeping the name Falataer gave them to honor him.
This eight-stringed masterwork mandolin can be played to cast cure serious wounds, dispel magic, and summon monster III each once per day.
Cli Lyre

A wise and powerful bard in the Moonshaes named Falataer created the first of these instruments, using them to test and reward the students of his bardic college. Others have since copied the designs, keeping the name Falataer gave them to honor him.

Goodbye.
Maybe me help yous somehow, huh?
Maybe I could help you out?
Me want ask questions.
Could I ask you some questions?
I don't want any trouble, but I guess what I want doesn't really matter. It's not like there's anything I can do...
Can I help you? No, what am I thinking... I can't even help myself. I can't even huddle in my own home...
Hell, your <Lord/Lady>ship. Can you help? I don't know if I should dare to ask... probably not. I'm not worth the time of someone like you.
Can't go home to the Beggar's Nest because of zombies, can't get out of the city because of the quarantine... what's a guy supposed to do? Just choke on stink of the corpse-fires, I guess.
Farewell, then. I'll just stay here... nowhere else to go...
I don't know how you could. I don't know anyone that can take on an army of zombies by themselves. The Beggar's Nest is completely overrun... my home is overrun...
I-I'm sorry, I don't mean to be rude, but if you think I've had any time to think about any of this, then you just aren't very bright.
No, please, I don't want to think about this anymore than I have to.
It's over? I mean, the plague is still going, sure, but at least I can go home. The zombies in the Beggar's Nest were just a nightmare I didn't need. Thank you.
I just want to go home, that's all.
I never thought I'd be happy to be going back to the Beggar's Nest.
Goodbye.
Maybe somethings me can do?
Is there anything I can do?
Me want ask questions.
Could I ask you some questions?
You one of those damned thieves? I wouldn't put it past them to come out here and start the same crap in the City Core that put me out of the Docks.
What, you trapped out here too? Ain't it just like the working stiffs to get the worst of everything. It's rough, isn't it.
You some sort of noble or officer? Can't you throw some highfalutin influence around and take care of the crap that's keeping me from my job?
See, I just want to go back to work in the Docks district. There's not much to do under the quarantine, but at least I'd be away from the stink of the corpse-fires.
Can't do squat with all the thieves everywhere. I don't know what's got into them, but it's made the Docks district unlivable. I can't go home for all the muggers.
Bye then. Guess I'll just wait here. Nothing I can do. Why doesn't someone step up and be a damn hero?
I ain't looking for charity. I just want to be able to get back in the docks. Someone needs to get in there and raise hell.
I swear, if my back was in better shape, I'd be in there, but I can't take on an army of thieves. No way.
I ain't gonna waste my time explaining something so simple. I just want to get back to work in the Docks. I ain't used to running from thieves.
Ah, I don't know anything you can't learn from better talkers than me. I ain't had time to see anything except them thieves nipping at my heels as I ran.
I just want to get back to work, but until someone kicks some heads in the Docks district, I'm stuck out here. That's all there is to it.
Glad that somebody was willing to take those thieves to the woodshed. I gotta thank you. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna get back to work in there.
I hate this. Someone should lay down the law.
That's the way things get done! Yes indeed!
Me needs temple stuffs.
I require temple services.
Me needs temple stuff.
I need temple services.
Me need temple stuff.

I ask that you heal me.
Very well. Mind that you hold still a moment. There, that should do it.
Stand away from me, you, before I call the tavern guards!
More plague-waifs cluttering up the place, I see. Excuse me.
Go on, you're fouling my air.
If it weren't for this place, I wouldn't go out at all. Plague has closed all my old haunts.
The quarantine has really hurt trade. I wonder how long this place will stay open.
I don't mind being sealed in the Blacklake. I hardly go to the rest of the city, anyway.
The place is a bit rough, but until the barricades are down, this is the best place for us to gather.
You seen pretty friendly for this type of place.
Careful around here. You won't want to ruin that pretty face of yours.
Been a while since we had a fresh barbarian face around here. You'll spice things up, I bet.
You'll like this place, I'll wager. You look a little rough around the edges.
Oh, I'll enjoy watching you battle in the pit. You look ready for rough-and-tumble.
Not much of interest for you around here, magic user.
I doubt you'll find this place to your liking, caster.
A spellslinger? This isn't really your type of place, is it?
I take it you are the new owner. Luck be with you in these hard times.
I am not interested in battling you. Put your weapon away until you need to use it.
Yes, yes, I see your fine weapon. Now get it out of my face.
Weapons should not be brandished on the main floor. You'll bring unwanted attention.
Wherever you fought, it must have been an impressive battle. You are a mess!
Look at you. You are in no shape to fight. You need rest.
You look horrible! Isn't the healer doing her job?
Present yourself properly, <man/woman>! Dress yourself!
Kindly cover yourself. You'll bring unwanted attention to the tavern.
This is hardly the place to risk such behavior. Dress yourself - if not for decency, then at least for battle.
Me gots hurts that need to be healed.
I am injured. Can you heal my wounds?
Me am hurts. Yous got healing, please?
I am injured. Could you heal me?
<StartAction>Aribeth looks you over, then raises her hands in praise of the Even-Handed, Tyr. You begin to feel better.</Start>
<StartAction>Aribeth looks you over, then raises her hands in praise of the Even-Handed, Tyr. You begin to feel better.</Start>
Remember, you can always rest here in the Temple of Tyr. It is safe, free from plague, and Aribeth can see to any wounds you might have.
We are very disappointed in you, <FirstName>. Your slaughter of innocent people has caused much suffering in a time already overburdened with tragedy.
Were it up to me you would have been left to rot in your grave; however, Aribeth has ordered me to resurrect you. Despite your actions, Neverwinter still has need of you.
You will suffer no further consequences for your mad killing spree, but I implore you not to engage in such wholesale slaughter again. Please, focus on the mission you have been given.
If yous can't do this, why could me?
If you can't do it, how would I?
Look, if I had the manpower I might be able to get it done, but we are tapped out. The prisoners are organized, running the prison like a fortress. Their raiding parties always retreat back inside
I heard that it was the Waterdhavian intellect devourer behind it, and that the remains of the creature have been turned in to Aribeth already.
Now I just have to reward the proper person. I will give the payment I earmarked for this task to the person that returned the creature to Aribeth.
If you see them, tell them I will be waiting here with their well-deserved wages.
Yes, I heard that it was the Waterdhavian intellect devourer. I also heard that you turned the remains of it in to Aribeth. Good work.
Her word is good enough proof that you did the job. I assume that 300 gold danger pay is sufficient?
Mizzenmast Mercantile
At last I can unleash my magic again. Feel my power!
This is my territory now and I'm not going down without a fight!
Me thought only nobles in Blacklake.
I keep quite a few houses clean too. Not every house, but close enough.

Well, I guess I have no choice. If I want my family heirloom that my brother carried to his DYING DAY, I guess I have to pay.
Well, so be it. Here is my offer then. I have 400 gold. No more, no less. I assume it will be enough?
Listen, I have nothing more! That's it! I'm not going to waste time bargaining! I have 400! Take it or don't, but don't taunt me further!
I simply can't. I have already paid for his journal. I simply have no more gold to give.
I see. Well, it would appear that if I want these last written words of my brother, I have no choice.
Very well, then. I have 400 gold, no more, no less. I assume it will be enough?

And you take your dirty, filthy gold! I hope you choke on it! Now, was there anything else, or are you done bleeding me?

Walk away then, dog. You are despicable. I hope the spirit of my brother haunts your dreams!
I have been given his Journal. You must have found his staff. Must I be forced to purchase a treasured family heirloom?
His staff was freely given. Dare you viloate the spirit of that gift by demanding payment for whatever else my brother carried?
I am continually beset by the worst of our society. Isn't it enough that I have already had to purchase his journal? I can pay no more!
I have had to purchase the family staff already. I have nothing left to give for the return of anything else of his. There is simply nothing I can offer.
This is a cruel jest. Leave me to my mourning. I don't have the patience for this sort of thing right now.
