<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Your eyes shift... almost imperceptibly... but I see the movement. You dog... you convince me of my brother's death and then try to steal his things!

Who be you?
Who are you?
Get lost! Only guests of Mr. Rumbottom are allowed in. Please, I'm just doing my job.
You better step back. Mr. Rumbottom does not permit strangers to enter his estate.
I'm sorry, <sir/madam>. Only guests of Mr. Rumbottom are permitted past this point. The guards inside deal harshly with anyone that enters the estate.
Goodbye, then. Don't mind me.
I... I don't get the chance to speak with people all that often. I'm usually caring for Mr. Rumbottom's horse, but he claims to have... lost it. Now I'm a guard.
I'm sorry, I do tend to ramble. What is it you wanted?
I don't mean to suggest you are not being smart, but have I not mentioned the guards inside? I know I'm no threat...
I don't really care if you go in or not. This isn't my proper job, and I don't feel like losing my life over it. I'm not really much of a fighter.
I'm just a stable-hand, really. This seems like pretty dangerous stuff for what I make. Especially since I would expect to lose any fight I started.
The door is already open anyway. You could just walk in. I wouldn't do it, though. It's not safe. There are guards - real ones, not like me.
I told you, I'm no guard. I don't make enough gold to get in your way. I say it ain't safe, but what you do is your business.
The guards inside are real tough. I'm not sure why Mr. Rumbottom didn't put them out here. Maybe he wants them as a surprise for burglars. I don't know.
They attack on sight. Nothing more than killers, really. Working as a guard just lets them hurt people legally. I don't like them much.
I'm sorry, I'm not familiar with this area at all. I usually just tend to the horses, trying to stay out of the way.
Old Worthington in the stables used to know a lot about politics and such, but he died last week. Anything else you need?
Eh, I think most of the nobles are looking for... quicker help. Not that you're slow, I meant no offence.
Sorry, if I knew of any work worth having I'd probably take the job myself. Anything to get away from guarding this bloody door.
I wish I did. I don't know what I'm supposed to do - worse, I don't know what *not* to do. People just seem to get it without warning.
But, that's nothing you haven't heard before, I'm sure. Was there anything else?
Oh, I'm just watching the door, though I'm not sure why. This isn't my proper job. I care for animals. I'm no fighter. The pay ain't worth it.
Mr. Rumbottom has become concerned that his security is not up to snuff, so he's thrown a bunch of people at the problem. You should see the brutes inside. Vicious lot.
But who am I to question the oh-so-important merchant nobility. Mr. Rumbottom does as he wishes, though I swear I've never swung a sword in my life.
Tough loss, that one. Fashi is good. You did your best... though I couldn't tell from looking.
Tough break. Better luck next time. My gold will be on Agar, of course, but good luck anyway.
Should have seen that coming. Nobody beats Claudus.
*chitter* *chitter*
*HOOOOOWL*
This man looks displeased, as though angry that his status as a noble has not afforded any immunity to the effects of the plague.
This woman looks displeased, as though angry that her status as a noble has not afforded any immunity to the effects of the plague.
Captain Alaefin looks... wrong. It's hard to explain why. He seems to move as though imitating someone else --each step is slightly exaggerated and forced.

This note bears no markings as to who may have written it.
"The plague spreads more quickly than we could possibly have hoped; the streets are thick with corpses and the citizens are on the verge of open rebellion. Soon Neverwinter will be brought to its knees and the next phase can begin!
"But this will not happen if a cure for the Wailing Death is discovered. You must do everything in your power to prevent Aribeth and her agents from ending the plague."
This note should be shown to someone in authority.

In place of a signature, this letter bears the mark of a stylized, reptilian eye. Other than this marking, there is nothing to indicate who the author may be:
"Our agent within Neverwinter has informed us that several of the Waterdhavian Creatures have been delivered to Aribeth and are now stored in the safety of Castle Never. If all of the creatures are recovered a cure for the Wailing Death will be discovered, and our efforts will be for naught.
"It will not be possible for our agent to orchestrate an attack upon Castle Never, as was done with the Academy. Those who serve Lady Aribeth must be stopped before they deliver the creatures to the safety of the castle, at any cost.
"Should you succeed in this your rewards will surpass your grandest imaginings. Should you fail, you will feel pain and suffering such as no mortal was meant to bear. "Long live the People of the Eye."
This note should be shown to someone in authority.
A simple key, apparently for the front door of Milly the cleaning lady's home in the north central area of the Blacklake, near the Meldanen estate.
Milly's Key
Head of Loxar
The severed head of the villainous bandit Loxar.
Orders from Callik

This note consists of hastily scrawled instructions, mostly orders to members of a search party.
Excerpt: The old fool has to be somewhere! Even Vengaul can't disappear into thin air. I want patrols by the ship, and I want someone to get a hold of that damn wench he favors. She's usually around the Seedy Tavern somewhere. Take her downstairs and find out where Vengaul would hide himself. Shut down all his plans, boys, and when we find that fool we'll be rich as kings! I won't let him give up the chance at the largest ransom we've ever seen! We're doing things MY way now.
Callik

It took some convincing, but Bertrand now understands that his brother is dead. Marcus was his name, and zombies apparently overwhelmed him. None of his possessions have yet been returned to Bertrand.

A noble by the name of Formosa harangues the crowd gathered in the Blacklake's central square. She claims that, from behind his well-guarded gates, the sorcerer, Meldanen, is hoarding food from the plaguestruck.
Not only has she demanded the key to the warehouse where he has secured his grain, she has also called for his death. One of the sorcerer's teeth is of pure silver and she will gladly accept it as evidence of the deed.
The key has been found and turned in. Formosa awaits the tooth as well.

A noble by the name of Formosa harangues the crowd gathered in the Blacklake's central square. She claims that, from behind his well-guarded gates, the sorcerer, Meldanen, is hoarding food from the plaguestruck.
Not only has she demanded the key to the warehouse where he has secured his grain, she has also called for his death. One of the sorcerer's teeth is of pure silver and she will gladly accept it as evidence of the deed.
The tooth been found and turned in. Formosa awaits the key as well.

A noble by the name of Formosa harangues the crowd gathered in the Blacklake's central square. She claims that, from behind his well-guarded gates, the sorcerer, Meldanen, is hoarding food from the plaguestruck.
Not only has she demanded the key to the warehouse where he has secured his grain, she has also called for his death. One of the sorcerer's teeth is of pure silver and she will gladly accept it as evidence of the deed.
The key has now been recovered. Formosa already has the tooth, and likely eagerly awaits this new acquisition.

A noble by the name of Formosa harangues the crowd gathered in the Blacklake's central square. She claims that, from behind his well-guarded gates, the sorcerer, Meldanen, is hoarding food from the plaguestruck.
Not only has she demanded the key to the warehouse where he has secured his grain, she has also called for his death. One of the sorcerer's teeth is of pure silver and she will gladly accept it as evidence of the deed.
The tooth has now been recovered. Formosa already has the key, and likely eagerly awaits this new acquisition.
Henchman

Boddyknock Glinkle, a gnomish sorcerer from the island of Lantan, has joined your cause. Though not skilled in melee combat, his arcane spells will be a valuable tool in the many battles that lie ahead. His magic might also prove useful in opening any stubborn locks you might come across.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Daelan Red Tiger, a noble barbarian of the Uthgardt tribes, has joined his mighty axe to your cause. His ferocity and prowess in melee combat will be helpful in the many battles you are sure to face. Daelen can also use his great strength to try and bash open any chests or locked doors you might come across.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Tomi "Grin" Undergallows, a halfling thief of dubious character and widespread reputation, has joined his nimble fingers to your cause. His ability to pick locks will prove invaluable throughout your adventures, as will his skill in detecting and disarming traps. Though not eager to go toe to toe with an enemy in combat, Tomi's sneak attacks on an opponent's exposed flank can be devastating.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Grimgnaw, a macabre dwarven monk who worships Death itself, has joined your cause. With deadly feats like Stunning Fist and Flurry of Blows, Grimgnaw is a powerful ally in combat.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Linu La'neral, an elven cleric of Sehanine Moonbow, has joined your cause. Her divine spells, particularly her healing magic, will be invaluable in the many battles that lie ahead. As well, her ability to turn undead should not be underestimated.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Sharwyn, a beautiful bard determined to make a legend for herself, has joined your cause. Her skill in combat is augmented by a variety of spells and healing magic, and her powerful bard song will inspire those who fight by her side to heroic victory.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Your henchman has been spirited away to the nearest temple of Tyr in a desperate attempt to save them from a grisly and unfortunate end. You can use the Stone of Recall to return to the temple and reclaim your companion.
You have released your henchman from service. You can hire a new henchman at the Trade of Blades, or join up again with your previous companion in the place you last left them.
While the key to the prison is yet to be used, another method for getting inside has been found.
Trouble in No-Man's-Land

A man name Cendran is wandering the plague-ravaged no-man's-land between the City Core and the Blacklake district. He claims that after the nobles put up their barricade to keep the plague out, a half-orc named Loxar took advantage of the chaos caused by plague-maddened thugs and eventually killed everyone. Now this community of servants is all but destroyed, and Cendran hopes someone will kill the beast.

A huge half-orc named Loxar put up quite a fight in the no-man's-land between the Blacklake and the City Core. Likely, he had taken advantage of the chaos of the plague and killed and looted as he saw fit. Doubtless there would be someone around there that wanted him dead.
The huge half-orc that Cendran spoke of is dead, his head cleanly cut from his shoulders. Cendran will likely want to see proof of the deed before his fears are finally put to rest.
Cendran has been told that the half-orc Loxar is dead. It will not bring his fellows back, but any justice in this difficult time is probably welcome.

Me finds out all me can about cult in tower.
I have discovered all I can about the cult in the Host Tower.
<StartAction>Tell Aarin about Maugrim and Aribeth's betrayal.</Start>
<StartAction>Tell Aarin about the Words of Power.</Start>
Let me see what you have. Hmmm... this is excellent work, my friend. It does not, however, tell us where the cult is headquartered, only where other cultists may be found.
If you find these other cultists, perhaps they will have information on where to find their base and their leader, this... Maugrim.
We need something that tells us where their base is... as well as a second piece that backs up the first, so we know it to be true. We cannot afford to be deceived.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I... have no desire to speak of her, <FirstName>. It is no fault of yours. Perhaps another time.
Let us return to your questions and speak no more of me.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I do not think so, my friend. You have far more important things to focus on other than I. Ask me another time, perhaps.
Well done, my friend. I knew Lord Nasher's faith in you was well-justified. Come, then... tell me what you have learned.
I see. This enemy is far more elusive than I suspected, even, for the name of this Maugrim is unfamiliar to me... as is this creature you describe as his mistress.
That Lady Aribeth has fallen to become a blackguard and even lead their gathering army is... is far worse than anything I had feared. Dire, dire news indeed.
But... what of this Maugrim's purpose, my friend? Were you able to discover anything of the reasoning behind all this madness?
This is perhaps the first good news I have heard so far. It shows us that we are ignorant of much and must catch up quickly if we are to survive... but at least you have brought us hope.
Come then... let us return to Lord Nasher quickly and relate what you have discovered. Then perhaps we will see what must be done next.
<StartAction>Ask how to possess the familiar.</Start>

To possess your familiar, access your radial menu and select your Special Abilities. If your familiar has already been summoned, an option to Possess Familiar should appear in your Wizard or Sorcerer sub-menu.
When the Possess Familiar option is selected, you will now control the familiar directly. Your character remains where you left <him/her>, uncontrolled.
When you are finished, access the familiar's radial menu. At the bottom should be an option to Unpossess Familiar. This will return you to the direct control of your character.
Me too busy for this now, gnome boy!
Not now, Boddyknock! I'm kind of busy here!
Me not want to hear it. We got big fight ahead.
Good, keep quiet. We've got business to take care of!
Me sorry. You tell me what you got to say.
I'm sorry. Please go on.
What you want, little gnome friend?
Yes, Boddyknock - what is it?
What you point, gnome?
Get to the point, Boddyknock.
Enough talk, gnome! Morag not be dead yet! We still got work to do!
Save it, gnome. Our work here isn't done.
Thanks. That mean a lot to me, Boddyknock.
Thank you, Boddyknock. That means a lot to me.
*Sigh* Me big hero now, so me guess lots of people gonna be in awe when me come around.
*Sigh* I guess people holding me in awe is the burden of being a hero.
Me not do it alone. You help me lots, Daelan.
I didn't do it alone. You have been a valuable ally throughout my adventures.
<FirstName>, a moment if I may. I have something to say to you, and I'm afraid that if I don't say it now I may not get the chance.
Yes, I understand. All evidence points to the conclusion that our final confrontation is near at hand. If you don't want to hear what I have to say then I'll keep my observations to myself.
Onward, then. I'll follow you as I always do.
All evidence points to the logical conclusion that our final confrontation with Morag is near at hand, and there's something you should know.

I left my home of Lantan on a journey of discovery, eager to experience all the world had to offer. In our time together I have seen wonders I could not have imagined and experienced adventures I can barely believe myself.

But what still amazes me most through all of this, <FirstName>, is you yourself. The legend you have forged in the North, all the great deeds you have accomplished - I admit that at times I am somewhat in awe of you.
I want you to know that I'm proud to have been a part of this, even if it's only a small part. It's not often a simple gnome from a tiny island like mine gets to be a part of a legend in the making.
If we get out of this alive I'll be able to return to Lantan with marvelous tales; stories that will be the envy of everyone on my island home. I've got you to thank for that, <FirstName>.
I don't know what fate has in store for us, or if we even have a chance in this coming battle. But I'm with you to the end, <FirstName>. You can count on me.
You're right, of course. I just... I just felt it needed to be said before... well, before we go up against Morag.

Yes, well... I know this wasn't really the best time for this. Hardly logical for me to get all sentimental on you now, is it? But I just felt it needed to be said before - well, before we go up against Morag.

I may have had some small hand in this, <FirstName>, but make no mistake: you are the true hero here, not me. Yours is the name the history chronicles will remember... if we survive the coming battle.
Me too busy for this now, orcy-boy!
Me not want to hear it. We got big fight ahead.
Good, keep quiet. We've got business to take care of!
Me sorry. You tell me what you got to say.
I'm sorry. Please go on.
Not now, Daelan! I'm kind of busy here!
What you want, Daelan friend?
Yes, Daelan - what is it?
Me not no hero - me only in this for the money!
Don't paint me as something I'm not - I'm only in this for the money!
*Sigh* Me big hero now, so me guess lots of people gonna be in awe when me come around.
*Sigh* I guess people holding me in awe is the burden of being a hero.
Me not do it alone. You help me lots, Daelan.
I didn't do it alone. You have been a valuable ally throughout my adventures.
Enough talk, ocry-boy! Morag not be dead yet! We still got work to do!
Save it, Daelan. Our work here isn't done.
Thanks. That mean a lot to me, Daelan.
Thank you, Daelan. That means a lot to me.
<FirstName>, I have something I wish to say, and I fear if I do not say it now I may never again have the chance.
I understand, of course. We march toward a great battle; if you do not wish to hear my words I shall keep them to myself.
Let us press forward, then, to meet our fate with the courage of our ancestors.
The signs are clear, <FirstName>. We march toward a great battle against a foe we may not be able to defeat. If I am to face my possible death with honor there are words I must say to you.
I am born of the Red Tiger but I left my tribe to prove myself worthy; to prove the spirit of the Uthgardt was within me. I left to earn my honor and prove myself a hero.
I have fought many battles by your side, <FirstName> and now I see what a true hero is. You are a <man/woman> of great honor, <FirstName> and I am humbled in your presence.
I judge you on your deeds and not your motives, <FirstName>. Whatever your reasons, you are the savior of Neverwinter. You have forged a legend throughout the North.
My axe and bow are joined to your cause, but you are the one who deserves the glory, <FirstName>. You are the savior of Neverwinter, you are the one who has forged a legend throughout the North.
I am proud to have served by your side, <FirstName>. You have brought honor to me and allowed me to prove myself worthy of my tribe.

If we survive the coming battle I shall return to the people born of the Red Tiger. They will know of our deeds together and they will welcome me into the tribe, because I have proven the spirit of the Uthgardt is strong within me.
For this I thank you, <FirstName>. I know not what fate awaits us, or if the coming battle shall be my last. But I swear on the honor of my people that I will stand with you to the end.
You speak the truth, <FirstName>. The enemy yet lies before us, and the battle yet awaits.
I only speak what I know in my heart to be true, <FirstName>. But our enemy yet lies before us and the battle yet awaits.
Me not haves time for stupid stuff.
You makes it quick, runt.
What you wants, Tomi?
I don't have time for your nonsense.
Me say forget it!
You asking me laters, then.
Huh. That be new. Okay, you spits it out.
I said forget it.
Ask me later, then.
Well, that's new. Spit it out.
Make it quick, halfling.
What is it, Tomi?
The be no time to talk 'bout that stuff.
Me not intends to die.
You be scareds of dying, huh?
You knows good. You tells me.
This is not the time for a philosophical discussion.
I don't intend to die.
Are you afraid of dying, Tomi?
You should know. You tell me.
You pulls together!
You thinks of better way to die, maybe?
You no worry, Tomi. You is too lucky to die.
You not backs out on me, is you?
Pull yourself together, already.
Look at it this way: can you think of a better way to go?
Don't worry, Tomi. You're too lucky to die.
Are you backing out on me, then?
We goes, now...
You watches it, or me kills you myself.
Me so glad you approves.
Let's just move on...
Watch it, or I kill you myself.
So glad you approve.
Eh. Not really, nah. You know what to do, don't ya?
Huh. So all this is finally gettin' close to the end, is it? You can hear that fat lady clearin' her throat already. Mind if I ask ya a question, m'<lord/lady>?
It's not nonsense! It's a, umm... what do ya call it? It's a serious question.
Whoa! A bit touchy, ain't we? Somebody steal your oatmeal? I bet it's just nerves... I know what ya mean.
O-oookay. If there IS a later, you know what I'm saying? Not that I want to make ya nervous or anything, champ.
I gotta admit, though, I've been lookin' forward to this all day. Let's go teach the lizard bitch to stay dead! Woot!
Well... what are your thoughts on death? You know... the permanent kind.
Really? Seems like the perfect time, if ya ask me. As a matter of fact, I could sit here and talk about it alllll day...
Well that's easy for YOU to say. I'm the sidekick, remember? The sidekicks ALWAYS die.
I dunno. I've never given it much thought. There seems to be major potential here for me to wet my breeches over, ya know.
That's different. When a halfling's time is up, his time is up. The gods don't play around with that stuff, ya know.
You know just the thing to say every time, don't ya? Ahhh, it's the Undergallows charm at work. You want me, it's obvious. But that's okay.
You know just the thing to say every time, don't ya? You sweet-talker, you. Ha ha!
Hmm... well, how about that? I can't. I really can't. Wow, ya make a great case, m'<lord/lady>.
You know... you're right! I am too lucky to die! It's the Undergallows destiny to be rich and adored by halfling lasses throughout Faerun, after all.
Back out? Are you kidding? Miss the fight of the century? Miss all that glory and riches, the chance to be adored by halfling lasses everywhere?

I guess if I do kick the bucket, I'll have to be satisfied with meeting Brandobaris and pantsing Arvoreen in the afterlife. And maybe Sammy will be there! And if I don't die: I'm a hero! It's all good!
Ya know, you aren't so bad, yourself. You'll make some lad a fine wife some day, I bet.
Ya know, you aren't so bad, yourself. You'll make a fine hero one day, if I don't miss my guess.
I hear ya. Now let's go teach that lizard bitch to stay dead! Woot!
Me too busy for this now, monk!
Not now, Grimgnaw! I'm kind of busy here!
Me not want to hear it. We got big fight ahead.
Good, keep quiet. We've got business to take care of!
No, you tell me what you got to say.
No, tell me what you have to say.
What you want, Grimgnaw?
Yes, Grimgnaw - what is it?
Me only kill when me got no other choice.
I only kill when I have to, Grimgnaw.
*Sigh* Me big hero now, so me guess lots of people gonna be in awe when me come around.
*Sigh* I guess people holding me in awe is the burden of being a hero.
You not worry, Grimgnaw. You good at killing people, too.
Don't sell yourself short, Grimgnaw. You spread as much bloodshed as I do.
Enough talk, dwarf! Morag not be dead yet! We still got work to do!
Save it, dwarf. Our work here isn't done.
You talk like you think you gonna die in this fight!
Are you saying you expect to die in this battle?
<FirstName>, there is something I must tell you, something I would say now, before the Silent Lord claims me and forever stills my breath.
I understand, <FirstName>. A great slaughter is coming. If you care nothing for my words, I shall not deny you the pleasure of savoring the impending death and destruction.
Let us deliver Morag into the hands of my master, that Death may finally claim her!
A great slaughter is coming, a magnificent feast of bloodshed and death has been laid before the Silent Lord. But before my master gorges himself, there is something you must hear.
I have devoted myself to the worship and service of the Silent Lord, <FirstName>. I exist only to deliver others into the grasp of my master; I am an instrument of Death.

To serve my master I have fought at your side. I have seen the mark of the Silent Lord upon you, and I am humbled in your presence. You have been touched by Death, and all living creatures tremble at your approach.
You still refuse to see admit the truth. But I have seen with my own eyes the gruesome fate of those who oppose you.
I have delivered many into the service of the Silent Lord in our time together, but you have always been the catalyst of my actions. It is only at your side that my potential has been fully realized.
Since joining you in your quest I have seen Death in all its glory, and I have at last achieved an enlightened understanding of the Silent Lord that surpasses even the teachings of my Order.
It may be my time to bow down to the Silent Lord in this coming battle; but at last I am truly ready to accept his claim upon me. For this I thank you, <FirstName>.
Your words are true. The maw of the Silent Lord gapes wide, eager to feast upon the Old Ones who cheated him of his just due through their hibernation within the Source Stone.

The maw of the Silent Lord gapes wide, eager to feast upon the Old Ones who have cheated him of his just due with their hibernation within the Source Stone. I would willingly sacrifice my own life to feed my master's hunger.
Me too busy, you quiet now, Linu.
I'm too busy right now, Linu.
Me gots no time for you whining. We go now.
I have no time for your chatter. Let's go.
*Sigh* Okay. What you want say?
*Sigh* All right. What did you want to say?
What you want talk 'bout, Linu?
Yes Linu, what did you want to talk about?
Ya big deal. We go now, right?
What ever. Let's just get going, okay?
That be part of hero job. Me must make others be strong too.
That's the job of a hero. We inspire others to greatness.
You be hero like me, Linu. We be team.
We have been a team, Linu. You too are a hero.
Okay, Linu, me get point.
Okay Linu, I get the point.
'Nuff talk. We go fight now.
Enough speeches, we need to get going now.
Thank you, Linu.
Linu, me not see you do clumsy things whole time we be team. Maybe you just be nervous lots?
Linu, in all the time we have been together, you have never done any of these clumsy things. Maybe it's just a lack of confidence.
Dear <FirstName>, I would like to talk to you for a moment.
Of... of course you are. It was foolish of me to interrupt you; I had just wanted to share something with you, but it is of no matter.
Then we face our destiny together.
We are about to go into a desperate battle, where we might lose our lives <FullName>. I feel that I need to share something with you.
This battle that we face with Morag frightens me desperately. I didn't think I would ever be able to face this day, though I have known it would come for some time now.
Yet now that the time has come at last, I find that I have mastered my fear, and it is all because of you. I have drawn courage from following the greatest hero of our time - <FullName>.
All right, <FirstName>. I won't waste any more of your time with my boring thoughts.
Well, I need all the inspiration I can get. If it weren't for you I would still be trapped or dead in a plague-ridden NeverWinter.
Thank you for the compliment, but I would still be trapped or dead in a plague-ridden NeverWinter if it weren't for you.

That's if I hadn't managed to burn the entire city down around me. I can't tell you the number of nightmares I've had about this coming battle, where I would slip in some blood and knock you into a huge chasm.

Or I would start to cast a healing spell and it would go wrong and you'd be turned inside out. Or you would be just about to kill Morag and I'd lean against a giant boulder that would fall over and crush you.
I have learned from your confidence and skill, and I truly believe that, no matter what happens next, I am a stronger, better person than I was when we first met.
I know now that I can have all the grace and elegance of my elven ancestors. I just have to believe in myself.
That is a lesson I don't think I would have learned without you, <FirstName>.
I couldn't agree more.
Now let's go show them what legends are made of and kick some scaly-ass!
I was just about to say that.
Only that me brings your loud mouth along.
Me regret we not kissed. That counts?
No. Me has no regrets.
A few, maybes.
Only that I brought your loud mouth along.
I regret we've never kissed. Does that count?
No. No regrets.
A few, perhaps.
Me not only hero, Sharwyn.
Me like being hero. Is good.
You not be such big fool. Me does this because coin is good.
Me doing this because it be right... not to be hero.
I won't be the only hero, Sharwyn.
Nothing wrong with being a hero, I suppose.
Don't be a fool. I do this because the money is good.
I'm doing this because it's right, not to be a hero.
Bah. Is all foolish business.
Hmph. They writes what they likes. Me want royalties.
Me not be any legend...
Me be happy if things be normal after this.
Bah. It's a foolish business.
They can write what they like, so long as I get the royalties.
I don't think I'm a legend...
I'll just be happy if things go back to normal after this.
You gets ahead of things, no?
Ha! You is on own after this.
Who know what happens?
Me too, Sharwyn.
Aren't you being a bit premature?
Ha! You're on your own after this.
Who knows what will happen?
So would I, Sharwyn.
Not really. You're a grown <man/woman>. I'm sure you can handle yourself and even lead little old me, no?
So the end draws near, does it? I suppose all tales must end sooner or later. Any regrets, <FirstName>?
Hah! Say what you like, <FirstName>... my own legend is being written right alongside yours, whether you like it or not. I'm glad to play my part.
But I needn't speak more and ruffle your feathers. Let's finish this tale as it should be finished. Shall we?
Ha ha! Well, I guess some regrets are meant to be, then, aren't they? Nice try, though.
It's not as if you'll be lacking for company should we succeed, <FirstName>. You'll be a hero throughout Faerun with women falling at your feet. You know that, don't you?
I don't know. Maybe. I suspect I could be talked into it... especially since both our deaths could literally be around the next corner.
I didn't think so. After all... when this is finally over all of Faerun will celebrate you as a true hero. You know that, don't you?
Truly? Perhaps you will forget them once this is finally over. All of Faerun will celebrate you as a true hero after this. You know that, don't you?
That's kind of you to say, <FirstName>. Regardless, you will be the one the bards write of when they tell your legend.
Indeed. You will have earned your place, I think. They will be writing of your legend for an age to come, <FirstName>.
I didn't suggest that all heroes are altruistic paladins... but that's how they end up somehow, isn't it? I wonder how bards will write your legend?
You know, that's what I like about you. I'll have to make sure your tale is penned properly. I'm sure I won't be the only bard eager to write of your legend.
Well said. I'll have to remember to quote you on that one.
Ha! Deny it if you wish, <FirstName>, your fate is sealed.
I doubt things will ever be truly normal for you again, <FirstName>. I envy you.
As for me... I suppose I've you to thank for taking me this far. If I live, I think I'll have my own great tale to find in the years to come. If I'm lucky.
Of course... that doesn't mean we need part ways, necessarily. I've grown rather fond of our pairing. I'd enjoy continuing our travels, if you would.
I suppose that's how it has to be. Too bad. At any rate... we've one tale to finish before I go writing the next.
True enough. I suppose we've one tale to finish, first, before I start writing the next, anyway.
Good. Of course... we've one tale to finish, first, before we start writing the next, don't we?
Lead away, then, <FirstName>... let's finish this like it was meant to be.
The drow are an evil subrace of elves, living deep underground in the dangerous Underdark.
Baelnorns are elven spellcasters that have used their magic to extend their lives, usually to become a protector to family and friends or as a mentor and teacher to new generations.
This elixir smells sweet, similar to honeysuckle, and contains a small amount of liquid inside that bubbles faintly. It's use is unknown, though it is likely a curative of some form.

Pale imitations of true Bags of Holding, these lesser creations bear only a tenuous connection to the distant planes. Items held within still exist (and therefore retain some portion of their mass) on the Prime Material. The degree to which this is true varies according to the bag's craftsmanship.
These magic containers are essential for inventory management, and can hold many items, both large and small. The weight of the items within will still be a factor, however, especially when added to that of the container itself.

Prized by pack rats far and wide, Bags of Holding originated among the mischievous kender in the far-off world of Krynn. According to popular folklore, one enterprising kender actually founded a utopian village inside his Bag of Holding. It apparently continues to thrive to this very day.
Spider Properties
Ettercap Properties
Your flesh crawls as your fingers close around the gruesome fetishes that dangle from this wand. The elven femur that forms its shaft is yellowed and worn smooth by the oils of countless hands.

The enchantment on a Wand of Summoning owes much to the ancient magics crafted by followers of forgotten beast totems, though the modern example can hardly be called a divinely inspired tool. Sorcerers and wizards take inspiration from many places, and the resulting mix of incantations can bear little resemblance to the rituals they might have once been a part of.
Wand of Lesser Summoning
The marble is smooth and cool to the touch. This pool is where important items that have been lost appear.

NW_LOSTITEMS
City Core: Refugee Shelter
Well, I had hoped to give more, but disturbing news has reached me. There were others searching for the tombs as well and... some of what we sought now rests in evil hands.
I don't understand how this could have happened, but representatives of Talona have begin taunting us in a most unfriendly fashion... flaunting their theft in our faces.
You'll understand if I forgo further reward, won't you? We will need our resources to try and puzzle out what happened in this search.
I must apologize, however, if my mood seems somber. I have received word that... that the followers of Talona have laid claim to the artifacts in the tombs we were searching.
There are no more artifacts for you to find... they have been delivered into the hands of evil. I cannot fathom what has made this possible.
Needless to say, you are no longer needed for this task. I am sorry...
Oh dear... you seem to have contracted some form of sickness. You are lucky that it doesn't appear to be the plague, but I cannot certify you as disease-free until you rid yourself of it.
I would you suggest you go at once to Aribeth. She will be able to cure this affliction.
Forgive me. You are still investigating the plague, and I must be thankful for that.
It is despicable... imagine, our holy relics that we sought... in the hands of evil! We were searching for the ancient tombs... but now there is little point.
Bye then.
Farewell.
Me ask you some stuff?
Can I ask you some questions?
Yeah, yous too busy scaring animals and kids.
Yes, I see. Too busy scaring the animals and your children.
No, no, me think you right. Kids should know they is better than beasts.
No, You misunderstand. I approve. The children should know where they stand.
You said it. Me leave now.
Well said. Sorry to have bothered you.
Oh yeah, and yelling at animals in stinky cages is best way to show that.
Of course. And taunting the animals while they huddle in cages is the perfect way to show that.
Yeah, no hurt. But yous let them rot in there because you better than them.
Oh, no pain, of course. Just let them rot in there as a symbol of your superiority.
Me sorry. Bye.
Forgive my jest. Farewell.
I know. Yous do a good job of looking like a jerk by youself.
I know you don't. You make enough of an ass of yourself alone.
Bah, me not waste time with yous.
Don't worry. I won't waste my time on you.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I would guess you are afraid of the plague. At least here you still think you have control.
Yes, yes, just go.
Most certainly not. I don't waste my time with guards or other rabble. Go protect some wench. I don't need you here.
What did you say to me? Listen, <boy/girl>, I am important. I don't need to take that kind of abuse from the likes of you.
Er... yes... yes, that is what I intended. Especially in these strained times. The beasts are below and we are above. Remembering that gives us strength.
Well... you don't want to cause the beast too much discomfort... I don't mean...
Now see here, I don't need your veiled insults!
That is quite the proclamation. Right out of the blue you thought of that, hmm? Or perhaps you've been saving it for just such an occasion as this?
You sound worse than that fool of a druid, Nyatar, talking all high and mighty, not considering commerce or tradition. That kind of... of... "do-goodery" just makes me sick.
Go on, leave me be. I don't need this... this preaching from you. Not now. Not in times like this.
No. I am in no mood. Take a walk.
Bye bye.
Farewell.
Maybe me ask you some things?
Can I ask you some questions?
Hey, you hear me at all?
Uh, hello? Can you hear me?
Times sure have changed, I think.
Yes, sir, not like the old days. Not at all.
(cough) Things used to be very different. Very different.
'Scuse me, me gots to go.
Excuse me, I must be leaving.
Me gots to ask you some questions.
I want to ask you some questions.
What yous know of this place?
What do you know of this place?
Back to other questions, okay?
Let's go back to my other questions.
You knows him at all?
Are you acquainted with him?
Who Bill? Why he want kids to come heres?
Who is Billiam? Why does he insist these children come here?
If yous not like this place, why yous let it keep going?
If you don't like this place, why do you permit it to continue?
Well, me gonna shut this place up tight!
I will see this place shut down!
Who is yous?
Who are you?
Fare you well in this difficult time.
Oh, please no. I'm not in any mood to talk. It's bad enough I'm even here, but Billiam, he insists the children come.
I know we are here all too often. All hours of the day, it seems. Billiam looks at the animals and thinks of old conquests. I suppose we all have our retreats in hard times.
I don't care for the conditions the beasts are kept in, but I have no say in that. Montgomery Weatherson directs the place.
No, and I don't really care to. I am tolerant of my Billiam's rough edges, but I see no reason to go looking for others with a similar bent.
Billiam is my husband. He's not adjusting well to the plague. I imagine he feels helpless, and doesn't want the children to feel the same way.
He means well, but I question his methods. I don't much care for this place.
I'm not sure who you think I am, but I don't have that kind of influence. Many people support the zoo. Many would oppose closing it down.
The druid Nyatar had begun talks to make changes, but now that the plague has everyone's attention I guess the animals don't seem that important.
Will you, now? I won't be particularly sad to see it go. I won't get involved, however. I have enough to worry about, as it is.
My name is Lady Zemeria. I am just a citizen of the Blacklake. You'll forgive me if I don't feel like going into more detail? The troubles of the day weigh heavily on my mind.
How you knows about artifact stuff to start?
How did you know of the artifacts to begin with?
You was there and didn't help the dying guys?
You were there and didn't help the dying?
You evil dumb-head! Give me Jacob's write-y thing NOW!
That's despicable! Give me Jacob's quill NOW!
What in the Hells do you want? What reason would I have to speak with you?
Someone, after all, has already delivered the remainder of those disgustingly pure Tyrran artifacts to Oleff. Oh yes, I have spies even there!
Did you think you could return to me and expect accolades for allowing this to happen? Are you a fool? Bah! Get out of my sight!
I visited the dig in the Peninsula district. They need to hire outsiders like you. Their own brethren are falling like flies.
Well, I helped myself to some of their belongings. Got a fine quill off one of them. Jacob was his name, I think.
He won't be needing it. I assume he's dead. He didn't react much when I rolled him over to go through his pockets.
Someone else has already seen to the retrieval of the remaining Tyrran artifacts. The followers of Talona are joyous today.
You have served well, but the followers of Talona are done with you. Leave me be.
That is, if you deserved it! You allowed other of these artifacts to be returned to Oleff! Perhaps you were trying to spare your conscience, but it will do no good.
I will see that the followers of Talona use what we have already been given to torment the fools of Tyr. Get out of my sight.
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
If he snuck yous in, maybe backdoor thingy still work?
It is, after all, the duty of the people to watch over their own. What say you?
Wait... haven't I already pleaded my case to you? Certainly you see the need to act in this instance?
Oh, and you'll probably want to deliver the key to Formosa as well. Besides the Dryad's cage, it also opens my warehouses. Now go. Get out.
I don't welcome strangers in my estate!
You were not invited. Get out!
A very good choice. Something else as well, perhaps?
Sorry, but you don't have enough Smugglers' Coins for that. Something else, perhaps?
Very good. Would you care for anything else?
Excellent choice. Something else as well, perhaps?
You don't have enough Smugglers' Coins for that. Can I interest you in something else?
Very good. Something else for you?
Fine, fine. Is there something else as well?
You don't have enough Smugglers' Coins to purchase that. Is there anything else that you want?
Go talk to Vengual. He's the boss.
Can you do something? Can you? I don't see how...
Where do we go now? Plague... zombies... where?
I guess I should have tried to get to the City Core. There's certainly no help coming to us here.
How long before they get in here? Zombies are mindless, but they'll smell us... they'll throw themselves at the doors. We're all going to die...
My neighbor... he died of the plague. Then he came back as a zombie. That's not going to happen to me... is it? IS IT!
Where are the guards? Where is Lord Nasher? They left us to die! To die!
Is there anything anyone can do? Anything? It's the damned walking dead out there, for crying out loud!
What is wrong with this city? Plague... zombies... did we kick the Fates' dog or something?
You'd think the guards could have done something... but no... nothing... they stood on the wall...
Lost everyone. We all just ran... don't know where the family is. No clue...
Gotta look at the good side, you know? Zombies don't loot. I might have a home to go back to when this is over.
Zombies chased me the whole way here. I'm lucky to be alive.
I'm glad this place is here. I could have tried to get to the Helmite sanctuary, but I really needed a drink.
Whew... lucky to have made it here. They killed everything... and then those dead got up... I barely got here.
I don't believe it. We can leave? The undead are gone? Thank you... thank you if you did this...
These are the last days... I'm sure of it. Plague, undead... all we need is a plague of vermin and I'm calling it quits.
What is left... nothing. The living fear the plague... the dead can't rest. Why go on?
Slow death to plague or quick death to zombies... maybe the undead are the merciful way out after all.
I heard some people tried to get to the City Core but the guards wouldn't let them out past the gate. They didn't want the plague to spread...
Where do we go now... there's nowhere. We just wait for the zombies to get us here, I guess...
At least you can outrun zombies for a while, but the plague... I don't have a clue how to avoid that.
I guess I could have tried to go to the Helmite sanctuary... but they are always treating plague victims there. I don't want to get sick...
What can you trust if you can't trust the dead to stay down? How can anything be normal after that?
So this is where I will die... great. They can't keep the zombies out forever...
Can you understand having nothing? Having to leave everything or die? Can anyone understand...
I hate this place. Fools trying to act like everything will be okay. Well, nothing is okay... we're all doomed.
What do you want? I've nothing for you... I had to leave everyting to flee the zombies... I've nothing...
Is there nothing the guards can do? Burn down the Great Graveyard? Something? Anything...
I'm... I'm at the bottom. Things can't get worse. Who'd have thought this was how it would end?
I am so grateful. I... I'm just stunned that someone would bother to help us... thank you.
The Great Graveyard is in the north. It was barricaded until recently. I understand that all is quiet there now. Good. Perhaps now the dead can rest.
Well, as I understand it, the Beggar's Nest is no longer infested with undead, so it is fairly safe to venture outside.
Of course, I still welcome all that would seek the word of Helm. The plague still rages. We are far from true safety.
I understand it was one of the Waterdhavian creatures... a yuan-ti. Such horrid creatures. I do not know why it did what it did.
Ultimately, it doesn't matter. She is dead and the zombie threat is over. Of course, people should still come here. The plague still rages.
Thanks for getting rid of Drawl. Jerks like him are exactly why I quit the gang to become a guard. He got what he deserved for what he did to the others.
This stone altar hums with energy. It would not take much to shatter the stressed structure.

Moonstone Mask: An Evil Offer

Gilles, an unquestionably evil character in the Moonstone Mask, has made an offer. He has heard that Oleff seeks the tombs of Halueth Never and the artifacts within. Gilles would like these artifacts to be delivered to him, instead of Oleff. He will pay well, though it is obvious he intends to defile and misuse the items.

One of the Tyrran artifacts associated with Halueth Never has been given to Gilles, the evil representative of the rival church of Talona. Gilles eagerly waits for the last two items in the Moonstone Mask, hoping that he will soon be able to exploit this triumph over Oleff and the followers of Tyr.

Two of the Tyrran artifacts associated with Halueth Never have been given to Gilles, the evil representative of the rival church of Talona. Gilles eagerly waits for the last item in the Moonstone Mask, hoping that he will soon be able to exploit this triumph over Oleff and the followers of Tyr.

Gilles is triumphant. With gold and guile he has secured all of the Tyrran artifacts relating to Halueth Never. This will be a great blow to the morale of Oleff and the other followers of Tyr. A very selfish act has taken place today.

Gilles is partially satisfied that not all of the Tyrran artifacts made it to Oleff in the Hall of Justice. Those delivered to Gilles, will be used by the followers of Talona to torment the Tyrrans. It will cause years of tension between the two groups.

Gilles has had his evil mischief foiled. He wanted to sabatage the Tyrran search for the artifacts in the tombs of Halueth Never, but all were given to Oleff at the Hall of Justice. The followers of Talona will have to find some other way to amuse themselves now.
Gilles has been told to leave, taking whatever plans he has for the Tyrran artifacts with him. Oleff will likely be interested in the quill that Gilles had stolen.
A key has been found on Meldanen. The mage did not seem a reasonable sort, so perhaps he has an enemy that would be interested in it. His personal records may reveal a likely candidate.

A tooth has been taken from the mouth of Meldanen. The mage did not seem a reasonable sort, so perhaps he has an enemy that would be interested in it. His personal records may reveal a likely candidate.

A key has been found on Meldanen. The mage did not seem a reasonable sort, so perhaps he has an enemy that would be interested in it. He mentioned someone named Formosa, so she is as likely a candidate as any.

A tooth has been taken from the mouth of Meldanen. The mage did not seem a reasonable sort, so perhaps he has an enemy that would be interested in it. He mentioned someone named Formosa, so she is as likely a candidate as any.

A silver tooth has been taken from the mouth of Meldanen, and a key was found as well. The mage did not seem a reasonable sort, so perhaps he has an enemy that would be interested in these items. His personal records may reveal a likely candidate.

A silver tooth has been taken from the mouth of Meldanen, and a key was found as well. The mage did not seem a reasonable sort, so perhaps he has an enemy that would be interested in these items. He mentioned someone named Formosa, so she is as likely a candidate as any.
Any task that Formosa might have wanted completed has been indefinitely postponed. She is now dead.

The key to Meldanen's warehouse has been delivered to Formosa, but she has been told in no uncertain terms that Meldanen will not be killed. She will have to be content that half her goal has been achieved.
Hints of Conspiracy

An odd note was found after an attack by an apparently fanatical group of assassins. It suggested that an unknown group is helping spread the plague, and is actively working against a cure. The note should be taken to someone in authority.

A troubling note was found after an attack by a fanatical group of assassins. If it is to be believed, there may be a cult of some sort working against the city of Neverwinter and opposing a cure for the plague. The note should be taken to someone in authority.

A disturbing note was found after an attack by a fanatical group of assassins. It appeared to suggest that there is a traitor amongst the people of Neverwinter responsible for the attack on the Academy, and who is working against the city even now. The note should be taken to someone in authority.

Fenthick was given the odd note that suggested an unknown group is spreading the plague and working against a cure. He is uncertain how important the information is, a feeling reinforced by Desther's skepticism. Nevertheless, he will consider it and make what sense of it he can. All effort is appreciated in the current crisis.

Fenthick was given the troubling note that suggested a fanatical cult may be operating in Neverwinter and actively opposing the efforts to cure the plague. While the information is alarming, he is not certain if it is to be believed, or how it should impact the search for the cure. Desther encouraged him to dismiss it as hearsay. Nevertheless, he will consider it and make what sense of it he can. All effort is appreciated in the current crisis.

Fenthick was given the disturbing note that suggested a traitor may have been responsible for the attack on the Academy, and may still be working against the city. Fenthick appeared reluctant to act on the information, echoing Desther's concern that such potentially unfounded accusations could do more harm than good right now. Nevertheless, he will consider it and make what sense of it he can. All effort is appreciated in the current crisis.

The salvaged brain of the Waterdhavian intellect devourer has been delivered to Aribeth. She was understandably glad to see it. Although the item has been given to Aribeth, Sedos Sebile, the ranking officer in the Peninsula, would likely still give a reward for the discovery as well.
The uprising at the Peninsula district prison has been quelled and the brain of the Waterdhavian intellect devourer behind it has been delivered to Aribeth. Sedos also gave a reward for the task.

All of the artifacts to be found in the tombs of Halueth Never and his companions have been accounted for. Unfortunately, some of them are now in the hands of a rival church. Oleff was understandably disturbed by this, though there is little he, or anyone, can do. For whatever reason, an evil hand had a part in this quest.

All of the artifacts to be found in the tombs of Halueth Never and his companions have been accounted for. Unfortunately, they are all in the hands of a rival church. Oleff was understandably disturbed by this, but there is little he, or anyone, can do. For whatever reason, an evil hand had a part in this quest.

As the Wailing Death spread across Neverwinter, it was soon apparent that it was not a natural affliction. It couldn't be cured by normal means, and the holiest of clerics found their divine healing useless. To fortify the city and aid in investigating the plague, Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande called for all adventurers of promise to attend the Neverwinter Academy, and also sought help from some of the greatest wizards in the Realms, including the great archmage of Waterdeep, Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun.
Arunsun sent a collection of magical creatures to the city, with instructions on how they might be used as reagents in a potential cure. The beasts were stored at the Academy, and with the most promising recruits graduating, the site became too tempting a target for Neverwinter's unseen enemy. In the ensuing attack, all but a handful of students were killed, and the Waterdhavian creatures fled into the night.
Fenthick, Desther, and especially Lady Aribeth should be sought out. They will know what course of action should be taken in this troubling time.

Who you be?
Who are you?
Greetings, <FirstName>. Aribeth has instructed me to provide whatever assistance I can to you in your mission.
However my magic is not of a healing nature. My skills are tied to the teleportation portal in this temple and the Stone of Recall in your backpack. Is there something I can do for you, <FirstName>?
I am Sergol, a priest of Tyr. It is my duty to aid and assist those in the service of Neverwinter, though I am no healer.
My magic is tied to the Stone of Recall in your backpack and the teleportation portal you see in this room.
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
I thought you would be familiar with this by now. However, it is important so I will go over the use of the Stone of Recall again.
In your backpack you carry a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly teleport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
You will arrive at the teleportation portal in the next room. This will allow you to return quickly if the need arises, saving precious travelling time.
There is more, <FirstName>. Once you have used the stone to return, go through the teleportation portal and it will instantly send you back to the place your stone was last activated.
Anyone in your service - henchmen, familiars and the like - will also be transported with you. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
You're lucky to be alive. We barely managed to bring you back; your soul had nearly departed to the afterlife.
Hurry back to your mission, <FirstName>. Desther must not be allowed to escape judgment.
I can help you return to the site of your last battle, but are you sure you want to go back so soon?
Whatever you were fighting will still be there. It would be wiser to prepare yourself before returning to that encounter.
Or perhaps you should use the teleportation portal to return to the spot where you last activated your Stone of Recall.
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
I thought you would be familiar with this by now. However, it is important so I will go over the use of the Stone of Recall again.

In your backpack you carry a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly teleport you and anyone in your service back to the ritual room You will appear in the teleportation portal in the next room.
This will allow you to return quickly to this temple whenever you need to, saving precious travelling time.
There is more, <FirstName>. Once you have used the stone, go through the teleportation portal at any time and it will instantly send you back to the place your stone was last activated.
Anyone in your service - henchmen, familiars and the like - will also be transported with you. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
As you wish. I can use my magic to return you to the site you just came from. This will return you to your last battle. Are you ready?
As you wish. Prepare yourself, <FirstName>.
Hmmm. I thought you would have been familiar with this process by now. Very well, I shall explain it to you myself.
You are one of Aribeth's most important agents. After all you have done for Neverwinter she wants me to keep watch over you personally.
Before your mission started I cast a Word of Recall spell upon you, so that whenever you become mortally wounded I can immediately teleport you here to safety.
Just now, some enemy must have struck you a near fatal blow, and so the spell's contingency magics activated and whisked you away to safety.
I can't do that, <FirstName>. You are too important. Neverwinter has need of your skills now more than ever. We can't risk an untimely demise.
As soon as your battered body appeared, the other clerics here called upon the healing power of Tyr to bring you back from the brink of death.
You are now as ready as you'll ever be to continue with your mission. The Recall spell will activate again if you are dealt another fatal blow.
The spell doesn't require your presence. I simply needed to know your full name, which Aribeth provided.
I am Sergol, a priest of Tyr. It is my duty to aid and assist those in the service of Neverwinter.
Ah. You have awakened. I need to speak with you.
We are very disappointed in you, <FirstName>. Your slaughter of innocent people has caused much suffering in a time already overburdened with tragedy.
Were it up to me you would have been left to rot in your grave; however, Aribeth has ordered me to resurrect you. Despite your actions, Neverwinter still has need of you.
You will suffer no further consequences for your mad killing spree, but I implore you not to engage in such wholesale slaughter again. Please, focus on the mission you have been given.
He say what "People of the Eye" supposed to do?
Has he shed any light on the purpose of the "People of the Eye?"
He rants about everything, but I can't make sense of it. They are fanatics... insane... they must be. Why else would all this have happened?
*sob*
Yes... I knew you would come...
Who this Dumal guy?
Who is Dumal?
I don't wanna die... I don't. When's this nightmare gonna end?
Dumal? He used to be in charge, or at least close to it. I'm sorry, I really didn't know a lot about how the Hold was run. Dad kept up on all that.
He was nice, though. He might still be alive somewhere. I think he was kept alive so they could know how to act. Not sure, though.

False Helmite Elite

Despite its size, this well-maintained tome is exceptionally light. The pages also seem to have a strange, almost warming glow. Inside is revealed the methods by which the Guardian Spirit of Helm's Hold may be restored, should an evil entity have displaced it, though the taint must first be banished by other means. Simply having this book in one's backpack will allow the use of a properly prepared altar.
WP_MapNote

Boddyknock Glinkle, a gnomish sorcerer from the island of Lantan, has joined your cause. Though not skilled in melee combat, his arcane spells will be a valuable tool in the many battles that lie ahead. His magic might also prove useful in opening any stubborn locks you might come across.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to Aribeth's side in the ritual room. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Daelan Red Tiger, a noble barbarian of the Uthgardt tribes, has joined his mighty axe to your cause. His ferocity and prowess in melee combat will be helpful in the many battles you are sure to face. Daelen can also use his great strength to try and bash open any chests or locked doors you might come across.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to Aribeth's side in the ritual room. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Tomi "Grin" Undergallows, a halfling thief of dubious character and widespread reputation, has joined his nimble fingers to your cause. His ability to pick locks will prove invaluable throughout your adventures, as will his skill in detecting and disarming traps. Though not eager to go toe to toe with an enemy in combat, Tomi's sneak attacks on an opponent's exposed flank can be devastating.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to Aribeth's side in the ritual room. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Grimgnaw, a macabre dwarven monk who worships Death itself, has joined your cause. With deadly feats like Stunning Fist and Flurry of Blows, Grimgnaw is a powerful ally in combat.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to Aribeth's side in the ritual room. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Linu La'neral, an elven cleric of Sehanine Moonbow, has joined your cause. Her divine spells, particularly her healing magic, will be invaluable in the many battles that lie ahead. As well, her ability to turn undead should not be underestimated.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to Aribeth's side in the ritual room. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Sharwyn, a beautiful bard determined to make a legend for herself, has joined your cause. Her skill in combat is augmented by a variety of spells and healing magic, and her powerful bard song will inspire those who fight by her side to heroic victory.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to Aribeth's side in the ritual room. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.
Your henchman has been spirited away to the ritual room where Aribeth has saved them from a grisly end. You can use the Stone of Recall to return to the ritual room and reclaim your companion.
You have released your henchman from service. If you wish to rejoin with your companion you can find them in the place you last left them.
