Well... it's not that I can't. Neurik says I shouldn't talk about it if I want to... to stop thinking about it. If he said it was okay, though, I guess I could...
I... I know Alhelor likes to, but I really shouldn't talk about it, <sir/madam>, I'm sorry. You could ask Neurik about the beast, though, if you wanted.
He is the priest at the temple of Tyr. He knows a lot about the Black Wolf. Well... he knows a lot about everything, really.
Well... it's not that I can't. Neurik says I shouldn't talk about it if I want to... to stop thinking about it. If he said it was okay, though, I guess I could...
Oh. He lives near the pond of water at the town's center. It's a fairly small house. Modest, you know? Alhelor's usually here, but he said he was tired.
Wh-what? That can't be right. Are you joking with me, <sir/madam>?
I... that's so... I don't doubt your word, though. Alhelor was always a bit odd, somehow. I just never suspected... what a fool I've been!

Thank you for telling me, <sir/madam>. I'll definitely watch out for him. I haven't seen Alhelor since he went back to his home by the pond. If you hurry, you can catch him there and kill him once and for all!
My name is Ander, <sir/madam>. I help Alhelor here when he has need of it.
You don't remember me? Oh, maybe not... my name is Ander and I help Alhelor sell his werewolf remedies.
Are... are you with <CUSTOM2103>? You've got to help, <sir/madam>, please!
Alhelor is really the Black Wolf! He really is! He's down at his house by the pond right now... you've got to stop him before he hurts anyone else!
You've got to go and kill that Black Wolf, <sir/madam>! Please, before he hurts anyone else!
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
What you doings here, then?
What are you doing here, then?
Tells me 'bout yourself.
Tell me more about yourself.
Not that it's truly any of your business, but I am seeking passage to Evermeet. The way is closed to me, however, and seeking an alternative route is proving difficult.
If you haven't heard much of Elaith Craulnober, I'll certainly not be the one to educate you. Let the tongues of others guide you as they will, it matters not to me.
Oh, there's sure to be a war, there is. Everyone's talking about it!
Don't travel north, <sir/madam>. There's bandits on the road.
Be careful... everyone's talking about the werewolves in these parts.
Hope you aren't heading to Luskan. The city's been shut tight, I hear.
Oh... you must be one of the mercenaries come to town, right?
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Me need get money for new tax from you.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> I'm here to collect the new tavern tax.
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> You pay, or me close you place down. Aribeth and Nasher say so.
Ha! Me fool you good.
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> You'll pay, or this tavern will be shut down on the orders of Lady Aribeth and Lord Nasher.
Calm down man, it was only a joke.
A tax on taverns? That's outrageous! Lord Nasher must be out of his mind. Forget it, I'll never pay.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Lady Aribeth wants to come down here and ask for more taxes in person, then I'll talk to her.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Fine, here's 50 gold. It's a real shame when a ruler thinks he can just tax his subjects for every little thing.
Now what do you want?
A joke? You can't even begin to know how not funny that kind of joke is to an innkeep. Well... no harm done... I suppose. What can I do for you?
I already paid that tax to another person, so just forget about it. Now what do you want.
You're one of them folks from Neverwinter, aren't ya?
I can't believe Luskan's port has been closed up. No entry, they says. That was one of our major stops!
Wonder if they'll be opening the Luskan port soon.
Hope you're not itching for a ride on the ship. We barely got room for the cargo an' crew.
I wonder if them soldiers will ever catch that cult? I hate to think they'd get away with it.
Supplies to Neverwinter - supplies to Neverwinter, back and forth; we'll never match their needs for years.
I heard them talking about werewolves in the bar. I'd better not see 'em, or I'll never make port here again.
Wanna race?
You're funny!
Want to play plague? I'll die this time.
Go away!
I'm not allowed outside of town.
My brother says there are criminals and werewolves about.
You want to play werewolf?
Hee hee!
That was fun!
I'm beat. Let's play again tomorrow.
The werewolf's gonna come getcha!
I'm hungry.
I'm bored.
I'm Karathis the Werewolf! Rooaar!
North: North Road, Green Griffon Inn, Luskan, and Port Llast. East: Neverwinter Wood. South: South Road and Charwood.
Thank you so much for helping us out. I was afraid we'd never get to leave. Good luck, my <lord/lady>.
I kill da trolls, so you be safe to leave now.
You no need help find way out?
The way back is cleared of trolls; find your own way out.
Don't you need help getting back to Revat?
What do you think I am, senile? Of course I know the way is clear. I can make it back on my own, and I don't need you to tell me so.
What do I look like, somebody's weak, old granny? I'm a powerful mage and I can make my own way back, now that the spell is broken.
Not that I don't appreciate what you did, but you could have been a little faster about it. See you on the surface.
Aawill is the Archdruid. He takes care of things around here and makes sure everything runs smoothly. Jaer is second-in-command, in charge of circle challenges. Anything else?
Aawill is the Archdruid. He's the one to go to if you want to assist the grove with something like the troubles we're having right now. Jaer is second-in-command, in charge of circle challenges.
Sorry, but it's a druid thing. A <class> like you wouldn't understand it, so that's all I'm gonna tell ya.
Only druids can enter the challenges, sorry.
Goodbye.
No.
Yes.
I am in charge of the druid circle challenges. When a druid wants to become a member of our grove, he or she must challenge one of our members to gain entry to the first circle.
Do you understand so far?
We are all creatures of nature, and just as some of nature's children hunt alone, while others hunt in packs, we too have our individual preferences.
Each of the defenders in our circle has an animal companion who fights at his or her side. You too will enter combat with an animal companion, and a human follower, if you have one.
Everyone is working hard to recover from the death of the Spirit. It will be a long haul, but it's a battle worth fighting. Anything else?
Well, because of you, everything has pretty much returned to normal around here. Anything else?
There is nothing more I can do for you, Champion of the Grove. I am proud to have witnessed your ascension.

Jaer, the very serious young woman over there, meets with druids who wish to either join, or improve their standing in the circle of druids. She organizes challenge fights between the druid seeking improvement and the defender of the appropriate circle.
Are there any other questions you have for me <lad/lass>?
Not that the animals in this wood are fighting with intelligence, but that's another subject entirely. Do you have questions you would like to ask about anything else?

If a druid comes to the grove and wants to join, then he or she must talk Jaer into setting up a challenge with the defender of the fourth circle. If the challenger wins, he or she is allowed to join the fourth circle. Jaer has just recently promoted me to defender.
The forest has returned to its natural state.
You tell me all you know, and no time waste me.
Just tell me everything you know and stop wasting my time!
What you mean others? Tell me, please.
What do you mean, most of the others? This is important.
Dwarf be in pool?
Was the dwarf's body in the pool?
Me needs the dagger. You gots it?
I need that dagger. Do you have it?
Now you are mine!
You were here to kill me. That was what I thought the moment I felt your presence near my tree. I... I just wanted to stop you. Could you ever forgive me?
Just barely. My ability to control them has been weakening for a while now.
Nevermind. I'm sorry I lost control. Should I continue?
A dwarf came here a few weeks ago. He was fierce and mean and seemed immune to my charms. He asked me about the dagger that the druid had used to kill himself.
I don't know how he knew about the druid, but I had kept the dagger as a keepsake of the druid. When he threatened me, I gave it to him.
I never saw the dwarf again, but shortly before everything started going wrong in the forest, I found the dagger in front of the altar.
No, now that you mention it, his corpse wasn't there.
I brought it back here, but I don't remember where I put it, because the pain hit me before I made it back here.
I'm sure it's somewhere in my house though. If you look around, you should be able to find it, but you shouldn't use it! I don't want another death on my hands; they are so bloody already.
Leave the altar.
Draw forth the dagger and plunge it into your chest and have your henchman do the same.
Draw forth the dagger and plunge it into your chest.
There is nothing you can do here at this time.
The ceremonial dagger has disappeared, it seems that portal has been closed for good.
An ancient altar, covered in grotesque carvings, bloodstains (some fairly recent) and surrounded by bones, looms ominously beneath the waterfall.
<StartCheck>Your senses are blasted with all colors, all sounds, all feelings, all tastes and all scents imaginable.</Start>
No.
Yes.
You can catch glimpses of the Neverwinter Wood in this swirling portal. Do you wish to enter?
Kill for the mistress!
What has happened to me? Where am I? I must find my family!
Me cure Spirit of Wood, so you rest easy.
I have cured the Spirit of the Wood. You no longer need to worry about that problem.
Spirit be dead. Me need kill it, so me did.
The Spirit is dead. I'm afraid I had to kill it.
Me not sure if there be other way, but this be fast way.
Well, there might have been another way, but this was the quickest.
Me not have choice. Me be sad that Spirit dead.
I had no other choice. If I could have done it some other way, I would have.
You must be the kind of hero that legends are born of. How is it that you accomplished such a deed? No, don't tell me now, you have much more to do I'm sure.
When you are famous and all of the bards spread tales of your heroic deeds, I hope you will return to these woods and walk these paths in peace.
Maybe then we can share stories and maybe become friends. Until then I must go.
That is horrible news. The forest will suffer for generations. I desperately hope that you tried everything possible before going to such lengths.
Such a callous attitude toward nature is a sign of a troubled soul. Believe me when I tell you that what you do will come back on you someday.
Evil begets evil and is its own downfall. I would say more, but I suppose you are hardly interested in a sermon from me. I will leave you in the hands of nature now.
I'm sure that you did your best. I just hope the woods survives this loss. I should get going now.
Ah, another dominated slave
Me cure Spirit, so you be safe now.
I have cured the Spirit of the Wood. You may return to the other druids in peace.
Be safe.
Take care of yourself.
Me kill Spirit. You not need worry no more.
I had to kill the Spirit of the Wood, so the problem is resolved.
You watch what say or maybe you not be rescued after all.
Watch your insults. Nobody else knows I found you... if you take my meaning.
Me must go now. You fine on own?
Time to get moving. You can make it out on your own?
Me do what need be done!
I did what I had to do!
Me be sad that Spirit dead, but you not know how bad it be.
I am terribly sorry for the damage I have done, but you don't know what it was like.
You not there, so you not know nothin'.
You weren't there, so why don't you keep your judgments to yourself.
Praise be! What a marvelous thing. Surely your name will be sung on the wind for such a heroic deed.
I shall be sure that others hear of your deed, good <lord/lady>. Now if you will excuse me, I should be off.
You did what? Why would... how could... you idiot! Without the Spirit, the Wood will never truly recover.
I... I'm sorry. You did free me, so I guess I should be grateful. I just don't think you realize how much damage has been done.
I'm sure you think you did, but there had to be another path. Probably a harder path, but nothing worth doing is ever easy.
I... I guess I wasn't at that.
Me cure Spirit. You be safe now.
I cured the Spirit of the Wood, so you can rest easy now.
Me kill Spirit, so you no need worry no more.
I had to kill the Spirit of the Wood, so you don't have to worry about it now.
What mean you think that?
What are you talking about?
Me glad you think like me.
I'm glad you see it my way.
So, you no be mad at me?
So, you're not mad at me?
You... you cured it? I must admit that I am shocked. You are quite the <man/woman>, to have accomplished such a deed.
You really are a hero, even if you're not as beautiful as I am.
It's dead? Oh, I was afraid that something like that would have to be done.
The other druids didn't want to admit it, but nobody knew how to stop the Spirit. It was only a matter of time before someone would realize that it had to die.
Hmm, well, that's a bitter thought.
Sometimes the only way to solve a problem is to make the unpopular choice. Don't worry about what anybody else says, you did what you had to do.
I must be going now. Take care, and thank you for all your help.
Me look for gem you gots.
I was sent here to collect a gem you have.
If me has to.
That's a distinct possibility.
No, me want you let me have it.
No, I was just hoping to convince you to let me have it.
What me do to help?
What can I do to help you?
What you give me if me help you?
What will you give me to get this mirror for you?
You keep yell at me, me bash you like servants.
If you keep yelling at me like that, I'll show you exactly what I did to your servants.
Me sorry, but you monsters... er, servants, them attack me first.
I'm sorry, but your creatures, or servants as you call them, attacked me first.
That greedy elf sent you here? Did he tell you to kill me and take steal my gem?
I don't appreciate threats, nor do I enjoy people barging into my house and killing my servants. I think you underestimate my powers.
I certainly don't think that you improved your chances by busting in here and killing all my servants. Not exactly tactful, is it?
But, I might have a use for you, since you are so interested in... acquiring objects for others. We might be able to make a deal.

The only thing that holds true value for me is my beauty. There is a nymph who lives in this forest who has a mirror that can return my beauty. I overheard two dryads talking about it, just before all this trouble started.

The nymph lives to the northeast of here. I would get it myself, but I can't go anywhere near her. The unearthly beauty of her face physically hurts me, and she shuns me because I am ugly. Please, please get me the mirror!
I think you underestimate me, but that's beside the point. There has been enough fighting here today.
You were an intruder in my home. My servants were merely trying to protect me, as good servants should.
So why would you think that there would be anything in my house that could help you save the forest?
You can find a druid locked in the southwest most room. Here is a key for the cell door. Don't worry, she has not been harmed.
Oh, I am so very beautiful.
A portal has been activated.

The paint has all but peeled from the dry and brittle wood. You can almost make out what it used to say:
Da f rd Q obl y ay r of Cha woo Si e 11 2

Fire licks the base of this sign and the paint blisters and scorches in the heat. You can almost make out what it used to say:
Da f rd Q obl y ay r of Cha woo Si e 11 2
West: Port Llast. East: South Farms and Charwood. North: Neverwinter Wood.
You be safer if you no ask questions.
Probably safer for you if you don't ask that question again.
Me just lookin' round.
I was just exploring.
You dad say you need cheer up.
Your father told me you could use some cheering up.
Me not do favor; me only do stuff for pay.
I don't do favors; I do jobs. You want to pay me for this, then you should tell me about it.
So, what you want do now me here?
So, what do you propose to do about it?
Why not?
You gots to be jokin'. Me no want you for that!
Slow down there boy. I'm not here for that.
What you talkin' bout?
What do you mean by that?
Threats? Great, just what I need. You must be one of those adventurer types.
An adventurer are ya? Well go explore somewhere else will ya?
I should have known dad sent ya. He's always worried about me.
Whatever your reason for being here, you can turn around and leave, unless you have something important you want.
What? Oh, sure, I suppose I could do that. I'll pay ya, if you can do it.
Hmm... an interesting situation. I've never had a woman break into my room before.
I... um... er... oh, nothing. I can't do anything right now.
It's none of your business. What do you want from me?
Well, that hardly comes as a surprise. Nobody wants me!
Goodbye.
You always talk like that?
Are you always this forward?
Me ask questions, yuh?
Could I ask you some questions?
Dese farmlands stretch on for long time. Me need directions.
Who you calling idiot?
That better. Now you tell me how get places.
You know odd things about dis area?
Me hear of stuff going on. Maybe you know more?
Can I ask you some directions?
No, me have other question.
Me need place to buy stuff.
Where da east road go?
Where da west road go?
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
Where does the east road lead?
Where does the west road lead?
Anything interesting going on in these parts?
You know good places to go 'round here?
Me want work.
Adventures? What adventures you speak of?
Are there any places of interest around here that I should visit?
I'd be interested in work, if you know of anything.
What sorts of adventures?
Me not like milk cows. What he want for help?
What does he need help with? Not plowing the fields, I assume.
I'm investigating some recent events you might be aware of.
Me have other question.
Me see cave past dem waterfalls. What be in dere?
Uh... you ever been to Charwood?
You know stuff 'bout dat plague cult in Neverwinter?
I want to ask you something else.
I saw a cave up past those waterfalls. Do you know anything about it?
Wolfies? Dey be a threat to you?
Wolves? Are they a threat?
Have you ever been to Charwood?
Tell more. Me want to know more 'bout Charwood?
Is there anything else you can tell me about Charwood?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Do you know of anyone who might have been there?
Do you know anything about the cult that spread plague in Neverwinter?
You sure you not know more 'bout da cult?
You're sure you don't know anything else about the cult?
Me add fun to you life if you want.
Is there anything I can do to liven up your life?
Me not care. Me have other question.
I don't care to hear your excuses. I have another question.
Since Erik what?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anyone who might know more?
What wrong with Erik?
What do you mean about Erik?
What you do to him?
What did you do?
Who you be?
Who are you?
Well, you be pretty, that good 'nuff for me.
Well, you are rather pretty...
Where you lead me?
What do you mean by that?
Me get what you say now. You be pretty, that good 'nuff for me.
Oh, that! Well, you are rather cute...
Maybe me be simple, but you got big mouth and crooked teeth!
I'm not simple, I was meerly trying to give you a chance to act more like a proper, young lady.
We talk 'bout dat brooch of Erik's, 'kay?
I want to speak with you about Erik's brooch.
Slow down. Me ask 'bout something else.
You give it or me just kill you an' bring him your corpse, yuh?
But it be all dat remind Ingo of him dead wife, yuh?
Slow down, I need to ask you about something else.
How'd you like me to pry it from your cold, dead hands?
Be reasonable. Ingo treasures that brooch, because it reminds him of his wife.
Uh... tell me 'bout Erik.
All right, tell me a little about Erik.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But he love you Constance. Be good to him.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> He loves you Constance. Don't betray that.
Why dis 'erd be so important?
Why is the herd so important?
Why dis 'erd be so important?
Why is the herd so important?
Money? Dat be all dis mean to you?
Money? That's all this means to you?
Gimme da li'l brooch an' you have my heart, li'l lady...
Uh, well maybe me buy it off you, den.
For but a peasant's brooch, you'll have my undying love.
Maybe I can buy it off you...
You give brooch or me slit stomachs, yuh?!
Me not got that much gold for spend on this.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Dat too much for peasant's doodad. Me give 250.
Hand the brooch over or I'll gut you like a fish!
Me not argue no more. Now me kill you!!
I'm done haggling. Time to kill you and take it for free!
Me not afford that much for this.
I can't afford to spend that much on this.
250? Deal.
I can't afford to spend that much gold on this.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It's a simple peasant's brooch, worth 250 at most!
Me no got 400 gold to spend on this.
I don't have 400 gold to spend on this.
400 gold? Deal.
<StartAction>[Insight]</Start> Take the 250. The next fool Erik sends might not be so happy to negotiate.
1,000 gold? Deal.
Yuh? Me guess me go now, den.
What you mean you be robbed?
Hey - you no give item. Me want me money back!
Me no believe you - you give item now!
Really? I guess I'll be going then.
What do you mean you've been robbed?
Hey - if you don't have the item, I want my money back!
I don't believe you - hand over the brooch... now!
Fine, you keep money.
You give me money back, or me kill you!
That not fair!
Fine, keep the money.
Give my money back or I'll slit your throat!
That's not fair!
Why so much money?
Did Ma let you in here? This is a bedroom, not a bar table, I'll have you know.
Well... a handsome stranger in the bedroom of the farmer's daughter. I wonder where such an encounter could lead?
At long last and good riddance.
Yes, yes. On your way.
Fare you well, then. Perhaps we'll speak again.
Oh... I'm sorry. I shouldn't act that way. It's just that being one of the only young people for miles around... well, it gets so dull.
I see. A little on the slow side, are we?
I'll answer your questions if you don't take too long...
I suppose I can answer a question for you. What might it be?
I'd be happy to answer a question or two. What do you want to know?
Yes, I suppose a village idiot might be lost without a village, wouldn't <he/she>?
Er... um... me?
Where do you need to go?
(sigh) Make it quick.
Around here? Don't hold your breath. If we can't grow it or make it ourselves, we have to trek all the way into Port Llast to find it.
Nowhere really. Just into Charwood and I haven't seen anyone head that way in years. It's funny how the road never seems to grow over, though.
Follow it long enough and you'll make it all the way to Port Llast. That's the route we take on market day.
Is there something else?
Well there's always some sort of adventure to be had when you're this far from the rest of the world.
Well I suppose that's about as direct as one can get.
I'm not sure what you would find interesting. There's our farm and then the one Erik works with his pa. Not much more than that.
You should talk to me pa. He's out watching over the cattle I'm sure. A helping hand is always welcome, what with the wolves and all.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
You could help my pa out. I don't know if you would consider that interesting or not.
Nothing like that, he's just had some problems with wolves lately.
You should go talk to him about it. He's probably somewhere outside doing chores.
I might. What events are you referring to?
What do you want to know?
Oh, that's the den of those wretched wolves!
They've killed two cows already this season. You can ask me pa about it if you're really interested - he's been watching them like a hawk!
Is there something else you wanted to know?
No. My pa won't let me. He says it's because they're strange, though he won't say why. I think it's because he doesn't want me meeting a boy and running off with him.
Well, just that as kids, me and Erik used to tell each other the woods were haunted. Just children's stories, though - little harm can come of them.
Do you have more questions?
Maybe that cretin Erik's pa, Ingo. Before his wife passed away, he used to have a tinkering wagon that traveled from hamlet to hamlet around the area.
On our last trip to Port Llast, I heard a woman telling how awful the plague had been. Don't know much about the cult but they sound horrible.
It gets pretty isolated out here. A girl will do just about anything for a bit of excitement, but any news there is is usually about the weather, a new calf, or a good harvest.
Is there something else you need, then?
That's certainly an interesting thought. (Sigh) But mother's been keeping a rather close eye on me lately, ever since Erik... nevermind.
What else?
Erik has an infatuation with me; not terribly surprising considering the lack of choices around here.
One day I let him kiss me, just a little, but mom walked in on us. Since then... well, I'm surprised she hasn't walked in here yet.
The only other people around here for miles are Erik and his pa but Erik's blind to everything these days, so I doubt he'd be of any use.
If you want to speak to his pa, just take the north fork and the road will take you right to their front door. You'll know it by the corn fields and such.
Anything else?
Erik and I had a relationship, but it's over now and I have no interest in him.
I tried to hint that we were over, then I tried telling him, but he thinks we're *destined* to be together.
I had to do something drastic to get him to leave me alone.
I... I would rather not talk about. It really doesn't matter now. It's Erik's problem, not mine.
Is there anything else?
I'm Constance O'Deel, the prettiest girl for miles around... Also the *only* girl for miles around, but that's another story. What can I do for you?
Surely you know the story of the farmer's daughter and... oh, nevermind. Why must I always be surrounded by simpletons?
Forget it. The mood is gone now. What did you want?
Took you a while to think that one up, didn't it? Nevermind. We could trade insults all day, but what's the use? What can I do for you?
Oh... how embarassing. Sorry about that. So how can I help you?
Look, are we going to go over this again? I already told you this before, but I guess I have to repeat myself.
He told you about that, huh? Well, I tried to get him to leave me alone but he persisted. I told him there was never going to be a relationship between us, but he wouldn't listen.
I was going to give it back to him, if he promised to leave me alone, but now I need it. The gold I can get for selling it might help pa replace the cows killed by the wolves.
Whoa, where did that come from? Erik may want his brooch back but I know for a fact that he wouldn't have sent someone to kill me!
Look, if this stupid brooch means that much to you maybe we could work out a deal. 1,000 gold and it's yours, all right?
That may be so but it will also fetch a fine price in Port Llast - enough to by a couple head of cattle to replace those killed by the wolves, of late...
I know, I know - "He's a nice boy." That's what my ma always says and I can't say I entirely disagree...
But if he was a really nice boy, he'd spend more time helping out my pa and less time picking wildflowers, and that's all there is to it.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> He loves me? He would love a good romp in the hay is all and you'll not convince me otherwise!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well he's a fool to do so - All the love in the world won't buy a head of cattle! *Sigh* But I know you're right...
Look, 400 gold buys us a couple of good jersey milkers to replace what we've lost to the wolves. Give me that much and you can have the stupid brooch.
My pa's a cattle rancher and a good one, too. Without a proper herd, though, we've got nothing. There wouldn't even be food on the table...
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well he's a fool to do so - All the love in the world won't buy a head of cattle! *Sigh* But I know you're right...
Look, 250 gold would buy us a healthy bull, let us rebuild the herd. Give me that much and you may do what you wish with the brooch.
My pa's a cattle rancher and a good one, too. Without a proper herd, though, we've got nothing. There wouldn't even be food on the table...
Look, my ma and his ma were best friends before she passed on! If she would have known we were struggling, she'd have been happy to give it!
All the love in the world won't buy a head of cattle... but you sure are a sweet talker, but I'm the one who used that trick on Erik, remember?
Look, 250 gold would buy us a healthy bull, let us rebuild the herd. If you have any pity in you, you'll give at least that. Please?
Really? Okay - You may have it for... 1,000 gold!
Well, then I guess you're out of luck. 1,000 gold seems a perfectly reasonable price for memories of one's mother, wouldn't you agree?
Hey, hey, hey! Let's settle down. I'm sure Erik didn't send you to kill me! Look, I'll go as low as 250 then but no more threats from you...
No! Someone help me, please!
Hey, if you don't have 250 on you, what use are you? One way or another, my family needs that money.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Well you're the one who seems to want it so much! 1,000 gold seems like a fair enough price for memories of one's mother.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Okay, maybe I couldn't get 1,000 for it but I sure could get 400!
Well if you don't even have 400 gold to spare, what good are you? Haggle all you want, but that's as low as I'll go.
*Sigh* Bargaining with Erik would have been a lot simpler, I'll have you know. Fine, then: 250...
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> *Sigh* Bargaining with Erik would have been a lot simpler, I'll have you know. Fine, then: 250...
1,000 gold? We... We could buy another half herd with this! Thank you so much, you can't know how much this means to my family!
Give me a second, I have the brooch right here in my pocket...
What the -? Where is it? It's gone! Somebody must have picked my pocket! I've been robbed!!!
You! You were involved in this, weren't you? Erik sent you to distract me so someone else could pick my pocket! I'm not stupid, you know!
Well my family and I aren't going to come out on the short end of this mess! I'm keeping your money!
How dare you threaten me after all this! You're a cruel and evil <man/woman>.
Hmph. I'm glad we could reach an understanding. I guess we can consider this matter settled, then. Is there anything else I can do for you?
Fair? Don't talk to me about fair! I've just been robbed - and I know you were involved somehow! So I'm keeping your money, end of story.
Here it is and I hope that fool Erik has learned not to give his heart so freely. Now, is there anything else I can do for you?
Me pa's a cattle rancher and a good one, too. Without a proper herd, though, we've got nothing. There wouldn't even be food on the table...
Those stupid wolves have almost been the death of us, even if all they ever preyed on was the cattle!
Don't think I enjoyed doing this to poor Erik - I like him, honest. But sometimes things get desperate, all right? I need the 1,000 gold.
What is this, a joke? I already gave it to you, don't you remember?
Now, if there's something else I can do for you...
It's a little late for that, I'm afraid, as I've long since given it away. Honestly, you didn't really expect me to wear the gaudy thing, did you?
Is there something else I can help you with, maybe?
Back again, are you?
Look, I have a lot of work to do, so please leave me be.
What bad stuff happen to dis place?
What kind of disaster happened here?
West: Port Llast, East: Castle Jhareg
<StartAction>Leave the pillar alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Might' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Emperor' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Nether' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'shall' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Destroy' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Rule' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Return' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Prevail' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'does' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'never' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'always' rune.</Start>
<StartAction>Press the 'Gur-Atol' rune.</Start>

This pillar is weathered with age and covered with moss and small vines... there is no telling how long it has been standing here. Of particular interest are the large runes that seem to cover most of its surface, in no language you recognize.
Without some way of translating these runes, however, there is no way to determine what they say or what use the pillar might have. Its mysteries remain a secret.
With the help of the notes in the explorer's journal, you identify the runes as Ancient Netherese and piece together a rough translation.
The runes have been placed on depressions... three rows of four runes. Pressing one rune in each row results in a three-word Netherese phrase... the effect of which is unknown.
Do you wish to press a rune in the first row?
You step away from the pillar, suddenly aware of a faint yet palpable sense of evil around it.
Do you wish to press a rune in the second row?
Do you wish to press a rune in the third row?
As you press the last rune, the pillar begins to hum...
The Green Griffon
Me has no time to listen.
I have no time to listen to this.
Okay, okay. You tells me about it, then.
Fine, fine. Tell me what this is all about, then.
You go be lost, kid, or me smash!
Get lost, kid.
And me is busy with mine. Me goes now.
And I'm busy with mine. Excuse me.
There be big reward?
Is there a reward in it for me?
You be calm. What be big problem?
Calm down. What seems to be the problem?
It no concern for me.
It's not my concern.
Why you and father not just go?
Why don't you and your father just leave?
You wants me to finds mother?
You want me to find your mother?
Sombody in charge helps you, no?
Surely someone in authority can help you.
Okay, me helps.
All right, I'll help.
You not hears 'bout me?
Haven't you heard of me?
You tells me what be wrong, then.
Tell me what's wrong, then.
This haves something to do with cult, maybe?
Does this have anything to do with a cult?
Err... hello, <sir/madam>. Are you an adventurer? You don't... look like one. Me and my pa could really use some help, though, if you are.
You... you're an adventurer, aren't you? I mean... I mean greetings. Uh... that is, my pa and I could certainly use your help.
But... but please! There's nobody else who can help us! Everyone is busy with their emergencies!
I... oh... okay. I guess there's nothing I can say to convince you.
I think so. I bet my pa could pay you, if you helped out. You could talk to him about it, at least.
Well, me and my pa... his name's Gerrol, everyone in Port Llast knows him... we live on a farm just north of the town gates.
There's lots of monsters that live in the hills around our farm. Normally they don't bother us so much, but lately they've been ambushing travelers and caravans and such, being real bold.
They even went and kidnapped my mother while me and pa were away from the farm last week! So my pa sent me to town to get help.
Pa says he won't leave ma behind... and besides, it's our land. Pa doesn't want to go. Couldn't you... just talk to him?
We just needs your help! All I ask is that you go and talk to my pa, Gerrol, nothing else.
Pa says he's sent lots of messages about the troubles, but the mayor's all caught up helping Neverwinter he's got no time to help us.
There were some other adventurers who went before, but none of them has come back. I was hoping... maybe you could do what they couldn't...
That would be great, my <lord/lady>. I'm sure my pa would appreciate it. To get to our farm, you just need to go through the north gate and follow the road a bit.
I'll stay here for now and find some more people to send to pa, until he calls me back. I'm sure you'll do the trick, though. Just go and talk to him.
Umm... no. Should I have? I live on a farm just outside of town, so we don't get much news, I'm afraid.
We'd heard that a bunch of adventurers had come to Port Llast, however, so my pa sent me here to find some people to send to him. It's real important!
Uhh... maybe. I don't know anything about a cult. You'd have to talk to my pa about that.
Um... hello, <sir/madam>. Or... is it my <lord/lady>? I... I'm not very good at this. It's just that you look like an adventurer, and my pa and I could certainly use some help.
You just need to go north of Port Llast to speak to my pa at the farm, my <lord/lady>. I'll go back there when my pa calls me.
Kill the enemies of the master!
Zombies?!
That not scares you?
That doesn't frighten you?
What books?
You speaks now, teeny-weeny old gnome...
Out with it, you crotchety gnome...
No, you say 'books'. Me be sure.
No, you said 'books'. I'm sure of it.
Why you not tells someone 'bout this?
Why haven't you told anyone about this?
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Me from... uhh... Arcane Brothers. Key belongs to us.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> I'm from the Arcane Brotherhood, actually. The key belongs to us.
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> Yes, but we don't call it the Arcane Brotherhood anymore...
<StartCheck>[Lie]</Start> No.
Yes, I guess I did.
Yeah, me did.
Mm? Oh, yes, yes. They've been a bit restless for quite some time, now. I imagine it's one of those wizards down there, not quite as dead as he should be. You know how it goes.
Us caretakers don't frighten easily. Besides... I imagine that fella's busy with his books. He won't be bothering me for quite some time.
Oh, did I say books? Err... no I didn't. I said he's busy with his looks... yeah, that's it. Those undead look a fright, you know...

Dang blast it! Fine, fine. It just so happens those fool wizards left a whole collection of magical books down there. I don't know why. I bet they just plain forgot about 'em, I guess. Leave it to wizards.
I ain't never seen 'em, but my grandpappy did. He said they was huge books, all covered in runes. The kinds of things wizard usually get their robes all in a knot over.
Anyhow, I imagine them books is connected to whatever strangeness is going on down there. I don't mind. I just takes things as they come.
Tell who? In case you haven't noticed, people are busy as bees with all their plagues and fighting and such. City's closed up tighter'n a salt merchant's pocketbook.
Me, I figure they'll notice soon enough when all them zombies begin pouring out of here. All in good time, as my granpappy used t' say.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh. Well, all right... though I have to say, you've got to be the thickest wizard I've ever met and then some. Not that I've met any, mind you.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> What do I look like? A baby gnome all in his swaddlings? Hmph. Tell me another one.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh? Why didn't you say so? We've only been holding onto this key for how long now?
I suppose you've got some more dead to put down there, eh? Heh heh... well, with all them zombies walking about, there'll be plenty of room. Here... take the key and git.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Eh? Didn't you just ask me what the Arcane Brotherhood was?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Dagnabbit! Have I gone and fallen behind the times again? What do they call it now, the Merry Casters of Magick again? Ahh, no matter.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh. Must have wax in my ears again. I could'a sworn you did. Must be gettin' old, finally.
I thought so. I ain't as old as I look, you know.
The board reads: 'BEWARE! The undead are restless. Bring weapons to visit Grandma or don't visit her at all. Really.' It is signed: The Caretaker.
Long have I waited for life to return to these bones. None shall stop me now!
This pillar shines with a holy light, basking the room in its warm glow.
Why me cares?
Me see what me can do. You holds on.
Yes, me can heals you.
Here... you takes healing potion.
You wants healing so you be in contest again.
You be hurt? What hurt you?
Why should I care?
Tough. Me can handles myself.
Maybe me should ends your misery.
Tough. I can handle myself.
Perhaps I should put you out of your misery.
I'll see what I can do. Hold on.
Yes, I can heal you.
Here... take a healing potion.
You want me to heal you and put you back in the contest?
You're injured? What did this to you?
You forget it. You enters contest, just likes me.
Forget it. You entered the contest, just like me.
I... am most grateful for your aid, my friend. I was almost certain that I was about to die here in this dungeon.
I was ambushed by invisible creatures in the next room. They are quite powerful. I thought I was skilled enough to battle them anyway, but I was wrong.
During the battle, one of them came too close to that pillar of light and it... it exploded. I was too injured to take advantage of that knowledge... but you are not.
Now I intend to find my way out of here. Thank you again, friend. I wish you luck.
Please... do not leave me here to die, friend! I beg you!
You are a cruel <man/woman>. Pray you do not meet the same fate as I.
No! I will not let it end like this!
P-please hurry. I... do not wish to die in this place, friend.
I care nothing for this contest any longer. I just want to get out of here alive. Mutamin can keep his blasted coin.
I will gladly tell you of the creature... and how I believe it can be defeated. If I am healed. Please... I will not last, otherwise.
Help me.
Thank you.
Me wants to see goods.
Let me see your goods.
Let me see what you sells.
Let me see what you're selling.
Certainly. Until Luskan opens its gates, I'm afraid this is the only store in this region.
YOU HAVE ENTERED THE ROOM OF THE FINAL TEST!
You go home, but be safe. Much danger there be if you not go right home and see you father.
You can go home now, but be careful and go straight to your father.
You be safe now, so you tell me you story. Please?
You're safe now, but I need you to tell me what happened. Please?
You gots 'nuff excitement now?
Do you think you've had enough mystery in your life now?
You fall for that tale? That story be as old as me grandma's grandma.
You fell for that old story?
I... I guess I could tell you. You seem much nicer than I thought you were.
Oh, yes. I want to be back in boring, old Port Llast. I like boring now. I'll never want mystery again.
Me not finds anything yet.
Nothing yet.
<StartAction>Show her the letter to Vardoc.</Start>
<StartAction>Show her the Charwood cultist's journal.</Start>
<StartAction>Show her Relmar's journal.</Start>
Me keeps on looking.
I shall continue the search.
<StartAction>Show her the letter to Neva.</Start>
<StartAction>Show her the letter to Solomon.</Start>
<StartAction>Show her Ganon's journal.</Start>
No other stuffs yet.
Nothing else, no.
This is good news. What have you discovered?
So the cult sought to strike at you again! And this time they have given themselves away in the process. Well done!
Hmm. The ramblings of a madman. One has to wonder what this cult hoped to achieve in that haunted place.
One can only wonder what this cult might have done had their plans in the Neverwinter Wood been successful. Well done.

This information suggests that this Maugrim and his cult are to be found within Luskan. I do wonder, however, if this is not some attempt on their part to deceive us. Perhaps they meant for you to find this?
I would like you to continue your investigation, just in case. I need a second piece of information that supports the first, to be absolutely certain it is the truth. We can afford no mistake.
This information confirms it, then... the cult is located within Luskan. Excellent work, <FirstName>. You have justified Lord Nasher's faith in you and more.
This Maugrim grows desperate, I see. They fear you... and well they should.
The cult sought to strike against you through an agent, did they? Fortunate for us that their efforts proved fruitless.
So the cult was responsible for stirring up the humanoids in the hills? You are to be commended for putting an end to that danger, indeed.
While this information you bring is incredibly valuable, it still does not tell us where the cult is based. We need that information if we are to strike at them.
Fortunately, it does mention where more cultists may be found. Charwood and the Neverwinter Wood. Search those places, perhaps, for the information we seek.
Have you found any other information?
You'd better watch out!
Are you a werewolf?
You're kinda scary. Leave me alone!
Daddy said you're the hero of Neverwinter. You don't look like no hero!
Are you an adventurer? That must be neat!
My friend said you're not really <race>!
Mommy says you're the hero of Neverwinter. I want to be a hero!
I know somebody who has a crush on you. (giggle!)
You're the hero of Neverwinter, aren't you? You are! You are!
Wow! I want to be just like you someday!
I'm not supposed to talk to strangers.
Are you here to kill that werewolf?
Is there going to be a big war, <mister/missus>?
Do you know Lady Aribeth? Is she really an elf?
I don't suppose there's something you want?
I'm just here to have a drink or two. Leave me be.
They say the hills are still full of monsters. I hate monsters!
The roads out there aren't safe. I lost both my guards to some orc raiders.
I wonder how Mutamin gets all his money? Someone told me he was once a great adventurer.
I hear that the High Captains in Luskan have been slaughtering the populace in the name of some evil demon.
How long do you suppose they'll keep Luskan closed?
Sigh. This inn isn't bad, really... I'd just rather get into Luskan and be done with my business.
I suppose you're here for the contest, huh?
Hmm. I hear winning the contest isn't worth it, after all. What do you think?
I'd like to congratulate you on your victory, <sir/madam>.
Aren't you the one who won the contest? Wow. Well done!

Complete History of the Creator Ruins

This musty old tome appears to be the type of book that was written and never read. It is a long, boring text written by a druid, Jordius Caini Getafix the Third, several hundred years ago. It uses large, complicated and often seemingly meaningless words to discuss his observations on the Spirit of the Wood. One page in the text has been earmarked and there is a small comment beside an underlined passage in the margin.
"This could mean that if one stood in the pool, below the waterfall, and somehow died, one could reappear, alive (presumably) in the realm of the Spirit. I think it would take a combination of two magical forces, one to kill the body, yet capture its essence and transport both to the Spirit's realm, the other to preserve the corpse and bring it back to life once it enters the realm. The death-giver should be easy, some kind of weapon, perhaps a dagger, since that should be easiest to manipulate in taking one's life. It would hardly to to imbue a morningstar with this power and then try to bash one's head in with it, ha ha."
Explorer's Journal

Though this book has been severely damaged by exposure to the elements, large parts of it are surprisingly legible.
Included in its pages are translations of the runic language used by the ancient Netherese.
The remainder seems to be the personal journal of an unnamed explorer who had come to this region determined to find an ancient Netherese temple which he referred to as 'the Ruin of Gur-Atol'.
The last page is of particular interest and reads:
"I've decided to camp in the forest, tonight. Whatever has happened in Charwood, it's something I certainly don't want to get involved in. The villagers there are frightening and will be no help in my search for the temple. It's best I just avoid them entirely.
"Resting in the forest will not be much better, however. To think I scoffed at the tales I was told of it being haunted. It is so eerily silent... yet I will not be deterred. The secret portal that leads into the Ruins of Gur-Atol must be in this area... and I WILL find it. If I am right, the treasure that will still be there will make all these long months worthwhile."
Old Scroll

This weathered scroll is severely time-worn and covered with almost-indecipherable runes. There is a hand-written translation across the bottom, showing this to be some manner of religious text written by a Netherese priest. Part of the translation is of particular note:
"The lands of NETHER will one day return to the destiny to which they were born. Its people SHALL rise up from their ancient graves and RULE all those which have come after them."

Trolls captured Janis, the mother of Revat, a simpleton along the east road from Port Llast. She has been freed from the magical bonds that held her and has returned to the surface, back to her son.

Jax, an archeologist with an interest in the earliest races of Faerun, believes he is close to being able to prove his thesis and receive the necessary grant funding to continue his research. Convinced that ancient ruins lurk beneath the troll caves along the road east of Port Llast, he has enlisted the aid of adventurers to discover them and return to him with proof that the ruins were a product of the so-called "creator races." The book will be a Complete History of the Creator Ruins.
The archeologist's first suspicions appear to have had a grain of truth as evidence found in the troll caves point to there being something even the trolls are frightened of below. Adventurers have recently breached these lower ruins and have begun to explore them, searching for the evidence that Jax requires. A Seal Guardian stands between the adventurers and their goal, demanding adventurers show it the "Ring of Gax" for safe passage.

Jax, an archeologist with an interest in the earliest races of Faerun, believes he is close to being able to prove his thesis and receive the necessary grant funding to continue his research. Convinced that ancient ruins lurk beneath the troll caves along the road east of Port Llast, he has enlisted the aid of adventurers to discover them and return to him with proof that the ruins were a product of the so-called "creator races." The book will be a Complete History of the Creator Ruins.
The archeologist's first suspicions appear to have had a grain of truth as evidence found in the troll caves point to there being something even the trolls are frightened of below. Adventurers have recently breached these lower ruins and have begun to explore them, searching for the evidence that Jax requires. A Seal Guardian stands between the adventurers and their goal, demanding adventurers show it the "Ring of Gax" for safe passage. Adventurer's have passed the first Seal Guardian and are continuing their search.

Boddyknock Glinkle, a gnomish sorcerer from the island of Lantan, has joined your cause. Though not skilled in melee combat, his arcane spells will be a valuable tool in the many battles that lie ahead. His magic might also prove useful in opening any stubborn locks you might come across.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, note that your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Daelan Red Tiger, a noble barbarian of the Uthgardt tribes, has joined his mighty axe to your cause. His ferocity and prowess in melee combat will be helpful in the many battles you are sure to face. Daelen can also use his great strength to try and bash open any chests or locked doors you might come across.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, note that your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Tomi "Grin" Undergallows, a halfling thief of dubious character and widespread reputation, has joined his nimble fingers to your cause. His ability to pick locks will prove invaluable throughout your adventures, as will his skill in detecting and disarming traps. Though not eager to go toe to toe with an enemy in combat, Tomi's sneak attacks on an opponent's exposed flank can be devastating.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, note that your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Grimgnaw, a macabre dwarven monk who worships Death itself, has joined your cause. With deadly feats like Stunning Fist and Flurry of Blows, Grimgnaw is a powerful ally in combat.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, note that your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Linu La'neral, an elven cleric of Sehanine Moonbow, has joined your cause. Her divine spells, particularly her healing magic, will be invaluable in the many battles that lie ahead. As well, her ability to turn undead should not be underestimated.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, note that your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.

Sharwyn, a beautiful bard determined to make a legend for herself, has joined your cause. Her skill in combat is augmented by a variety of spells and healing magic, and her powerful bard song will inspire those who fight by her side to heroic victory.
NOTE: If your henchman ever dies, a special Recall spell will transport them back to the Temple of Tyr. You can use your Stone of Recall to return to the temple and retrieve your fully healed henchman. Also, note that your henchman will always be one level lower than you and will level up when you do.
Neverwinter Wood: Rescuing Bree

The druid Bree has been rescued from the clutches of Setara the Forest Witch in the Neverwinter Wood. she had been investigating the mysterious circumstances surrounding the Spirit of the Wood but will now return to the Archdruid Aawill to report what she has discovered.
Neverwinter Wood: Rescuing Orlane

The druid Orlane has been rescued from a spider's cocoon in the Neverwinter Wood. He had been investigating the mysterious circumstances surrounding the Spirit of the Wood but will now return to the Archdruid Aawill to report what he has discovered.
Neverwinter Wood: Rescuing Terari

The druid Terari has been rescued from the clutches of a maddened nymph in the Neverwinter Wood. He had been investigating the mysterious circumstances surrounding the Spirit of the Wood but will now return to the Archdruid Aawill to report what he has discovered.
Neverwinter Wood: Spirit of the Wood

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Wood has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Wood would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.

Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Wood would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Wood has retreated to that world. To those who have come to help her, she has offered up images of her poisoner, a nameless dwarf who apparently hides within the spirit world, even now.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Wood has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Wood would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Wood has retreated to that world, followed by her poisoner, a cult agent by the name of Relmar. He has been killed and a journal on his corpse suggests that he has buried a cure to the Spirit's poison beneath some rubble near where he was found.

Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Wood would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Wood has retreated to that world, followed by her poisoner, a cult agent by the name of Relmar. He has been killed and a journal on his corpse has led to the discovery of a cure that might still save the Spirit.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Wood has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Wood would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Wood has retreated to that world, followed by her poisoner, a cult agent by the name of Relmar. He has been killed and a journal on his corpse ultimately led to a cure for the troubled Spirit.
Renewed to her former vigor, the Spirit will once again be able to restore the forest to its proper balance. Aawill will be eager to hear the good news.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Wood has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Wood would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Wood has retreated to that world, followed by her poisoner, a cult agent by the name of Relmar. He has been killed and a journal on his corpse ultimately led to a cure for the troubled Spirit.
Renewed to her former vigor, the Spirit will once again be able to restore the forest to its proper balance. Aawill was happy to reward the adventurers for their exceptional work.
Neverwinter Wood: The Missing Druids

A desperate young man has told you a tale of how his family has been plagued by humanoid bandits in the northern hills. His mother was kidnapped by them recently and he was sent to Port Llast to find help. His father, Gerrol, can be found at their farm just outside town to the north.

A man named Mutamin hosts an illegal dungeon race beneath the Green Griffon Inn, north of Luskan. Those given a key to the cellars are to proceed to the cellars and speak with his assistent, Jaroo.
Jaroo has explained the rules and launched the race. Competing adventuring parties are to race down parallel paths filled with monsters, traps, and treasure. At the end of the dungeon, they will be faced with a riddle. The first party to solve the riddle is deemed the winner.
The final riddle has been solved and the contestants teleported back to the entrance. Speak to Jaroo to have the winner of the contest declared.

Kendrack, head of the mercenary guild and Mayor of Port Llast, has put out a reward for the death of five dangerous prisoners escaped from Waterdeep. They have separated to avoid detection but can all be identified by means of a tattoo on their left ear, marking them as inmates of the Bulwark prison. It is this tattoo that Kendrack wants as evidence of the deed.
Zor, a burly minotaur, is rumored to have been spotted on the north road, near the Green Griffon Inn. Wyvern, an elven ranger with a taste for trickery, will likely have sought refuge in the Neverwinter Wood. Stirge, an egomaniacal gnome, was last sighted on the road south of Port Llast. Delilah, a halfling assassin who once made her home in Luskan, was last seen on the road east of Port Llast. Yesgar, the group's ring-leader and mastermind, remains elusive though Kendrack doubts that he'd stray far.

Thus far, adventurers have been able to secure all ears save that of the ring leader, Yesgar.
Port Llast: Five Tomes of Imaskar

With the Wailing's cure and subsequent removal of Neverwinter's quarantine, the wizardess Eltoora has journeyed to Port Llast to provide her services to those searching for the cult responsible. She also comes with ulterior motives, however, as she seeks a collection of ancient tomes from the lost civilization of Imaskar. The five books are said to act as recipes, providing guidance to those undertaking magical experiments. Should any of the tomes be found, she will not only reward whoever returns them but also make the tomes publicly available to all arcanists who wish to experiment with them in her library.
Through scrying attempts, she has managed to narrow down the locations of the five tomes of Imaskar. The Tome of Fire and the Tome of Death are both said to be lost in Charwood, while the Tome of Life apparently rests with the corpse of Brother Toras in the cemetery outside the walls of Luskan. The Tome of Ice is housed within a tower south of Port Llast and the last, the Tome of Resonance, lies somewhere along the treacherous road to Luskan.

With the Wailing's cure and subsequent removal of Neverwinter's quarantine, the wizardess Eltoora has journeyed to Port Llast to provide her services to those searching for the cult responsible. She also comes with ulterior motives, however, as she seeks a collection of ancient tomes from the lost civilization of Imaskar. The five books are said to act as recipes, providing guidance to those undertaking magical experiments. Should any of the tomes be found, she will not only reward whoever returns them but also make the tomes publicly available to all arcanists who wish to experiment with them in her library.
Through scrying attempts, she has managed to narrow down the locations of the five tomes of Imaskar. The Tome of Fire and the Tome of Death are both said to be lost in Charwood, while the Tome of Life apparently rests with the corpse of Brother Toras in the cemetery outside the walls of Luskan. The Tome of Ice is housed within a tower south of Port Llast and the last, the Tome of Resonance, lies somewhere along the treacherous road to Luskan.
Three of these books have been found and should be returned to Eltoora, to be made available to all those who wish to experiment with them.

The infamous adventurer, Elaith "The Serpent" Craulnober appears to have at last become homesick for the land of Evermeet he fled so long ago. He and his daughter are currently staying at an inn in Port Llast, searching for three gems that will help them make the journey home. Unfortunately, the gems are not in the hands of people interested in parting easily with them.
The first is in the possession of a local wizard by the name of Wanev. He lives in his tower south of town. The second is held by the warrior Zamithra who recently passed through Port Llast on her way to Luskan. The final gem is the personal treasure of Setara, a witch of the Neverwinter Wood.

One of these gems has now been discovered.

Two of these gems have now been discovered.

All three of these gems have now been discovered.

The famed adventurer, Elaith "The Serpent" Craulnober appeared to have at last become homesick for the land of Evermeet he fled so long ago. He and his daughter stayed at the inn in Port Llast while he searched for three gems that would help them make the journey home. You recovered the gems for him, and the thankful pair have now sailed away.

Neurik, a priest of Tyr who presides of Port Llast's temple, warns of a terrible tragedy that has befallen some of the town's young men. Sir Karathis Ironheart, a travelling werewolf hunter, enlisted the help of four boys to hunt a foul lycanthrope known only as the Black Wolf. It was a trap, however, and Sir Karathis was himself the Black Wolf. His claws raked the flesh of Bran, Urth, and Geth, infecting them with his dread disease, leaving only the youngest boy, Ander, to escape. Neurik believes that, if found soon enough, the three young men may still be curable by a charm he has concocted. Ander currently spends his days at the Alliance Arms Inn, trying to spread news amongst adventurers of the tragedy that befell his friends. Neurik recommends speaking with the boy to gain an understanding of where those friends may now be hiding.

Neurik, a priest of Tyr who presides of Port Llast's temple, warns of a terrible tragedy that has befallen some of the town's young men. Sir Karathis Ironheart, a travelling werewolf hunter, enlisted the help of four boys to hunt a foul lycanthrope known only as the Black Wolf. It was a trap, however, and Sir Karathis was himself the Black Wolf. His claws raked the flesh of Bran, Urth, and Geth, infecting them with his dread disease, leaving only the youngest boy, Ander, to escape. Neurik believes that, if found soon enough, the three young men may still be curable by a charm he has concocted.
Ander, who currently spends his days at the Alliance Arms Inn, trying to spread news amongst adventurers of the tragedy that befell his friends, has a few guesses as to where his friends might have fled. He suspects that Bran is somewhere along the road to Charwood and Geth might be taking refuge in the Neverwinter Wood. Ander wasn't sure about Urth but recommended talking to his parents who live on the edge of town. The last time Ander saw Sir Karathis, it was at the supposed cave of the Black Wolf, in the hills east of the Green Griffon Inn.

South Road: Erik's Despair
The Search for the Cult: Charwood Journal

A cult agent has been found and killed in the strange village of Charwood. The journal he was carrying suggests that the cult is headquartered in Luskan's Host Tower. This has been corroborated by a second piece of evidence and these should be brought to Aribeth in Port Llast as soon as possible

A cult agent named Relmar has been found and killed in the spirit world of the Neverwinter Wood. The journal he was carrying suggests that the cult is headquartered in Luskan's Host Tower. This has been corroborated by a second piece of evidence and these should be brought to Aribeth in Port Llast as soon as possible.
The Search for the Cult: Solomon
A halfling named Solomon approached you in the Alliance Arms Inn, quite insistent on giving you a ring in return for saving his family in Neverwinter.

It appears that Solomon, the halfling who approached you earlier in the inn, is obviously connected with Desther's cult. He appeared once more to deliver a warning, saying that the cult would not tolerate your 'interference' much longer before escaping.

The dreaded cult agent Vardoc is dead. A letter he was carrying suggested that the cult is headquartered in Luskan's Host Tower. This has been corroborated by a second piece of evidence and these should be brought to Aribeth in Port Llast as soon as possible.

Through your valiant efforts, the city of Neverwinter has been saved and what citizens it still has have been spared the suffering of the Wailing Death. Desther, the man responsible for spreading the plague, did not act alone, however. He had substantial backing from a powerful and mysterious cult, known only to be based somewhere north of Neverwinter.
With the city's long quarantine lifted and her lover, Fenthick, hanged, Lady Aribeth has moved the base of her investigation to the township of Port Llast, northernmost member of the Lords' Alliance. An important lead has been uncovered in the case, found on the body of one of the cult agents operating in the region. The cult appears to be operating out of the dreaded Host Tower of the Arcane which lies at the heart of the pirate city of Luskan.
Aribeth intends to have this lead followed up on and has moved the base of operations to Luskan, itself. Now that you are inside the city, you must seek out Aribeth and Aarin Gend at the Temple of Tyr to find out their plan to get you inside the Host Tower.

Through your valiant efforts, the city of Neverwinter has been saved and what citizens it still has have been spared the suffering of the Wailing Death. Desther, the man responsible for spreading the plague, did not act alone, however. He had substantial backing from a powerful and mysterious cult, known only to be based somewhere north of Neverwinter.
With the city's long quarantine lifted and her lover, Fenthick, hanged, Lady Aribeth has moved the base of her investigation to the township of Port Llast, northernmost member of the Lords' Alliance. There she has once again put out a call to adventurers to seek out the cult's corruption wherever it may lie. The cult's base must be discovered and its leaders brought to justice. Standing guard over Aribeth at the local mercenary barracks is Aarin Gend, a Spymaster in the service of the Alliance. She has encouraged all adventurers to work closely with him in their ongoing search of the region.
Aarin Gend has explained that the best lead for locating the cult lies to the north of Port Llast, in a series of caves that lie in the hills. They are inhabited by humanoid monsters that have been performing unusual raids. Should this avenue of investigation not prove worthwhile, the spymaster suggests searching either Luskan to the north, Neverwinter Wood to the east or the wildlands of the South Road. Two separate and corroborating pieces of evidence are needed to prove the cult’s location.
The East Road; north is the Green Griffon Inn.
The East Road; west is Port Llast.
Grove of the Spirit
Grove of the Spirit
Collapsed Wall
The spirit before you is bathed in a divine and peaceful light. From behind her crystal mask, however, you can feel the piercing desperation of her eyes.

This pillar shines with a holy light, basking the room in its warm glow.
