These stones vibrate with energy. They seem to be powering something
Ever will the innocent guard this seal.
Evil guards the first seal!
By the sword shall you bless me. With my essence I shall bless you.
Fleshlings no hurt me, we talk no fight.
Oh the fleshlings, they will find my shiny.
Fleshlings help me yes, so kind.
This single-minded spirit continues on its way past you, toward a place in the distance.
Captain Baram smells like a sewer. He gets mad if you tell him.
War is fun 'cause I get to stay up late!
I can't go home because my house burnt down.
Captain Kurth is a big meenie! He hit Billy.
Mommy says we have to stay here or we'll die.
Tag! You're it!
Your soul shall be mine!
I am invincible, fool! Suffering shall be your only reward!
I bask in the glory of Shar and she is with me!
I stand in the dark light of Shar and she is my armor.
Your powers are feeble against the powers of Shar weakling.
Nothing can touch us, fool! Prepare for death!
I said we didn't have anything more to discuss, didn't I? I assume you know where the door is?
Me think you wants to know: Kurth be dead.
I thought you should know: Kurth is dead.
No, me not does that.
No, I haven't.
Yes. Baram dead, too.
Yes, actually. He's dead too.
Me think you wants to know: Baram be dead.
I thought you should know: Baram is dead.
Yes. Kurth dead, too.
Yes, actually. He's dead too.
He is, is he? Well, that's good. That smug bastard deserves to suffer... I hope he was squealing for mercy in the end.
I suppose I should thank you for getting rid of him. I don't suppose you might have gotten rid of Baram while you were at it?
Oh, well. I suppose things won't really change, then, once he discovers he's the only High Captain left... if he actually is. You can never tell. But thank you anyhow.
What? You... you're joking, right?
No, you're not joking... I can see it in your face. That's wonderful news! Thank you, thank you! Finally I'm not under the thumb of either of those bastards!
I wish I could give you some kind of reward! You've done us all a huge favor! May the gods bless you, my <lord/lady>!
What? You're... joking, right?
Well that's a relief. Baram was almost worse than Kurth with his twisted little brain. I suppose you did the job? Of course you did, or you wouldn't know.
Thank you for that, at least. You've done the city a favor. I don't suppose you might have gotten rid of Kurth while you were at it?
What? You're... joking, right?
I'm sorry, but I really must go!
Me think you wants to know: Kurth be dead.
I thought you should know: Kurth is dead.
No, me not does that.
No, I haven't.
Yes. Baram dead, too.
Yes, actually. He's dead too.
Me think you wants to know: Baram be dead.
I thought you should know: Baram is dead.
No, me not does that.
No, I haven't.
Yes. Kurth dead, too.
Yes, actually. He's dead too.
He is, is he? Well, that's good. That smug bastard deserves to suffer... I hope he was squealing for mercy in the end.
I suppose I should thank you for getting rid of him. I don't suppose you might have gotten rid of Baram while you were at it?
Oh, well. I suppose things won't really change, then, once he discovers he's the only High Captain left... if he actually is. You can never tell. But thank you anyhow.
What? You... you're joking, right?
No, you're not joking... I can see it in your face. That's wonderful news! Thank you, thank you! Finally I'm not under the thumb of either of those bastards!
I wish I could give you some kind of reward! You've done us all a huge favor! May the gods bless you, my <lord/lady>!
What? You're... joking, right?
Well that's a relief. Baram was almost worse than Kurth with his twisted little brain. I suppose you did the job? Of course you did, or you wouldn't know.
Thank you for that, at least. You've done the city a favor. I don't suppose you might have gotten rid of Kurth while you were at it?
What? You're... joking, right?
I'm sorry, but I really must go!

The inscription on the shield reads: Beware! The gods as our witnesses, from this day forth the entrance to ancient Illusk shall be sealed. Beneath this house, three wards guard the gates forever confining the unholy evil of Voleron the Damned within. The ancient texts speak of a hero from the south that will break the seals and forever rid the world of the horror within. We pray that the seals will hold until that day comes.
Heart of Good to prove the hero's strength to the Guardian.
This seal has been broken.
A measure of blessed water to cleanse the hero's soul.
The final seal has been broken and the ruins of Illusk are open to you.
Head of Evil to prove the hero's courage.
This seal has been broken.

What foul curse befell this land when the gates of hell would not open for Voleron the Damned. Though Illusk was brought to ruins, still his evil choked the very life from the land and those that died at his hand will not sleep. Only the one who is destined to destroy Voleron will break the three seals. So have the gods decreed it, so shall it be.
At last! The 'hero' of my enemies comes to die! Once you are dead, Voleron shall be free!
<StartAction>Leave the portal alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Put the glowing sphere in the portal.</Start>
<StartAction>Put the smooth token in the portal.</Start>
<StartAction>Put a random object in the portal.</Start>
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start><StartAction> Examine the portal more closely.</Start>

The portal in the center of the room is obviously a construction of magic, its energies being sustained in an artificial manner. Its purpose is unknown... but the aura it gives off fills the room with a dire chill and a sense of evil.

As it passes through the energies of the portal, there appears to be some kind of violent reaction. The sphere bursts and the portal flares white for just a moment. The magic of the structure is weakened, but not destroyed...
As the sphere passes through the magical energies, it causes a violent reaction. The portal crackles and shudders and suddenly explodes with power...

As it passes through the energies of the portal, there appears to be some kind of violent reaction. The token bursts and the portal flares purple for just a moment. The magic of the structure is weakened, but not destroyed...
As the token passes through the magical energies, it causes a violent reaction. The portal crackles and shudders and suddenly explodes with power...
You pick up a small piece of stone and put it into the portal. There is a small ripple as the stone passes through the energies... and then falls back onto the floor behind the portal.
It seems the stone had some effect upon the magic energy of the portal, but not a very strong one. Regardless, nothing can pass through to the wherever it leads.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Through the swirling energies, some hellish landscape can just barely be seen. You can tell nothing else from your examination.
Wherever the portal leads, it is one-way only. Creatures pass through it into our world, but it cannot be used to travel into theirs.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Through the swirling images within the portal you get a sense of a hellish landscape. The portal no doubt leads into the depths of the Abyss, itself.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> The portal connects to one of the outer planes... most likely a layer of the Abyss. It is used to regularly summon demons to this world. In your estimation, its energies seem incredibly sensitive to planar materials.
The portal is definitely one-way only. One cannot pass through it to the Abyss... though demons seem to be summoned through it into our world on a regular basis.
What you knows about portal?
Tell me what you know about this portal.

Kurth has brought a lot of demons through it... a lot of his power is connected to it in some way. Or that's what I was told, anyway, by one of his mages. Makes you wonder what he did to get that kind of power.
There's a library still around here that belonged to the wizard who made the portal. Maybe it could tell you more about it, I don't know.
You stands back! Me bets they do somethings to you!
Who you? How this happens?
You be calm. Me frees you from cocoon.
Stand back! I can just imagine what's been done to you!
Who are you? How did this happen?
Calm down. I freed you from this cocoon.
You makes it out okay?
You wants me to take you to Londa?
Me has better things to do.
Me tries.
Can you make it out of here?
Do you wish me to take you back to Londa?
Forget it. I have other things to do.
I shall try.
I... Ilmater's mercy! Where am I? Wh-what is this place?
Done to me? I... oh, the spiders. I... I remember...
Me? M-my name is Miriam. These... oh my. The spiders! I... I remember...
You... freed me? Oh... the spiders, I... I remember! I remember!
I... yes. I can leave. I... I've got to get out of this city, I can't stay here. Th-thank you for freeing me, my <lord/lady>... I must go...
O-of course. I... didn't think. N-nobody does anything for anyone, here, do they? I've just got to leave, got to get out...
I cannot face Miss Londa. Not after... not after that. I've just got to get out of this place. Th-thank you for freeing me, my <lord/lady>... but I must go...
Destroy the intruder!
I would speak with you.
You be Maugrim!
You knows me coming?
Who you be?
So you're... Maugrim?
You were expecting me?
And who are you?
You be another prisoner of Maugrim, huh?
Another one of Maugrim's prisoners, then?
You knows me? Me not knows who you be.
You know of me? I have no idea who you are.
You be Arklem Greeth, huh? Old top wizard?
You are Arklem Greeth, then... the former Archmage Arcane.
Huh. You turns yourself into lich.
Interesting. Transformed yourself into a lich, have you?
Maybe you be weaker than you thinks.
Maybe you're just weaker than you thought.
You be undead monster?! You be lich!
You are a lich! An undead thing!
Me rather kills you, monster!
I'd rather kill you where you stand, creature!
You forgets it! Me takes my chances!
Forget it! I'll take my chances!
You rewards me for letting you go?
Can you reward me for letting you go?
Why me want to free you?
Why would I free you?
How me gets you out, then?
How do I get you out of there, then?
What keeps me from killing you after, huh?
How me knows me can trusts you?
What's to keep me from killing you afterwards?
How do I know I can trust you?
Me finds some other way. Me not frees you!
I'll find some other way. I won't free you!
Me has questions, first.
I have some questions, first.
That be enough questions.
That's enough questions.
You helps me fight Maugrim, maybe?
Would you be willing to help me fight Maugrim?
Why Maugrim keeps you here? Why not kill you?
Why is Maugrim keeping you captive? Why not kill you?
You knows if Aribeth with Maugrim?
Do you know if Aribeth is with Maugrim?
What you knows 'bout Maugrim and cult?
What do you know about Maugrim and his cult?
Wait, now... who be you?
Wait a minute... who are you?
Ah. I see the fly in the ointment has finally arrived.
Don't be so foolish, <man/woman>. You expect the new 'master' of the tower to calmly await your arrival in a cage of magic? I think not.
Are you surprised? This tower is a living thing, in its own manner. To anyone as accustomed to its rhythms as myself, you are the veritable bull in a china shop.
Someone who has been following your progress through the tower with a great deal of interest, dear <man/woman>. You show remarkable determination.
I was the master of this tower long before the usurper took his place. I sensed your presence here immediately, even from this little prison.
Oh, indeed. I am Maugrim's prize, if the truth be known. I am Arklem Greeth... the former Archmage Arcane of the brotherhood, little mortal.
Bah. Blundering about the tower on some fool's errand, no doubt, without a thought as to where you are. No matter. My name is Arklem Greeth, little mortal.
It was I who was once the Archmage Arcane of the brotherhood. I fled from this tower when Maugrim showed his true intentions, but not quickly enough.
So you are not quite the dullard you seem. Good. You are correct... I fled the tower when Maugrim showed his true intention, but not quickly enough.
So my own reputation precedes me. Yes... you have the right of it, little mortal. I fled the tower when Maugrim showed his true intention, but not quickly enough.
Maugrim has power you cannot even imagine. His mistress favors him... and even the power granted me by this... form... could not resist capture in the end.

I have, at Nyphithys's advice, in fact. It has proven remarkably beneficial... both for myself and the brotherhood. Maugrim was a... a surprise. He is my enemy... and that means our interests coincide, yes?
Maugrim caught me by surprise, mortal. His power far surpassed anything I had suspected in him. Regardless, he is my enemy... and that means our interests coincide rather nicely, don't you think?
Indeed. Do not get yourself in a huff about it, mortal. At the moment, our interests rather coincide, don't you think?
Free me from this magical prison, mortal. You assist me... and I shall assist you.
Oh, truly? You are an amusing one, mortal. You can certainly try to kill me. The spells Maugrim has enveloped me in to keep me here would prevent your success... but you are free to try.
Wouldn't you rather discuss your options... or lack thereof... instead, hm?
(sigh) You mortals with your limited minds. Very well... do as you wish, if it satisfies your perverse sense of independence.
A reward? Certainly, my dear <race> friend. I can reward you. You see that door that leads into my sanctum? Have you tried to open it?
Why, indeed? How about this, my unimaginative <race> friend? You see the door that leads into my sanctum? Have you tried to open it?
It is locked tightly... with spells that I'm positive you have no ability to break. I happen to know that Maugrim lies beyond it. He is the one you came here for, no?
I created the spells that hold the door. I can open it for you... but only if I am freed. It's either that or... you are certainly free to return whence you came. In failure.
So what do you say now, mortal? Do you really have a choice?
You see the four braziers that surround me? They sustain the magic that Maugrim keeps me held within.
They are protected by their own magic... too much for me to overcome on my own. If you were to damage them, however... and I was to add my power to yours... they could be destroyed, and I freed.
Attack them however you wish and I will turn my own efforts toward aiding you. Then I shall open the door to my sanctum for you... and I shall leave.
Hmph. You can certainly try if you wish, fool... I will not remain here long enough for you to break through my own protections, however, I can assure you.
Foolish <man/woman>. You can't. You can trust, however, that I would rather be away from here than deal with you myself. Have you another choice?
Go, then. I tire of this cage. I would see Maugrim dance before whatever <race> fury you can muster.
You see the four braziers that surround me? They sustain the magic that Maugrim keeps me held within... in much the same manner that Nyphithys was held.
It is locked tightly... with spells that I'm quite sure are beyond even your ability to dispel. I happen to know that Maugrim lies beyond it. He is the one you came here for, no?
Naturally. Go ahead, mortal. I'd be interested to hear what you have to ask.
Then what shall it be? Will you free me now?
Certainly not. You are on your own with your foolish quest. I intend to leave this tower and regroup elsewhere with my dear Nyphithys.
With luck, you will at least weaken Maugrim... or at least drive him from this tower. I intend to take advantage of that, in time.
There are many secrets of this tower that are yet mine alone. If Maugrim knew what I knew, he would already be aware of you... and you would not have made it so far.
Consider yourself lucky. If I didn't think that you might actually cause a problem for the fool, I might have been amused to warn Maugrim of your presence.
The elven blackguard? Indeed. She came with him and lies beyond that door. If you hurry, you just might catch her.
Have you another question, then?
Ahhh, now that is an interesting question. I, myself, have wondered much about the nature of Maugrim's mistress. How is it that she gives him such power?
The plague was loosed to strengthen her, you see. Each death in Neverwinter fed her with new life-force. And I know she seeks even more power, yet.

Maugrim is desperate to find what he calls the 'Words of Power'. They are ancient artifacts I believe... four in total, though I had never heard of them before Maugrim, himself, made mention. He holds only one, but his mistress wishes them all.
What these 'Words of Power' would do for Maugrim and his mistress one can only guess... I'm sure you can. It would amuse me to see you halt their efforts, if that is your goal.
I have been in contact with my dear Nyphithys, and she has told me much about you. Sadly she has not been able to reach my old sanctum as you have, or I would already be free.
So? Will you free me or no, little mortal?
I am waiting, fool. Destroy the braziers and I will add my power to yours. I desire to be free!
It is done! I am free at last! Would that I could visit vengeance upon Maugrim for this indignity myself!
I give you thanks for my freedom, mortal. I shall open the door to my sanctum... you may deal with Maugrim at your leisure. Do not be here, however, when I return.
But you... you intend to be the fly in Maugrim's ointment, do you not? That will do. I will tell you what I know of his desires, little mortal.
Have you not wondered at the nature of Maugrim's mistress? How it is that she gives him such power?
The plague was loosed to strengthen her, you see. Each death in Neverwinter fed her with new life-force. And I know she seeks even more power, yet.

Maugrim is desperate to find what he calls the 'Words of Power'. They are ancient artifacts I believe... four in total, though I had never heard of them before Maugrim, himself, made mention. He holds only one, but his mistress wishes them all.
What these 'Words of Power' would do for Maugrim and his mistress one can only guess... I'm sure you can. It would amuse me to see you halt their efforts, if that is your goal.
I would rather it had not come to this... but so be it.
Me must be going.
I must go.
I wish you well, then, my <lord/lady>. May Tyr bless your efforts.
What's this? You don't have a Stone of Recall? Here, take this one. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.

Host Tower Lab Notes

This book explains that the focus of a lab found on this level is to summon a powerful weapon. The arcane ritual appears to mention two ingredients to be placed within the Alchemist's Apparatus - a gargoyle's skull and a slaad's tongue. It is not clear which spell is to be the catalyst that summons the item but the final line reads: 'Dispel the magical essence from the components that you may reap your reward.'
This finely crafted ring bears the family crest of a proud and noble elven family.

The note is handwritten and dated from shortly before the events in the tower were likely to take place. It reads:
"Please inform the apprentices that they are no longer to dump their failed alchemical experiments into the sewer. One can only wonder how those potions affect the water under the city."
The signature is indecipherable.

This forged diplomatic pass was given to you by Aarin Gend. It designates the bearer as an official representative of the far-off land of Mulhorand come to deal with the leader of the Arcane Brotherhood. The pass bears the magical seal that will allow the bearer to pass unharmed through the wards on the bridge to the island of the Host Tower.

One part inventor, three parts madman, a man by the name of Colmarr has created a machine that can turn the murky waters of the Luskan sewers into equally murky magical potions. Chased from the scene by the sewer's more typical denizens, Colmarr was forced to leave his so-called Fantabulous Contraptulater behind. While the main body of the contraption is quite sturdy, it bore a series of four levers that were far more fragile. No doubt inquiring minds have already snapped them off and scattered them throughout the city. If the machine is to be restored to full use, all four levers will have to be found and re-attached.

One part inventor, three parts madman, a man by the name of Colmarr has created a machine that can turn the murky waters of the Luskan sewers into equally murky magical potions. Chased from the scene by the sewer's more typical denizens, Colmarr was forced to leave his so-called Fantabulous Contraptulater behind. While the main body of the contraption is quite sturdy, it bore a series of four levers that were far more fragile. No doubt inquiring minds have already snapped them off and scattered them throughout the city.
Luckily one of the levers was unharmed and a second has been discovered and reattached. Two more remain to be found before the machine will function once again.

One part inventor, three parts madman, a man by the name of Colmarr has created a machine that can turn the murky waters of the Luskan sewers into equally murky magical potions. Chased from the scene by the sewer's more typical denizens, Colmarr was forced to leave his so-called Fantabulous Contraptulater behind. While the main body of the contraption is quite sturdy, it bore a series of four levers that were far more fragile. No doubt inquiring minds have already snapped them off and scattered them throughout the city.
Luckily one of the levers was unharmed and another two have since been discovered and reattached. One more lever remains to be found before the machine will function once again.

One part inventor, three parts madman, a man by the name of Colmarr has created a machine that can turn the murky waters of the Luskan sewers into equally murky magical potions. Chased from the scene by the sewer's more typical denizens, Colmarr was forced to leave his so-called Fantabulous Contraptulater behind.
The machine has been found and its functions restored. It looks as if you could pull the levers until they are in the desired position. To activate the machine it looks as if you must pull the chain right beside the levers. Those wishing to brave the stench of the sewers and potions alike are welcome to experiment with it.

Londa, a world-weary woman staying at Luskan's Cutlass Inn, has lost all nine of her children to Baram, one of the city's vicious High Captains. She is hesitant to think of what cruelty they have suffered at his hands and longs only to hear news of them and have them returned safely to her side.
High Captain Baram has informed you that he cruelly had all nine of the children killed... that there is no chance of saving them. There is no way of knowing whether Baram is telling the truth. Regardless, Londa is unlikely to take the news well.

Politics makes for strange bedfellows, it seems. Certainly, there is no love lost between Bela's brothel and the High Captains of Luskan. Bela suggests that enemies of the High Captains might benefit by seeking out one of her boys, Oreth, who works upstairs...

Politics makes for strange bedfellows, it seems. One of Bela's bitter courtesans has informed you that Kurth's main base lies in the walled-off West Docks district, accessible through a gap in the western wall near Kurth's ruined tower. With the right key, however, one could access a back entrance that can be found within the ruined tower, itself.

A strange outcast ghoul has been encountered in the sewers beneath Luskan, envious of his 'brother' who holds an amulet that retains the last of their mortal power. He has offered to reward the party should they manage to take the amulet from the ghoul lord and return it to him.
The amulet belonging to the ghoul lord has been obtained. The strange outcast ghoul offered a reward to the party should that amulet be returned to him.

A strange outcast ghoul has been encountered in the sewers beneath Luskan, envious of his 'brother's' amulet... a magical device which he claims holds the last of their mortal power. The amulet has been returned to him and the ghoul seemed pleased... even though he did warn the party to never return.

The city of Luskan rises and falls on the quarrels of its High Captains. Lately, those quarrels have become an all-out war for supremacy and the two remaining contenders, Kurth and Baram, have pulled out all the stops. Very recently, adventurers have laid siege to Kurth's base.
Inside the base, a prisoner was discovered who offered some information on Kurth. He said that Kurth was obtaining much of his power from the demonic portal in the base, and that more information on the portal could probably be found in the arcane library.
Luskan: The Ruins of Illusk

A magical inscription has been found on a statue in the Docks of Luskan. It tells of the Ruins of Illusk that lie beneath Luskan and how they have been sealed with three wards to hold a great evil within. Apparently, the one who breaks the seals is the one who will kill the great evil that haunts the Ruins.

A magical inscription has been found on a statue in the Docks of Luskan. Apparently, the one who breaks the seals is the one who will kill the great evil that haunts the Ruins.
Adventurers have broken the first seal in the Ruins.

A magical inscription has been found on a statue in the Docks of Luskan. Apparently, the one who breaks the seals is the one who will kill the great evil that haunts the Ruins.
Adventurers have broken the third and final seal in the Ruins. Voleron the Damned waits below.

A magical inscription has been found on a statue in the Docks of Luskan. It tells of the Ruins of Illusk that lie beneath Luskan and how they have been sealed with three wards to hold a great evil within. Apparently, the one who breaks the seals is the one who will kill the great evil that haunts the Ruins.
The three seals have been broken and Voleron the Damned has been slain. The curse of the Ruins of Illusk has been broken.

Through your valiant efforts, the city of Neverwinter has been saved and what citizens it still has have been spared the suffering of the Wailing Death. Desther, the man responsible for spreading the plague, did not act alone, however. He had substantial backing from a powerful and mysterious cult, which was tracked down with considerable effort to be based within the Host Tower of the Arcane Brotherhood in Luskan.
The leader of the cult, a sorcerer by the name of Maugrim, had engineered a coup to overthrow the order of wizards and bring the majority of its power under the influence of the cult. This power was used to approach other powers in the North and throw the city of Luskan into chaos... all in an effort to build an army that could assault Neverwinter. This army will be led by none other than Lady Aribeth herself... a fallen paladin who has become a blackguard in the service of the same mistress as Maugrim: a strange lizard creature by the name of Morag.
This Morag seeks 'Words of Power'... what they are or what will happen once Morag obtains them is unknown, but they may prove to be the only way to block the great power Maugrim and his cult have already gathered.
Time is of the essence. You must bring this information quickly to Aarin Gend at the Temple of Tyr!

Over there! Kill them and search their packs for the Words of Power!
None shall stop the Return! Death to the infidels!
Death to all who oppose the Old Ones!
More of Gend's puppies! 100 gold for each head ye bring me!

What a horrible thing to say! You're a vile, disgusting man!
I'd never defend a horrible man like you!
Rolgan was no murderer. He was only defending himself!

Look at this... it's the smooth talking lawyer! Tough break about that Uthgardt murderer getting his head chopped off. Maybe I should go see if his pretty little wife needs someone to comfort her in her grief.
Well, look at this. If it isn't the smooth talking lawyer! If I ever murder someone, I'm going to get you to represent me!
You're pretty quick to judge me, considering you represented a killer and all. But I didn't come to this bar to talk about the tiral. I'm just looking for some female companionship. So...

That's the same song you were singing at the trial - I'm getting a little bored with it. Anyway, I didn't come here to this bar to talk about the trial. I'm just looking for some female companionship! So...
I was just happy to help.
Welcome, <FirstName>. On behalf of the Black Lion Uthgardt tribe let me extend my thanks for your efforts on behalf of Rolgan at his trial.
You did much when others of the Lords' Alliance did nothing. For that you are forever a friend of the people of the Black Lion.
The Black Lion tribe call you Oathbreaker for failing to defend Rolgan. You should leave this place - you are no longer welcome here.
Welcome, <FirstName>. I must congratulate you on your performance at Rolgan's trial. You truly served the cause of justice in his acquital.
I know Neurik appreciates all you have done to aid the Temple in this matter.
Welcome, <FirstName>. I hope you are not feeling any guilt in failing to gain an acquital for the Uthgardt warrior - his blood is not on your hands.
You did your duty in this matter and presented the evidence to the court so justice might be served. Sometimes it is difficult for people to accept that Tyr's justice is harsh.
Rolgan owes you his life, <FullName>. You have earned much honor in defending him. We children of the Black Lion thank you for what you have done.
Rolgan's spirit haunts me for the judgment I have passed - just as he will haunt you for breaking your vow to defend him! Begone, Oathbreaker!
Welcome back. How's the life of the bounty hunter treating you? You bring any orc heads back for me? Or is there something else I can do for you?

Hello, again. If you've come to me looking for work, you're out of luck. With Guzud, Vaath and Obould all out of the picture I'm not handing out anymore bounties. Or was there something else you needed?
What did happen that night with Griff?
Go speak with Zokan. His rooms are in the center of the keep; you'll need to take the east corridor to get there.
You tell me how me gonna kill them golems again, 'kay?
Tell me how to destroy the guardian golems again.
Goodbye.
Me look for Power Words.
I am looking for the Words of Power.
Guar-di-an golem? Cre-a-tor? What you mean?
Guardian golems? Creators? What are you talking about?
Who you be? Is you a ghost?
Who are you? Are you some type of spirit?
You gotta know some way to beat them golems.
Surely there must be some way to defeat these guardian golems.
You not worry. Me gonna kill them golems and free you, ghosty!
Don't worry - I'll destroy the golems and free your spirit!
Go back in time? How me gonna do that?
Go back in time? How am I supposed to do that?
If you not gonna talk normal, me is gonna leave!
If you won't talk sense, then I'm leaving!
Who you be? Is you a ghost?
Who are you? Are you some kind of spirit?
What is you saying? Me not get it.
What are you trying to say? I don't understand you.
Why are you still here? The invulnerable guardian golems of the Creators still walk these halls. You must flee before they destroy you!
You are of the living - there is no place for you here! Flee these ruins, or the guardian golems of the Creators will destroy you!
The magic of the Creators compels me to return to my work. The perfection of the Guardians must be maintained. Leave me to my endless torment.

One of the artifacts you seek is within the heart of this complex, encased in a magically protected vault. But if you seek the Word of Power, the invincible guardian golems of the Creators will surely destroy you.
The Creators fashioned the guardian golems to protect this place and the Word of Power within. The golems that walk these halls cannot be beaten, they are invulnerable.
The magic of the Creators has sustained them for ten thousand years, just as it has bound my spirit here for all eternity to maintain the golems in their flawless perfection.
I am a spirit doomed to be a slave to the Creators in death, even as I was a slave to them in life. My soul is forever bound to this place and the invulnerable golems the Masters forced me to create.
I was a slave when the golems were first fashioned ten thousand years ago, before this ghostly existence I now endure. The guardians were built without flaw or imperfection - they cannot be beaten!

To destroy the golems you would have to travel back in time, to the ancient days when the Creators walked the earth. You would have to travel to the time the golems were being made, and introduce a single flaw into their creation.
This small imperfection would make them vulnerable, and would break the spell of the Creators that binds my spirit to this place and compels me to sustain the golems for all eternity.
I pray for your success, though I fear you are a fool to try. I am doomed to this fate, but you can still escape this accursed place.
There is powerful magic in the lands beneath this complex. The Creators used the magic to build the sundials so they might travel back through the rifts of time.
The secrets of the sundials were not given to the slaves, but if you find a way to unleash their magic you can travel back to the time when the golems were being built.
Ulak sabba por! Poad hisa ul pathcea fea gal!
Jula va pekito. Rawa asagus.
You give me gold for getting you out!
Is there a reward for rescuing you?
I'm free! I'm free!
You didn't really think this through, did you? I'm a prisoner here - notice the cage. Do you really think the fire giants would let a prisoner keep his gold?

I already went and got the snow globe. You better come up with something else.

Cultist Journal

This is the personal journal of one of the cult members. Most of the entries are detailed observations about a woman named Esthelia, who might have been another member of the search party. Sandwiched in between the sexual commentary are a few entries about the duties of the group.
Excerpt: "I hate these stinking woods. We were supposed to be doing guard duty in Luskan, but orders came down and next thing you know, we're racing north and hunting for some kind of magical words.
"Boyd 'The Cockroach' figures we're going to have to try to sneak into the lair of those giants we saw the other day and try to search there. I think his time as patrol leader must be nearly up. I still have that elven arrow I found. It would be a real pity if the elves managed to assassinate our brave leader..."

This is the journal of a cult member. It would appear that at one point in time, this cultist was a nobleman, due to the constant reminiscences of the "days of wealth and privilege."
Excerpt: "I amused myself today with memories of the annual fox-hunt at the Vintner Estate. There were some old ruins, back in the woods behind his southern fields that the fox might head for. As we searched the ruins today, I imagined that the Words of Power were the fox and I the hound.
"The other's must have thought I was cracking up when I started to laugh for no apparent reason, but I suddenly conjured up the image of Lord Vintner as a bespectacled hound and I couldn't help myself."

This is the journal of a cult member. It details the search for the Words of Power. Excerpt: "All glory to the coming Queen of the Old Ones. Today I had to deal with a traitor in our midst. Jerica was walking beside me as I discussed the possibility of another foray into that cursed dungeon. She was behaving strangely, quiet and introspective. Suddenly she asked me if I thought what we were doing was right. I asked her what she meant and she hesitantly replied that she was wondering if we should actually be serving the Old Ones. The Coldwood knew blood that day. I had her stripped and tied between two of the trees. I whipped her myself until the flesh hung from her back in long strips. As I whipped her, she begged for forgiveness for her doubt. I was going to let her live, but then she cried out to Ilmater, for release. As she muttered her prayer, I cut out her beating heart and burnt it as a sacrifice to the Old Ones.
Gold
The handle of this heavy, ornate key is fashioned into the likeness of an ancient red wyrm - a replica of the mighty Klauth himself.

This notebook identifies the bearer as an official representative of Tyr's justice in Rolgan's murder trial and explains the rules of court, including the right for defense council to question any of the participants involved before the trial begins.
To aid you in your task Neurik has included notes on the witnesses and jurors and where you might be able to locate them for questioning.
Witnesses: Rolgan - the accused. Currently under my protection in the Temple of Tyr. Zed - a Lords' Alliance soldier. Recently has been spending most of his time in the soldiers' barracks. Lodar - a Lords' Alliance soldier. Usually found in the drinking house when not on duty. Vanda - wife of the accused. Spends her time on the plateau by Beorunna's Well.
Jurors: The jurors have been selected to ensure a fair representation to all sides in the dispute.
Edegar - my assistant, a good and honest man. He is usually to be found here helping out in the temple. Averik - a Lords' Alliance soldier. When not in the company of a female he can be found in the drinking house. Jevon - a Lords' Alliance soldier. A reliable young man who spends most of his free time in the barracks. Dalcia - a female ranger. She spends her time living with the Uthgardt on the plateau near Beorunna's Well. Palla - a wise woman of the Uthgardt. She makes her home on the plateau near Beorunna's Well.
When you are ready to start the trial, go speak to Neurik at the Temple of Tyr.
Adventurer's Note

An adventurer's journal; most of the pages are torn and blood-stained, but a few notes can be made out still:
"The golems are invincible; it is only luck that has them move so slowly they cannot keep up.
"There must be some way to defeat them; the strange wizard in the garden seems to know something, but she won't tell me.
"I must leave now, I know, else I may never see my family again. If only I can make it back to the door.
This key was possessed by the guardian golems in the Creator Race Ruins; it opens the door they were protecting.
Golem Key

This note appears to be instructions from a high priest to one of his underlings describing how to enter the central vault of the complex:
As a keeper of the sacred artifacts you must understand the secrets of our inner sanctum. Only the rituals of smoke, light and sound will unbind the door - there is no other way to enter its hallowed walls. Once the slaves have finished building our golems, our defenses will be fully intact.
The enslaved fairy will guide you through the ritual of sound, for she is bound to the magic of the gongs.
To complete the ritual of smoke you must cast the blessed powders on the sacred brazier so that their combinations match the descending order of the stones set into the brazier's base.
The ritual of light can only be completed using the stones drawn from the holy pool in the center of the pillars. Begin by choosing any two of the single stones set in the primary color pools. The secondary pools must then be filled with the twin gems that match the corresponding color that would be created by combining the hues of the stones in the primary pool.
You may keep this letter for a fortnight, and then you will be tested on what you have learned. Master the secrets of the rituals and the Queen will be pleased with you. Fail to learn them and you shall suffer a grisly fate.

These appear to be the lab notes of Cyril, the mage who created this laboratory:
I believe I have at last unlocked the keys to creating the Staff of Command! As I suspected all along, the key ingredients were a rakshasa eye and a quartz crystal. However, determining the proper spell to cast on the components once they were combined in my laboratory was not as simple as I had at first assumed.
My error came in looking for an obscure solution, and missing the stunningly obvious answer right in front of me. Of course the necessary spell to create a Staff of Command is Dominance.
I must remember this valuable lesson - the most obvious solution is often the right one, even when dealing with the arcane.
This door is protected by a golem. It must be killed before this door can be opened.
The door is blocked; you'll have to find another way.

Without the protection of its commander, the catapult is easily destroyed.
The catapult cannot be harmed while its commander is still alive.
Asgard?
They could be anywhere in that war zone - inside an abandoned home, holed up in an empty shop. Nobody knows where they are... except maybe Asgard. But nobody even knows if he's still alive!
Asgard used to be a smuggler in Neverwinter, until he lost his sight. Now he's just an old, blind man. But he knew this city inside out - the location of every hidden passage and secret hideout.

Asgard might be able to help us get to Aribeth and Maugrim... if we knew where to find him. Last I heard he was living in the district just beyond the south gates, but now that it's become a warzone I doubt he's even still alive.
Captain Trancar?
He took a platoon into the war zone to try and stop the catapults and the war golems, but last I heard they had been driven back to the City Core.
He's the one you should speak to if you want to save the city. I think he's holed up in the old mercenary enclave.
Thanks for finding me; it's much warmer here. Out in the streets it was always cold.
Me need healing.
I need healing.
Who you be?
Who are you?
Me not understand 'bout Stone of Recall and teleport portal.
Teleportation portal? Stone of Recall? I don't understand.
That be big power magic!
That's some pretty powerful magic!
That's handy.
Me need you go over that one more time.
Can you explain that again?
Goodbye.
Me need to return to mission. Me need to go back to place where me died.
I need to return to my mission. I must get back to where I just was.
Send me back.
What you mean? Why me not want go back?
What do you mean? Why wouldn't I want to go back?
Me need prepare stuff before me continue mission. Goodbye.
I need to prepare before I resume my mission. I'll see you later.
Teleport portal? Recall Stone? What you be talking about?
Teleportation portal? Stone of Recall? What are you talking about?
That's handy.
Me want go back to spot where me almost die! Me want go right now!
I want to go back to the place where I nearly died, and I want to go now!
Me change my mind. Goodbye.
I've changed my mind. I'll see you later.
Yes. Me want to go back now.
Yes. Transport me there now.
How me get here?
How did I get here?
Me no want Recall spell! Me want to control me own fate! Cancel spell now!
Me not feel hurt at all. How me get healed?
I don't want some stinking Word of Recall spell whisking me anywhere. Cancel the spell, right now!
Me not like that! But me accept it. Can you get me back to where me just was?
Fine then! I still need to get back to where I was. Can you help with that?
I don't feel hurt at all. How was I healed?
When you cast Recall spell on me?
Ummm...when did you cast this Word of Recall spell on me?
Who you be?
Who are you?
Greetings, <FirstName>. Aarin Gend has instructed me to provide whatever assistance I can to you in your mission to recover the Words of Power.
However my magic is not of a healing nature. My skills are tied to the teleportation portal in this temple and the Stone of Recall in your backpack. Is there something I can do for you, <FirstName>?
You should speak to Oleff in that case. My abilities are tied strictly to the Stone of Recall and the teleportation portal. Is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
I am Sergol, a priest of Tyr. It is my duty to aid and assist those in the service of Neverwinter, though I am no healer.
My magic is tied to the Stone of Recall in your backpack and the teleportation portal you see in this room. Now, is there something else you need of me?
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
I thought you would be familiar with this by now. However, it is important so I will go over the use of the Stone of Recall again.
In your backpack you carry a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly teleport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
This will allow you to return quickly to town whenever you need to, saving precious traveling time.
There is more, <FirstName>. Once you have used the stone to return, go through the teleportation portal and it will instantly send you back to the place your stone was last activated.
Anyone in your service - henchmen, familiars and the like - will also be transported with you. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
You're lucky to be alive. We barely managed to bring you back; your soul had nearly departed to the afterlife.
Farewell, <FirstName>. May the grace of Tyr be with you.
I can help you return to the site of your last battle, but are you sure you want to go back so soon?
Whatever you were fighting will still be there. It would be wiser to find a way to avoid this confrontation, or at least to arm yourself better with supplies from some of the shops in the camp.
Or perhaps you should use the teleportation portal to return to the spot where you last activated your Stone of Recall.
Here, I am giving you a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at any time and it will instantly transport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
I thought you would be familiar with this by now. However, it is important so I will go over the use of the Stone of Recall again.
In your backpack you carry a Stone of Recall. You can activate this stone at anytime and it will instantly teleport you and anyone in your service back to this temple.
This will allow you to return quickly to town whenever you need to, saving precious traveling time.
There is more, <FirstName>. Once you have used the stone, go through the teleportation portal at any time and it will instantly send you back to the place your stone was last activated.
Anyone in your service - henchmen, familiars and the like - will also be transported with you. Now, is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
As you wish. I can use my magic to return you to the site you just came from. This will return you to your last battle. Are you ready?
As you wish. Prepare yourself, <FirstName>.
Hmmm. I thought you would have been familiar with this process by now. Very well, I shall explain it to you myself.
You are one of Aarin Gend's most important agents. After all you have done for Neverwinter he wants me to keep watch over you personally.
Before your mission started I cast a Word of Recall spell upon you, so that whenever you become mortally wounded I can immediately teleport you here to safety.
Just now, some enemy must have struck you a near fatal blow, and so the spell's contingency magics activated and whisked you away to safety.
I can't do that, <FirstName>. You are too important. Neverwinter has need of your skills if we're ever to find the Words of Power. We can't risk an untimely demise.
As soon as your battered body appeared, the other clerics here called upon the healing power of Tyr to bring you back from the brink of death.
You are now as ready as you'll ever be to continue with your mission. The Recall spell will activate again if you are dealt another fatal blow.
The spell doesn't require your presence. I simply needed to know your full name, which Aarin Gend provided.
I am Sergol, a priest of Tyr. It is my duty to aid and assist those in the service of Neverwinter.
Ah. You have awakened. I need to speak with you.
We are very disappointed in you, <FirstName>. Your slaughter of innocent people has caused much suffering in a time already overburdened with tragedy.
Were it up to me you would have been left to rot in your grave; however, Aarin Gend has ordered me to resurrect you. Despite your actions, Neverwinter still has need of you.
You will suffer no further consequences for your mad killing spree, but I implore you not to engage in such wholesale slaughter again. Please, focus on the mission you have been given.

Pause and Play.
Ready.

The quickbar lets you use many of your most important skills, feats, abilities and items. To use an ability from the quickbar just hit the corresponding function key from your keyboard or click on the quickbar slot with your mouse.
Any special effects on your character, such as spells or items that affect your stats or give you special immunities or abilities, can be seen by scrolling down to the bottom of your character sheet.

These special effects are also represented by icons that appear on the top of the screen just to the left of your character portrait. Mousing over these icons will bring up a text description of what effect they represent.
Next I'll tell you about the "Pause and Play" function, if you're ready.
In a single player game "Pause and Play" is enabled by default. In a multi-player game it's up to the DM whether "Pause and Play" will be available to the players.

When Pause and Play is enabled you can pause the game by pressing the space bar. While paused, you can select a spell to cast or use a special ability or item with the same controls used during actual game play.
These actions will show up in an action queue across the top of the screen in the order you selected them. You can clear the action queue at any time by clicking on the ground.

You can also switch equipment, armor and weapons while in pause mode, although, like the actions in the action queue, these changes won't take effect until normal gameplay resumes. To end pause mode, just press the space bar again.
They will deal with you. I am needed elsewhere.
There is nothing you can do to stop us. Minions attack!
What? You survived? It matters not. You will die here!
If you can't cast healing spells, use a potion to heal me. Just drag one to me from your inventory and I'll use it. Now let's get out of here!
What was that?
Go on.
You maybe say that stuff over, okay?
Could you go over that again?
Me gots it. What's else you want to say?
I understand. Anything else?
On the subject of henchmen, you'll need to remember a few things. For instance, when you gain a level, your henchman will also gain a level, matching your progress.
However, this only happens if they are in your party when you gain the level. When you first meet a henchman, or if they were not present for a time, you may be more experienced than they are.
Don't worry, you can train them and make up the difference. When you speak with a henchman that is a lower level than you, you will have the option to tell them to level up. Easy as that.

Marrok of the Hammer's catalog of weapon and armor modifications.
Here be the list of whats I need and whats you, the customer, get. I'll be wanting a goodly number of coins as well, depending on what I wants to charge you. Puts the items in the forge and talks to me, Marrok, with your gold in your pocket.
Armor and Axes: Chromatic Breastplate: Requires a diamond and a suit of magical armor of total AC:6.
Scales of Truth: Requires special holy water and a suit of magical armor of total AC:5.
Whitebone Armor: Requires gargoyle skull and a suit of magic armor of total AC:3.
Sentinel: Requires adamantite and a magic battleaxe.
Double Axe of the Tall Kin: Requires adamantite and a magic double axe.
Stonefire Great Axe: Requires adamantite and a magic great axe.
Ice Reaver Hand Axe: Requires dragon blood and a magic hand axe.
Maces and the like: Gladiator Club: Requires ironwood and a magic club.

Reaver Heavy Flail: Requires dragon blood and a magic heavy flail.
Storm Light Hammer: Requires a diamond and a magic light hammer.
Foundation Light Flail: Requires ironwood and a magic light flail.
Mace of Disruption: Requires special holy water and a magic mace.
Drone Morning Star: Requires fairy dust and a magic morning star.
Rune Hammer: Requires adamantite and a magic war hammer.
Blades both Sharp and True: Harbinger Kin Greatsword: Requires adamantite and a magic greatsword.
Sword Saint Katana: Requires adamantite and a magic katana.
Astral Blade Longsword: Requires a diamond and a magic longsword.
Namarra Rapier: Requires dragon blood and a magic rapier.
Desert Wind Scimitar: Requires adamantite and a magic scimitar.
Feyduster Short Sword: Requires Fairy Dust and a magic short sword.
Uthgardt Ceremonial Two-Bladed Sword: Requires ironwood and a magic two-bladed sword.
Rarer Fare: Ravager Halberd: Requires dragon blood and a magic halberd.
Sea Reaver Scythe: Requires adamantite and a magic scythe.
Fey Spear: Requires fairy dust and a magic spear.
Golden Sickle: Requires special holy water and a magic sickle.

To victory!
I will win the day!
Bring it on!
I need healing. Quickly now.
At my side, aid me here!
I see the enemy. Heed what I say.
We are lost! Time to retreat!
Attack if you can! I don't fear you!
Watch my back, all right!
Hold this position.
I feel a poison's taint...
My damned magic has failed.
My attack can't touch them!
Follow in my step.
Have a look over here.
Gather here. Form up.
Stand aside, you're in my way.
This lock needs to be dealt with.
Search this place carefully.
Time to get out of sight. Hide.
I can do that.
I can't do that.
I'm done with this.
I can't carry this much. Lose some of it.
And what do you want?
Greetings to you.
I'd say yes.
Has to be no.
Hold! Stop!
I need some rest if I'm to continue.
We are wasting time. Let's get going!
Goobye to you.
Thank for that. I appreciate it.
Blood of the gods!
That's the way! All right!
Listen to me, you should hear this.
That sounds like a good idea to me.
That is NOT a good idea.
You're messing with more trouble than you can handle.
At their throats! Cut them down!
I'll see you cut asunder!
You breath your last!
Only I will walk away!
My wounds must be healed.
I need help here now!
I see the quarry... The enemy is here.
Away! Retreat! This fight is lost!
Come to me! I await you here!
Guard me well.
Do not relinquish this spot. Hold here.
Venom... In my blood...
Accursed spell! Lost!
My attack has had no effect on this one!
Follow where I lead.
Here. Look this way.
Gather here. Form up.
Move your carcass aside.
This lock needs to be carefully disabled.
Take careful notice searching this place.
To the shadows! Hide!
I can do this.
I cannot do that.
This task is complete.
I am no mule. I carrry too much.
What do you want?
Greetings and well met.
Yes.
No.
Stop. Now.
I am driven past endurance. I must rest.
We are idle too long. Let's get moving.
Fare you well, then.
I... am grateful.
cold chuckle
Shadow and hell....!
I approve!
Listen to me here, and listen well.
That sounds like a fine idea.
That is not a sound idea.
You have no idea the pain you risk. I warn you...
Step up to the fight! Bring them down!
I hope you like pain!
I'll put you in your place.
I always get my way!
Someone heal me... please.
Won't someone help me here?
I see them. The enemy is over here.
This doesn't look good. Let's get out of here!
Come now. Let's see what you've got!
You'll be sure to guard me, won't you?
Now don't you move from this spot.
I don't feel well. I think it's... poison?

Nothing? My attack did nothing?
You'll follow me, won't you?
Come over here. Look at this.
Everyone group up over here, all right?
You'll move over a little, won't you?
This lock needs a very delicate touch.
Search this place very carefully. Take your time.
Get out of sight. Duck into the shadows.
I can do that.
No, I'm sorry, I can't do that.
I'm all finished with this.
Oh, I simply can't carry all of this.
Yes? What do you want?
Well hello there.
I say yes.
I have to say no.
Stop now. Wait.
I'm so tired. Can't we just lie down for a moment?
This is so boring. Let's go find some action.
Bye bye.
Thank you so very much.
That.. is so... frustrating!
Oh ho, I like that!
I think you should lend me your ear for a moment.
I think that is a... very good idea.

Keep acting like that, you'll see just how bad I can be.
All right, I says you attack right now!

I smack you down!
Bleed and die!
I hurt. Heal me right now.
Help me here right now!
Look, I see the enemy here.
We run now! This fight is lost!
You step up and I smack you back! Come on!

You not move from here. Hold this spot.

I can do.

Why have you returned, warm-blood? **hiss** My magic cannot sustain this astral pocket much longer. You must leave through the portals and return to your own world so that I may finally be free to pass from this existence.
The Great Tree
Tell me again about your vision of my future.
Me want you to say again about what you see in me future.
Goodbye, Haedraline.
**hiss** I see you still live, warm-blood. **hiss** I feared you had perished with Morag and the rest of the Old Ones when the Source Stone collapsed.
What is this place, Haedraline? How did I get here?
Where is we, Haedraline lizard-girly? How me get here?
The Source Stone collapsed? What are you talking about?
Source Stone collapse? What you mean?
You again? What do you want now?
You again? What you want now, lizard-girly?
I am anxious to return to my own world, Haedraline.
Me just want to go home now, lizard-girly.
When you destroyed Morag you destroyed her magic as well. **hiss** The world she had created - the Source Stone - crumbled into nothingness, and all trapped within it were utterly consumed. **hiss**

I used my magic to open a portal from the collapsing Source Stone into this astral pocket, a temporary place of refuge between that world and your own. **hiss** I am glad you found the portal and escaped with your life, warm-blood.
**hiss** My time here grows short. The Words of Power are broken and my magic is fading. **hiss** Soon I will pass from this existence and this astral pocket will also collapse.
Pass from this existence? Are you dying?
What you mean by pass from ex-ist-ence? Is you dying?
So it's over, then? Neverwinter is safe once more?
So it all be over? Neverwinter be safe now?
The time of the Creator Race is over. **hiss** There is no place for me in your world now, just as there was no place for Morag. I have accepted this, warm-blood.
You have faced Morag and the Old Ones and triumphed. **hiss** Even the foul and ancient magics of the dark Queen could not stand against your might.

You are the savior of Neverwinter, warm-blood - but you are also much, much more. **hiss** You have altered the fate of not just your own world, but a thousand others that would have fallen to Morag's armies.
I only did what had to be done.
Me only did what me had to do.
Maybe people should start bowing down before my awesome greatness.
Wow! People should bow down whenever me come near.
For all the work I did you'd think I could get more of a reward.
Me think me could get some big reward for all the work me do.
Few could have faced Morag's power and survived. **hiss** But even though you have ended the threat of the Creator Race your work is far from done, for I have seen glimpses of what fate awaits you.
I have marked well your evil nature, warm-blood. **hiss** You hunger for power and wealth, you seek to dominate and destroy those who will not bow down before you. **hiss**
You are a champion of the North, a defender against all that is dark and evil. **hiss** Hold fast to what you believe to be true and your courage shall not fail when you face your greatest challenge.

Your legend and fame will continue to grow, spreading throughout the North. **hiss** But Morag will not be the most dangerous foe you face in your lifetime. **hiss** As you become ever more powerful, so will those who seek to destroy you.

Take heed of my warning, warm blood. You are not so different from my people - or from Morag herself. **hiss** As your terrible legend grows, so will the power and conviction of those who stand against you.

Heroes will rise to challenge your tyranny, just as you rose to challenge Morag. **hiss** Hoard your power and marshal your forces, for you will need all your resources to triumph against those who would cast you down.
Who are these upstarts who will dare to stand against me?
Who be them ones who want to fight with me?
Greatest challenge? What do you mean?
Greatest challenge? What you mean by that?

The city of Neverwinter is still vulnerable, and there are other enemies who seek to destroy it - and you. **hiss** There are sinister forces that will ally against you, for you are a symbol of all that is righteous and good.
More than this I cannot say, for my magic has grown weak with the destruction of the Words of Power, and the mists of time cloud my vision.
Quickly now, warm-blood. I cannot sustain this astral pocket much longer. **hiss** The portal behind me will return you to your own world.
I thank you for all you have done - never again will I be a Word Slave. **hiss** Go through the portal so that I may finally pass to my long awaited eternal rest.
What are you talking about? Who seeks to destroy me?
What you mean? Who be person who want to destroy me?

There are many who will try to steal that which you have worked so hard for, and others will seek to forge their own legend by destroying you. **hiss** Your enemies will band together, they will strike when you least expect it. **hiss** That is the price of fame and fortune.
**hiss** You speak with arrogance, but there is truth in your words.
You have done everything I have asked of you, warm-blood. **hiss** Morag has been defeated, the magic of the Words of Power is broken. **hiss**

The Creator Race can never return, and never again will I be a Word Slave. **hiss** You are free to leave this astral realm at any time, with my thanks. The portal behind me will take you back to your own world.

This document is a short summary of the basic plan of attack that the Luskan force is using during its assault on Neverwinter. Aribeth as war leader, is commanding the army from Maugrim's Sanctuary, an extra-planar domain created by Maugrim. Supposedly it can be reached via a portal located in a courtyard to the southeast. The final line reads, "Beware the Baalor, for he guards the entrance into Maugrim's Sanctuary and will kill all trespassers."

By checking the 'Remember Password' checkbox the game will remember your password the next time you run the game. It will always remember the last user name that logged in.

Enter a user name, email address, and password in the fields provided. You must confirm your password in order to ensure it is indeed what you believe it to be. Although the email address field is not necessary, if you don't enter one, you won't be able to to recover your password should you forget it. When logging into the Neverwinter master server and creating a new account, user names are unique. You will have to keep trying until you find one that is not used. If you want the game to remember your password for the next time you log in, check the 'Remember Password' checkbox. You must be careful, however, not to leave this checked when playing on a public machine.
Cloak of Resistance +2
Cloak of Resistance +3
Cloak of Resistance +4
Cloak of Resistance +5
Cloak of Arachnida

This black garment, embroidered with a web-like pattern in silk, gives the wearer many of the abilities of a spider. The cloak also grants immunity to entrapment by web spells or webs of any sort.
Cloaks of this type are common in the Underdark, and are almost standard raiment for drow priestesses.
Cloak of the Bat

Known only by his nickname, Stiletto the thief became renowned for his amazing skill at burglary. He claimed he could get in and out of the most secure, heavily guarded treasure rooms without ever getting caught. Once, on a dare, he snuck into Zhentil Keep and stole a ring from Fzoul's high chambers. Getting in seemed to be easy, but escaping turned out to be more difficult. When Stiletto found himself surrounded by multiple guards, the secret of his career was revealed. Stiletto turned into a bat and flew out through a window.
Cloak of Displacement

Interwoven with strands of sinew from a displacer beast's tentacles, the fabric of a Cloak of Displacement distorts and warps light waves, much like the displacement spell, making it much harder for enemies to score a proper hit on the wearer.
Cloak of Greater Sanctuary

These silvery gray cloaks seem to absorb light rather than be illuminated by it. On command, these cloaks make their wearer wraithlike in appearance.
The gnome wizard Dimble Deagal confounded Lathander's clerics in Featherdale for years before his secret was finally revealed by a traveler skilled in the Art. Dimble owned one of these cloaks and used it to scare the local farmers. The Featherdarrans had mistaken the often insubstantial gnome for an actual ghost and roused the local exorcists who continually failed to turn the false specter.
Greater Mantle of Spell Resistance
This embroidered garment is worn over normal clothing or armor. A favored defensive tool of powerful spellcasters, it grants the wearer significant resistance to all spells.
Vestments of Faith

These holy garments are most often a gift from Ilmater to a favored disciple. They are worn over normal clothing and grant a special protection to the person wearing it, helping to ease that faithful soul's physical suffering.
Laeral's Storm Armor
This well-crafted suit of full plate armor is made of a strange, nonmetallic material that does not conduct electricity. Lore has it that the substance is native to some other plane.
Storm Armor of the Earth's Children

This well-crafted suit of full plate armor is sized for smaller humanoids, and is crafted of a strange nonmetallic substance that does not conduct electricity or heat. Lore has it that the substance comes from some other plane of existence.
Cape of the Fire Bath

Common among clerics and other powerful followers of Kossuth, these cloaks of resistance are brilliant red and embroidered with images of flames. The wearer can withstand both extremely hot weather and mystical fire damage.
Cape of Winter

These cloaks of resistance are commonly found among frost giants and other Auril-worshipping creatures in the frozen North. The cloak is white and trimmed with white fur.
The wearer can withstand extremes of cold weather and magical cold damage as well.
Cloak of Blackflame

This cloak resembles a tangle of thick, black cobwebs when not worn, but smoothes into a woven black cloak of coarse threads when donned. It protects its wearer from energy-draining attacks.
Such cloaks originated in the halls of Sorcere in the city of Menzoberranzan where they are used by drow necromancers to protect themselves from their own creations. This cloak is an adaptation for use in the surface realm.
Hair Shirt of Ilmater
This heavy shirt is made of coarse brown horsehair, unpleasant to the touch.

This thick shirt of coarse brown horsehair constrains its wearer but provides additional protection from damage. In addition, the wearer can invoke cure serious wounds once per day.
Generally made and worn by disciples of Ilmater, the wearers of these garments usually only use the shirt's curative powers to ease the suffering of others.

<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Secret word? Tell me about it. We're friends, right?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Secret word? Maybe you say it? We friends, okay?
Tell me the word or I'll get you in trouble. I'll tell your mother you stole something.
Tell word or me get yous in trouble. Me lie to yous mummy and say you steal or something.
Why you gotta lie like that? I never did nothing. I'll tell you, just don't lie to momma. It's just a word, anyway. It opens the bookshelf.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, I guess. Just don't tell momma. I hide behind the bookshelf. You say a word and it opens. It's a silly word, though.
The word is "hal-you-eth." I dunno what it means, but it opens the shelf when you say it. Weird, huh?
I already said it out once, I might as well say it more. We got a secret word that opens the bookcase. The word is "hal-you-eth." I dunno what it means.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I'll get in trouble. I don't want make things worse. Mommy cries a lot because of people getting sick.

Moonstone Mask: Statuette for Ophala
Moonstone Mask: Urn for Ophala

A portrait of Sir Reginald Rumbottom III has been found that appears to have the name "Ophala Cheldarstorn" written on the back. She is the famous matron of the Moonstone Mask. It is likely she would be interested in it.
It turns out that Ophala was interested in acquiring the portrait, among other things.
A gaudy statuette has been found that appears to be a partially nude representation of Ophala Cheldarstorn, the famous matron of the Moonstone Mask. It is likely she would be interested in it.
It turns out that Ophala was interested in acquiring the statuette, among other things.

A gilded urn has been found that appears to have suffered a roughly head-sized dent. "Best Wishes, Ophala Cheldarstorn" has been scratched into the base of it. If this is referring to Ophala Cheldarstorn, famous matron of the Moonstone Mask, she would certainly be interested in it.
It turns out that Ophala was interested in acquiring the gilded urn, among other things.

We need people safe, first of all. We also need to find out what is causing this infestation. The undead don't simple get up. Something has to drag them back from the other side.
Anyone need immediate help?
Any guys need helps to come fast?
Krestal in the west, north of the Helmite shrine, and Jemanie in the center of the east edge of the district. Their homes are in overrun areas, and we don't know if they are alive or not.
Krestal in the west, north of the Helmite shrine. His home is in an overrun area and we don't know if he's alive or not.
Jemanie in the center of the east edge of the district. His home is in an overrun area and we don't know if he's alive or not.
Hopefully something can be learned from the people we save. I have runners in the area that may be able to inform us if guards like you find anything. Just ask if we've found anything new.
I think most people have been secured here or in the Helmite shrine. Now all that is left is to find what is behind all of this. I hope I can provide you information to help in the investigation.

Opened 2
Robes of the Old Order
Robes of the Dark Moon

Whatever the motives of the Monks of the Old Order might be, no one doubts that they are keenly, defensively minded. Rumor has it that the masters of the order attain ranks by being able to survive a beating by an Ogre, without ever raising a hand in defense. True or not, these robes, produced by the order to fund monasteries, are the trade mark of any monk who would survive in the frontlines of combat, against an enemy clad in armor.

When she was a young student in the monastery of the Dark Moon monks, Beyl Van Yoren's teachers would constantly urge her to move faster and faster. They were finally appeased, when she suddenly began to be able to hit them four shots for every one of theirs. Despite her speed, Beyl found she had trouble concentrating on lessons, usually because she was moving so much faster than everyone else, that she would often grow bored and restless. Eventually she gave up the robes and the monastery to go and live with the wizard, whom she had traded 'personal favors' with for months, to earn the robes.
Improved Robes of the Old Order

Robes of the Shining Hand +2
Robes of the Shining Hand +3
Robes of the Shining Hand +4
Robes of the Shining Hand +5

The Shining Hand Monastery in Vaasa has made an impressive reputation, and a small fortune, designing these robes. Demand has spread across many nations, such that different variations on the similar robes keep the monks hard at work. The robes increase a monk’s senses to such a degree that she can focus on her opponent and move her body to absorb blows. One drawback to these robes is that they make the wearer supersensitive to noise. Even in the quiet rooms of the monastery the wearer would have a hard time distinguishing between the snoring of a brother down the hall and the scuttling of a rat under his bed.

Boots of the Sun Soul +5

The original version of these boots were said to be worn by the wise wanderer, Teki Jin, of Kara-Tur. As he traveled and grew in strength, Teki was joined by students who would follow in his path. When a student left to travel their own path, Teki would pass his old boots to his student, to remind them that every path under the sun should be walked in the wisdom of the past. After his death, many copies of his boots would show up in stores, each supposedly handed down from Teki to a student. Even if these copies are nothing more than clever forgeries, they do seem to assist the wearer in avoiding enemy attacks.
Gloves of the Hin Fist +1

Founded by a sect of isolationist halflings, the Monastic Order of the Hin Fist maintains a tradition of solitude paired with the belief that one must first master the self before one can attain mastery over the outside world. Monks of the Order fashioned these gloves with sonic properties so that the outside world could be forewarned of their training and thereby know to keep a distance.

Founded in distant Thay, the Monastic Order of the Long Death celebrates the passage from life to lifelessness in all of its forms. It is said by those who have survived encounters with the Order that the grip of its adherents is like the icy touch of death itself, not soon to be forgotten.

Also referred to as the Disciples of the Saint Sollars, the Monastic Order of the Yellow Rose is known equally for its acts of great loyalty to its allies and those of great destruction to its enemies. Monks of this Order frequently travel alongside paladins of Ilmater, serving as trusted guides and companions to these knights of the suffering lord.

Chaohinon of the Void has been banished back to the dark hells that spawned him. The spot where he was raised now lies empty, awaiting the return of the Guardian Spirit of Helm's Hold.
This altar has been badly mistreated by the false Helmites. Carvings indicate that the Guardian Spirit of the hold would normally reside here, summoned through the use of the Book of Helm.
Lesser Amulet of the Master

Ciressa Gind’ra was a mage who infiltrated the Night Masks for the Harpers, before she was found drowned in a two-inch puddle outside her residence. To infiltrate them, Ciressa created an amulet that allowed her to mimic the abilities of a master thief. One night she used it to break into the Night King’s private quarters. She didn’t anticipate the Night King’s personal guard, who had a permanent detect magic spell surrounding the room. When the Night King was finished with her, he took the amulet and since it had qualities useful for any adventurer, he made copies of it, which he sold throughout the land.
Amulet of the Master
Lesser Amulet of Health

Natnea Chesh was one of the first priestesses of Kelemvor in the Moonshae Islands, and became known as “The Defender of the Dead”, when she helped stop a necromancer from raising an army of undead. As a gift for her heroic deeds, Kelemvor gave her this amulet, along with the secret of making copies for other clerics dedicated to the destruction of powerful undead creatures. Many a thief has since found these items to be invaluable in their line of work as well.
Amulet of Health
Greater Amulet of Health
Lesser Ring of Power

Mynseril Lostbone was a powerful priest of Malar who enjoyed many a bloody brawl or battle, but felt that such fights were simply over too soon. Studying the regenerative capabilities of trolls, Mynseril was convinced that more entertainment value could be garnered from a field of regenerating warriors than a regular battlefield, so he commissioned the creation of a number of powerful rings. When the rings were finished, he distributed them to particularly vicious warriors, who were often on opposite sides of the battlefield.
Ring of Power
Ring of Resistance +1

Confounded by the inability to wear more than two magical rings at once, and desiring the powers of several of his own rings, Jagen Marsk, a Turmish noble, researched the combining of powers in magical rings. While what he was really hoping for was to combine invisibility with teleportation, he eventually had to settle with this ring, that provided a measure of magical protection, with a handy light source. He now sells these rings to finance his ever-growing obsession with more powerful combinations.
Ring of Resistance +2
Ring of Resistance +3

DM Easy:
- Single Player: No PvP (Fireballs and other area effect spells will not harm party members) - Multi Player: As per server setting
- No critical hits on PCs - No attacks of opportunity on players using ranged weapons - No attacks of opportunity on players using potions - PC does a minimum of 100% of damage - NPC does a maximum 25% of damage - Players cannot die - Sleep effectss on players last for a short duration - Domination and Charm effects will daze a player - Hold, Paralyze and Stun effects will daze a player - Confusion effects will daze a player - Fears effects will cause a -2 penalty to hit

Easy:
- Single Player: No PvP (Fireballs and other area effect spells will not harm party members) - Multi Player: As per server setting
- No critical hits on PCs - No attacks of opportunity on players using ranged weapons - No attacks of opportunity on players using potions - PC does a minimum of 50% of damage - NPC does a maximum 50% of damage - Players can die - Sleep effects on players last for a short duration - Domination and Charm effects on players will daze a player - Hold, Paralyze and Stun effects on players last for a short duration - Confusion effects on players function normally - Fears effects on players will give them a -4 penalty to hit
