If you use missile weapons, don't forget to stock up on ammunition before you go adventuring.
Refugee Shelter
The Stone of Recall is a useful way to get back to the core areas to shop, heal, or end nearby quests.
Choose henchmen, animal companions, or familiars that complement your abilities. Ex. Strong fighters need someone that can find traps, heal, or cast spells.
You have an additional 24 quickslots that can be accessed by holding the CTRL or SHIFT keys.
Remember that you can keep your own notes in the journal.
Choose the Point Blank Shot feat if you want to use a ranged weapon in close combat; or, switch to a melee weapon.
Area maps have notes to draw your attention to points of interest. You can add your own map notes as well.
If you find the game to be too difficult or too easy, try changing the difficulty in the Game Options page.
Different types of stores sell different items. If you don't find what you want at one store, check other stores as well.
You can pause the game at any time by pressing the spacebar so you can strategically choose your next few actions in safety.
Poison and disease don't do hit point damage, but lower ability scores instead.
If you are in need of healing, then remember to return to the Temple of Tyr, where healing is free.
While using the Stone of Recall is free, returning to where you were will cost some gold. Still, it is cheaper than dying.
Misplaced plot items can be recovered in any Temple of Tyr. Important lost items will reappear in the temple divining pool.
You can use the radial menu off the chat window to set the different levels of feedback available in the game.
If you join an existing multi-player game, your journal will lack entries given for quests already begun. Your party can tell you what you need to do.
The difficulty setting assumes you will hire a henchman. The game may be too difficult to beat without one.
It costs 100 gold to have an item identified. Several items in the game give you a bonus to your Lore skill to identify items for free.
Clerics don't have to memorize basic healing spells in advance. If dragged directly from spellbook to quickbar, such spells can be cast spontaneously by sacrificing a memorized spell of equal level.
There are components, such as adamantite, that can be used to create magic items in wizard labs and by certain blacksmiths.

Small Stature

Type of Feat: Race Prerequisite: Gnome or Halfling. Specifics: Gnomes and halflings are small creatures. As such, they gain bonuses to their attack rolls, armor class and hide checks when dealing with larger creatures. Note: Because they are so small, they cannot use the following weapons: dire mace, two-bladed sword, double axe, greataxe, greatsword, halberd, heavy flail, quarterstaff, scythe and spear. Use: Automatic.

How to Use This Server Browser
To change the order of information displayed in each of the columns, click on its title at the top. For example: 'Server Name'.
Under the box labled 'Game Type' there are a list of themes. By clicking on one of these themes you are moving from your current Chat Room and Server Filter to the one you selected. Select a theme that best suits you.
To learn more about the settings of a specific server, highlight that server in the server list and click on the 'Server Details' button.
To connect to a server that is listed, highlight that server in the server list and click on the 'Connect' button.
To connect to a friend's specific unlisted server, click on the 'Direct Connect' button. Type in either your friend's IP address (for example - 192.168.0.25) or their DNS name (my.friend.org). If you need to specify a port number, just add the port number to the end of the IP address or DNS name. For example - 192.168.0.25:5122 - my.friend.org:5122
To send a Private Message to someone, double click on their name in the Player List, located in the lower left. Type in your message, then press Enter.

You sense your adventures are fast approaching a point of no return. Before you present Aarin with the final Word of Power you should be certain all your business in Beorunna's Well is complete, and you should be sure the henchman by your side is the one you want for the conclusion of your quest.

Back at Beorunna's Well, Aarin Gend waits for the final Word of Power. Events are moving quickly now - one would be wise to be certain all business in Beorunna's Well is complete before delivering the final Word of Power to Aarin and embarking on the conclusion of this adventure.

Adventurer's Robe
Greater Battle Robe
Mage's Battle Robe

Sick to death of hearing about the prowess of mages like Elminster, Blackstaff, and the Red Wizards of Thay; Klaphen Fortier, a powerful, but relatively unknown wizard, created these robes to bolster young spellcasters across the realms. His hope was that youthful and unscrupulous mages might be encouraged to challenge more powerful wizards in hopes of making a name for themselves. Rumor has it that Klaphen died in an accident of spectacular proportions, when 56 lightning bolts and numerous large meteors struck his tower.
Master Adventurer's Robe

Former Royal Magician Vangerdahast to King Azoun IV of Cormyr was once an accomplished adventurer of high fame. One reason he became popular in wizardly circles was his creation of the Adventurer's Robe. Mages have always struggled with the limitations placed on them by the ability to cast arcane magics. These robes give the mage an edge in surviving encounters with melee fighters by being able to absorb some damage from hits.

This obviously magical pool is filled with an opaque, viscous liquid. The tingle of immense power radiates from the pool and simply being near it fills you with a sense of divine will. An engraving on the side of the pool explains its purpose:

'Infused with the essence of immortal Tyr himself, the Pool of Righteous Energy will recover any relics lost by those who act in the service of the Just God. A small donation to honor Tyr's holy might will be appreciated.'

All evidence seems to indicate that our mission is progressing in the proper direction. I can't imagine what other advice to give you at this time other than to continue in the same manner as we are.
You have no lack of confidence, I see. Yet I suppose you are justified in your arrogance.
I am not certain, <FirstName>, but I sense we are nearing the end of your quest. The only advice I can give you at this time is to continue on the path we already walk.
We should continue on as we are - the Silent Lord is pleased with our work. Other than this I have no advice to give you.
It seems like we're doing alright so far, so I'm not sure what to tell you. Maybe it'd be best if we just kept on doing what we're doing.
Mask of Persuasion

In his battle to deflect the attentions of the god Mask, the drow deity of thievery, Vhaeraun, granted his followers the knowledge to create these helms. These special helms not only mask the faces of his followers, but they make infiltration into enemy camps, such as the Church of Mask, far easier. With these helms, Vhaeraun's dedicated followers are some of the most effective and deadly spies in the realm.
Greater Mask of Persuasion
Zombie Lord's Slam
Slam1d10
Zombie Warrior's Slam
Bombardier/Stink Beetle Bite
Stag Beetle/Hive Mother Bite
Lesser Belt of Guiding Light

Lost and alone in the gloomy wilderness of the underdark, Polt Henrikson prayed for guidance from his venerated deity, Savras. His pleas did not go unheard, and Polt felt a weight around his waist that he soon discovered was a belt. When he touched it, the belt began to glow and suddenly Polt felt a confidence he had never known before. When he emerged from the underdark, Polt went on to lead a revival amongst the worshipers of Savras.
Belt of Guiding Light
Greater Belt of Guiding Light
Belt of Agility +1

Attempting to form an anti-thieves' guild, Ronger Delphos, a successful merchant, paid thieves to become security experts, to guard merchants in Waterdeep. The guards were trained to use wands with the Hold Person spell, to capture the thieves for interrogation. To counteract this security measure, magical belts were purchased by the thieves' guild, which nullified the effects of such spells. In the escalating war between the two guilds, many of these belts found their way into pawnshops and equipment stores.
Belt of Agility +2
Belt of Agility +3
Belt of Agility +4
Boots of Hardiness +1

Having explored the northlands extensively, a druid named Aawill commissioned the creation of these comfortable boots. Knowing he was heading for the sometimes-dangerous domain of the Neverwinter Woods, Aawill was looking for something helpful in combat, to lighten his need for armor. Since becoming the Archdruid for the Neverwinter Wood's Druid Grove, Aawill has commissioned several, more powerful versions of his original boots.
Boots of Hardiness +2
Boots of Hardiness +3
Lesser Gauntlets of Ogre Power

While these magical items have been around for thousands of years, their popularity never seems to decrease. Recently, a party of adventurers out of Calimshan uncovered a vast treasure trove, filled with magical items like these. The sudden influx of magical gauntlets does not seem to have decreased their value, as every adventurer across the land clamors for the assistance of these useful artifacts.
Gauntlets of Ogre Power

TilePathfindWarning
This module was designed for 1-4 players of levels 3-8.
Look, you've already got a copy of my recipe book, so what more do you want? Just read the damn thing.
Me want go back where me last use Recall Stone.
I want to go back to where I last used my Stone of Recall.
If you want to return to where you last used the Stone of Recall you do not have to speak with me. You only have to go into the magic portal here beside me.

The magic of the portal will transport you to the place you last used your Stone of Recall - and it will charge you an appropriate tithe for the convenience, of course. Was there anything else, <FirstName>?
What should yous do if he dead? Where you go?
What should you do if he's dead? Where should you go?
Thanks for the offer, but I'm going off on my own. People have been steering me wrong all night.
This door is presently barred from the other side but shows signs of recent use. Perhaps it will be open later.
A key to the backdoor and storerooms of the Seedy Tavern.
Boddyknock's Tale

Boddyknock told a story of his early past, when he became an apprentice to the wizard Prophyro.
[NOTE: Boddyknock will continue his tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Boddyknock continued the tale of his past, giving out details of his apprenticeship as a mage.
[NOTE: Boddyknock will continue his tale when you are a higher level of experience.]
Boddyknock finished his tale, mentioning that one of the reasons he came to Neverwinter was to seek a recipe for 'leaven bread', supposedly known only to a few master bakers.

The recipe for leaven bread found, Boddyknock was greatly pleased and gifted you with a magic item.
[NOTE: this item may be upgradeable in the future.]
Daelan's Tale

Daelan began a tale of his past, mentioning his exile from his tribe and a shame of blood... though he did not go into detail.
[NOTE: Daelan will continue his tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Daelan continued his story, giving details of his exile in the North.
[NOTE: Daelan will continue his tale when you are a higher level of experience.]
Daelan finished his tale, mentioning that he seeks an important talisman... a brooch that belonged to his mother. It is of little real value, except to him.

His mother's brooch having been returned to him, Daelan gave you a magic item in return.
[NOTE: this item may be upgradeable in the future.]
Grimgnaw's Tale

Grimgnaw talked a bit about his past, including details of his worship of death and the fact that he hails from the fabled Mithral Hall of the dwarves.
[NOTE: Grimgnaw will continue his tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Grimgnaw continued his tale, telling how he joined the Order of the Long Death.
[NOTE: Grimgnaw will continue his tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Grimgnaw finished his tale, mentioning that the real reason he is in Neverwinter is that he is seeking an apprentice of his Order who fled her initiation. Her name is Alaganda, and Grimgnaw needs a ring she wears that bears a falcon crest to prove her death.

Grimgnaw was pleased that Alaganda's ring was found, giving you a magic item in return.
[NOTE: this item may be upgradeable in the future.]
Linu's Tale

Linu told the tale of how she initially came to leave her home of Evereska.
[NOTE: Linu will continue her tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Linu continued the story of her recent past, telling of her failed quest for a holy relic of her church.
[NOTE: Linu will continue her tale when you are a higher level of experience.]
Linu finished her tale, mentioning that she hopes to find the Sacred Chalice of Moonbow somewhere during her journey.

Pleased that the sacred chalice was returned to her, Linu gifted you with a magic item.
[NOTE: this item may be upgradeable in the future.]
Sharwyn's Tale

Sharwyn talked for awhile about her motivation for becoming famous.
[NOTE: Sharwyn will continue her tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Sharwyn continued the tale of her past, talking about how her mother wanted to marry her to a wealthy man.
[NOTE: Sharwyn will continue her tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Sharwyn completed her tale, mentioning that her mother still lives in Neverwinter. Her mother, however, has contracted a serious disease known as bonerot... and Sharwyn hopes to find the cure for the disease somewhere in the city.

Sharwyn was pleased to receive the cure for her mother's disease, and gave you a magic item in return.
[NOTE: this item may be upgradeable in the future.]
Tomi's Tale

Tomi started a tale of his earlier life of thieving in the far-off city of Calimshan.
[NOTE: Tomi will continue his story when you are a higher level of experience.]

Tomi continued his tale about his former life in Calimshan.
[NOTE: Tomi will continue his story when you are a higher level of experience.]

Tomi finished his tale of his life in Calimshan, mentioning that he had come to Neverwinter originally in search of an old friend that was to forge some documents for him. Tomi fears his friend might be dead but hopes to locate the documents somewhere in the city.

Pleased that the documents were found, Tomi gave you a ring.
[NOTE: this ring is possible to be upgraded in the future.]
Design Build 3.15.2 Last Updated May 31, 5pm
This module was designed for 1-4 players of levels 3 to 8.
Design Build 2.5.1, Last Updated May 31, 5pm
This module was designed for 1-4 players of levels 7 to 15.
Leave.
Enter the portal.
This portal will return you to the surface.
<StartAction>Offer fairy dust reagent.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer fenberries reagent.</Start>
<StartAction>Offer quartz crystal reagent.</Start>
Goodbye.
The news I have heard is sad, yet I am sure you did your best. Is there anything I can do for you?
Goodbye.
Thanks. Goodbye.
Nothing. Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start> Elaith Craulnober. Me hears that name befores.
(sigh) Goodbye, then.
So ye've gone and solved our problems, eh? Well, I guess I don't have to be stoppin' no more wanderers then, and that's for sure.
And isn't it just the saddest day with the Spirit gone. I sure be hopin' that we can be restoring the forest someday.
A wild, piercing screech fills your ears and an almost blinding light streams down from the heavens. Suddenly you realize you are no longer alone.
You catch a squirrel and slice it open on the altar. As its blood oozes onto the altar, you are filled with a sense of horror and revulsion as your body suddenly begins to decay.
Nothing seems to happen.
As the first drop of your blood hits the altar, an eerie shiver runs down your spine and you feel nausea grip your stomach. Your blood burns like lava in your veins.
Using the dagger, scratch your initials into the altar.
Sacrifice a small woodland creature on the altar, using the ceremonial dagger.
Wave the dagger in random patterns above the altar.
Draw the blade of the dagger across the palm of your hand and drip blood on the altar.
The image dissolves and suddenly you can see that the dwarf is in the Spirit's realm. A few minutes later Relmar is joined by several of the other men.
Relmar, the crazy dwarf!
Go on.
Me go free? Oh, joy! Me run away now. Me thanks you much.
Hmph. So that's what grandpappy was talkin' about, was he? Just looks like a tattered old cook book to me. Smells like an old sock, to boot.
I don't know nothin' that would help you out. Why don't you go find that woman that was askin' all them questions about it? Eltoora, she said her name was. From Port Llast.
Or burn it. Or donate it to some school where young'n wizards like to poke their tiny noses into places they don't belong. I have me graveyard to take care of, damn it! Off ye go!
Like this one wizard who came by here months back... Eltoora, she said her name was. From Port Llast. Desperate to find them books. I didn't tell her nothin'.
Just what I said. Some mage from Port Llast who came here lookin' for them old books. Said she'd pay a pretty price for 'em, too.
She wouldn't pay ME nothin' unless I actually went down and got her them books, however. Bloody thick-headed, them mages, I tell you.
Goodbye.
What you knows about magic book me finds in tomb?
What do you know about this tome I found in the tomb?
What you says about Eltoora?
What's this about Eltoora?
Though dwarven druids are rather rare, the few who choose this path can be quite intimidating.

This is the journal of one Dydd, another contestant in Mutamin's Challange. The last entry seems to make reference to the riddle with the numbered doors in the room where his body lies:
Curse this riddle! As near as I can tell the grand daughters that the riddle mentions expand in a pattern. 4 to 5 to 7 to 11? What comes next? It isn't 16. That is all that I know.
Karlat's Burning Wand

This wand is an extremely simple to use wand that casts the spell Burning Hands. The wand need only be waved and no arcane knowledge is required to use it. It was likely the very first wand given to a young apprentice mage.
Karlat's Protection Wand
This wand was used to cast protections on Karlat while he was summoning fiends. Anyone attempting to summon a fiend without protection will quickly have the beast at their throat.
This ragged trophy is the head of Dergiab, an ogre mage threatening Gerrol and the other farmers along the North Road out of Port Llast.
All Undead 2
Aarin's Tale

The mysterious Aarin Gend has told you a great deal of his earlier life and how he became Lord Nasher's spymaster, though his tale is not yet finished.
[NOTE: Aarin will likely continue the tale in the future, when you are a higher level of experience.]

The mysterious Aarin Gend completed his tale of how he became Lord Nasher's spymaster. He mentioned someone by the name of 'Calli', though he was reluctant to speak more of this person.
[NOTE: Aarin will likely continue the tale in the future, when you are a higher level of experience.]

Aarin Gend has talked to you of his past as well as the tragic love of his life, a woman he was forced to kill... tales he has never told anyone else. Aarin finds you interesting and has intimated that he would like to get to know you better in the future.
[NOTE: Aarin will likely continue his tale in the future, when you are a higher level of experience.]

Aarin Gend has talked to you of his past as well as the tragic love of his life, a woman he was forced to kill... a tale he rarely tells anyone. Aarin obviously considers you a friend... his tales, however, are complete for the time being and he will unlikely have the chance to continue.

Aarin Gend has told you secrets of his past he has rarely shared and expressed his affection for you, gifting you with an a small amulet as a token of his affection. He hopes to continue to get to know you better in the future.
[NOTE: If you desire to continue Aarin's tale into future chapters, hold onto the amulet.]
Events are moving quickly... it is unlikely that Aarin Gend will speak to you any further of himself. Naturally, however, he will work to aid you as Neverwinter's spymaster.
Aribeth's Tale

Aribeth has confessed some of her anxieties and anger over the death of Fenthick to you. She cannot seem to shake the feeling that Fenthick's execution was unjust and meant only to appease the angry citizens of Neverwinter.
(NOTE: Aribeth will continue her tale when you have achieved a higher level of experience.)

Aribeth has been possessed by terrible dreams as of late, dreams which have been frightening the servants and even alarming the normally stoic spymaster, Aarin Gend. She confessed the nature of these disturbing dreams to you, though only reluctantly.
(NOTE: Aribeth will continue her tale when you have achieved a higher level of experience.)

Aribeth told you of how she became a paladin in the service of Tyr... and it is obvious her faith in the God of Justice has been shaken by recent events.
(NOTE: Aribeth will continue her tale when you have achieved a higher level of experience.)

Lady Aribeth has told you much of herself, including how she first entered into the service of Tyr long ago. Her faith in the God of Justice seems to be shaken to the core... a fact which disturbs Aribeth profoundly. It is unlikely that she will continue her tales for now, wishing nothing more you to locate the cult quickly and deal them the vengeance they deserve.

Lady Aribeth has told you much of herself, including how she first entered into the service of Tyr as his holy champion long ago. Her faith has been profoundly challenged, her disturbing dreams growing far worse... though through all of this, Aribeth is glad to have found a faithful friend in you. She made a gift of her father's ring to you and bids you to keep it close to remind you of her always.
[NOTE: if you wish Aribeth's tale to continue into the next chapters, make sure you keep her ring in your inventory.)
Events are moving quickly... it is unlikely Aribeth will be able to discuss herself with you for the time being.

Boddyknock started telling of his father in Lantan, a horticulturalist of great repute... though it is obvious the recollection is an uncomfortable one for him.
[NOTE: Boddyknock will continue his tale... when you have achieved a higher level of experience.]

Boddyknock reluctantly related the tale of how he accidentally destroyed his father's precious garden, an act that has created a gulf between them. The gnome was reluctant to continue after the tale was done.
[NOTE: Boddyknock may continue his story... but only if you are a higher character level and have adventured enough with Boddyknock in the past so that he considers you a friend.]
Boddyknock expressed a desire to repair things with his father by finding a previous flower that his father has always desired. It is called a 'prism blossom'.

Boddyknock was overjoyed to receive the prism blossom that he had been seeking.
[NOTE: the item Boddyknock gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Quint Jhareg, one of the two lords of Charwood who currently stand accused by the Guardian Spirit on the castle's main floor, has been discovered in a cell within his eastern tower. The former cleric of Lathander now seems quite mad and very much plagued by guilt over the death of the village children within this castle so long ago. Quint readily admits to gathering the children into the castle on midwinter's eve so long ago and also to stealing his brother's phylactery. He has begged that he be punished for his crimes.

Quint Jhareg, one of the two lords of Charwood who currently stand accused by the Guardian Spirit on the castle's main floor, has been discovered in a cell within his eastern tower. The former cleric of Lathander now seems quite mad and very much plagued by guilt over the death of the village children within this castle so long ago. Quint readily admits to gathering the children into the castle on midwinter's eve so long ago and also to stealing his brother's phylactery. He has begged that he be punished for his crimes.
Quint has now provided a written oath stating that the above is true. This oath should be submitted to the Guardian Spirit as evidence.

Daelan related his tale of leaving his tribe to prove himself in the world, and arriving at the cesspool city that is Luskan.
[NOTE: Daelan will continue his tale, but only when you are a higher level of experience.]

Daelan continued his tale from earlier, cultimating in his freeing a group of slaves and fleeing Luskan. He yet carries a burden of shame with him, though he is reluctant to speak of it.
[NOTE: Daelan may continue his tale... but only when you are a higher level of experience and only if you have adventured enough with him in the past so that he considers you a friend.]
Daelan finished his tale, admitting that he seeks his mother's murderer. He has been granted a vision that the murderer wields a notched axe... and it is this axe Daelan hopes to find.

Daelan was pleased to receive the axe, knowing that his mother's murderer was surely dead.
[NOTE: the item Daelan gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Grimgnaw related several details of the Order of Long Death, including the reasons behind their great hatred of the undead.
[NOTE: Grimgnaw will continue the tale another time, probably when you have gained a higher level of experience.]

Grimgnaw continued his tale from before, expressing a desire to assist members of his Order who fell in battle against the lich and became undead, themselves. He was reluctant to detail exactly what help he could render them, however.
[NOTE: Grimgnaw may say more... but only when you are a higher level of experience and only if you have adventured with him in the past enough for him to consider you a friend.]

Grimgnaw related detail of the secret ritual that his Order uses upon their fallen members who have become undead. Grimgnaw seeks a mummified hand or a similar artifiact of the undead because it is an important reagent in that ritual, so it may be performed upon the rest of his comrades.

Grimgnaw is pleased at the discovery of the mummified hand he sought.
[NOTE: the item Grimgnaw gave you in chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Linu began a tale of how she met her husband, Synth, a famous explorer.
[NOTE: Linu will continue the tale... when you have achieved a higher level of experience.]

Linu continued her tale of how Synth won her heart and they came to be married. She hinted that the story does not end well, however, and was reluctant to continue it.
[NOTE: Linu may continue her tale... but only if you have achieved a higher level of experience and adventured enough with her in the past so that she considers you a friend.]

Linu told the tale of her husband's mysterious disappearance on his last exploration voyage. She hopes to find evidence of what happened to him one day by tracking down a journal that she and Synth had shared while he was gone.

Linu was thankful to receive her husband's journal, but saddened at the truth that he was indeed long dead.
[NOTE: the item Linu gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Druids of Aawill's conclave in the Neverwinter Woods all tell of Jaer, the druid responsible for determining the heirarchy within the conclave. Any new druids wishing to join the conclave should speak with her.

Jaer, the druid responsible for determining the heirarchy of Aawill's conclave in the Neverwinter Woods, does so through a process of ritual combat. Druids wishing to join the conclave or improve their rank within it must speak with her. When he deems a fellow druid to be sufficiently skilled to challenge his or her superior within the conclave, Jaer initiates the ritual of the Druid's Circle. Whoever emerges victorious is issued membership of the appropriate rank.
Welcar, defender of the grove's fourth circle under Archdruid Aawill, has been challenged and defeated. Jaer has passed the ring onto its new defender.
Janken, defender of the grove's second circle under Archdruid Aawill, has been challenged and defeated. Jaer has passed the ring onto its new defender.
Henna, defender of the grove's third circle under Archdruid Aawill, has been challenged and defeated. Jaer has passed the ring onto its new defender.
Elgar, defender of the grove's first and final circle under Archdruid Aawill, has been challenged and defeated. Jaer has passed the ring onto its new defender and champion.
Neverwinter Woods: Spirit of the Wood

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world. To those who have come to help her, she has offered up images of her poisoner, a nameless dwarf who apparently hides within the spirit world, even now.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world, followed by her poisoner, a cult agent by the name of Relmar. He has been killed and a journal on his corpse suggests that he has buried a cure to the Spirit's poison beneath some rubble near where he was found.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world, but a cure that might still save the Spirit has been located.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world, but a cure for the troubled Spirit was finally recovered.
Renewed to her former vigor, the Spirit will once again be able to restore the forest to its proper balance. Aawill will be eager to hear the good news.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world, but a cure for the troubled Spirit was finally recovered.
Renewed to her former vigor, the Spirit will once again be able to restore the forest to its proper balance. Aawill was happy to reward the adventurers for their exceptional work.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world, but adventurers found and slew the wounded Spirit. Archdruid Aawill needs to know of the Spirit's fate.

The Spirit of the Neverwinter Woods has somehow come to harm and Aawill, an Archdruid who maintains a conclave there, is gravely worried. He has reluctantly granted forest access to adventurers so that they might help him right whatever has gone wrong.
Evidence discovered deeper in the forest tells of a pool at the base of a waterfall where the Spirit of the Woods would perform a ritual to enter the spirit world. The only way for mortals to follow is to enter that pool and die while in its waters. A magical dagger is obviously involved in the taking of one's life.
Poisoned and in great peril, the Spirit of the Woods has retreated to that world, but adventurers found and slew the wounded Spirit. Archdruid Aawill and his grove will work to save the woods, despite the damage that has been done.

With the Wailing's cure and subsequent removal of Neverwinter's quarantine, the wizardess Eltoora has journeyed to Port Llast to provide her services to those searching for the cult responsible. She also comes with ulterior motives, however, as she seeks a collection of ancient tomes from the lost civilization of Imaskar. The five books are said to act as recipes, providing guidance to those undertaking magical experiments. Should any of the tomes be found, she will not only reward whoever returns them but also make the tomes publicly available to all arcanists who wish to experiment with them in her library.
Through scrying attempts, she has managed to narrow down the locations of the five tomes of Imaskar. The Tome of Fire and the Tome of Death are both said to be lost in Charwood, while the Tome of Life apparently rests with the corpse of Brother Toras in the cemetery outside the walls of Luskan. The Tome of Ice is housed within a tower south of Port Llast and the last, the Tome of Resonance, lies somewhere along the treacherous road deep into the Neverwinter Woods.

With the Wailing's cure and subsequent removal of Neverwinter's quarantine, the wizardess Eltoora has journeyed to Port Llast to provide her services to those searching for the cult responsible. The five books are said to act as recipes, providing guidance to those undertaking magical experiments. Should any of the tomes be found, she will not only reward whoever returns them but also make the tomes publicly available to all arcanists who wish to experiment with them in her library.
Through scrying attempts, she has managed to narrow down the locations of the five tomes of Imaskar. The Tome of Fire and the Tome of Death are both said to be lost in Charwood, while the Tome of Life apparently rests with the corpse of Brother Toras in the cemetery outside the walls of Luskan. The Tome of Ice is housed within a tower south of Port Llast and the last, the Tome of Resonance, lies somewhere along the treacherous road deep into the Neverwinter Woods.
Three of these books have been found and should be returned to Eltoora, to be made available to all those who wish to experiment with them.

Neurik, a priest of Tyr who presides of Port Llast's temple, warns of a terrible tragedy that has befallen some of the town's young men. Sir Karathis Ironheart, a travelling werewolf hunter, enlisted the help of four boys to hunt a foul lycanthrope known only as the Black Wolf. It was a trap, however, and Sir Karathis was himself the Black Wolf. His claws raked the flesh of Bran, Urth, and Geth, infecting them with his dread disease, leaving only the youngest boy, Ander, to escape. Neurik believes that, if found soon enough, the three young men may still be curable by a charm he has concocted.
Ander, who currently spends his days at the Alliance Arms Inn, trying to spread news amongst adventurers of the tragedy that befell his friends, has a few guesses as to where his friends might have fled. He suspects that Bran is somewhere along the road to Charwood and Geth might be taking refuge in the Neverwinter Woods. Ander wasn't sure about Urth but recommended talking to his parents who live on the edge of town. The last time Ander saw Sir Karathis, it was at the supposed cave of the Black Wolf, in the hills east of the Green Griffon Inn.

One of the boys has been discovered. Neurik will be interested in examining the adventuring ring that Sir Karathis had given the boy, in case it can reveal any further clues as to the supposed werewolf hunter's whereabouts.

Sir Karathis Ironheart, a travelling werewolf hunter, enlisted the help of four boys to hunt a foul lycanthrope known only as the Black Wolf. It was a trap, however, and Sir Karathis was himself the Black Wolf. His claws raked the flesh of Bran, Urth, and Geth, infecting them with his dread disease, leaving only the youngest boy, Ander, to escape. Neurik believes that, if found soon enough, the three young men may still be curable by a charm he has concocted.
Ander, who currently spends his days at the Alliance Arms Inn, trying to spread news amongst adventurers of the tragedy that befell his friends, has a few guesses as to where his friends might have fled. He suspects that Bran is somewhere along the road to Charwood and Geth might be taking refuge in the Neverwinter Woods. Ander wasn't sure about Urth but recommended talking to his parents who live on the edge of town. The last time Ander saw Sir Karathis, it was at the supposed cave of the Black Wolf, in the hills east of the Green Griffon Inn.
All three of the boys have been discovered. Neurik will be interested in examining the adventuring rings that Sir Karathis had gave the boys. Perhaps it is time to revisit the scene of the initial tragedy to discover whether or not Sir Karathis still lingers there.

It appears that Sir Karathis Ironheart is not the Black Wolf after all. He entered the caves east of the Green Griffon Inn and was ambushed and infected himself. Maddened with the bloodlust of his unexpected transformation, he lashed out at the boys who had joined him in the hunt but luckily was able to refrain from killing them outright. Neurik, the Tyrist priest back in Port Llast was chagrined to learn that, even with the situation of Sir Karathis addressed, the dreaded Black Wolf remains on the loose. Worse yet, Sir Karathis has given him a familiar name: Alhelor, the merchant selling anti-lycanthropic supplies at Ander's side in Port Llast's Alliance Arms Inn. The boy's life is in great danger and Neurik has given the order to find and destroy Alhelor at once.
Luckily Ander is safe and sound in the Alliance Arms Inn. Alhelor appears to have caught wind of the recent news, however, and has supposedly retired to his home in the town's northeast corner. Given his previous ambush of Sir Karathis, it would be wise to proceed with caution.

Sharwyn told a story of her early experiences after leaving home and learning the trade of a bard.
[NOTE: Sharwyn will continue the tale when you are a higher level of experience.]

Sharwyn continued her tale, recounting her travels to Athkatla with her lover, Dannen. The tale's ending is obviously painful, and Sharwyn seems reluctant to share it.
[NOTE: Sharwyn may continue her tale... but only if you are a higher level of experience and have adventured with her enough in the past that she considers you a friend.]
Sharwyn finished her tale of her time in Athkatla, relating the betrayal of her lover, Dannen, and how she seeks a lock of nymph's hair to take revenge.

Sharwyn was pleased to receive the lock of nymph's hair that she had been seeking.
[NOTE: the item Sharwyn gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Neva, a young man supposedly kidnapped by bandits near the edge of the Charwood, turned out to be little more than bait in a deadly trap. His supposed siblings, Jaheel and Tarran, ambushed the adventurers who came to Neva's "rescue" but were ultimately unsuccessful. A letter was recovered from Neva's corpse, identifying the trio as cult agents. According to the letter, further agents have been sent to Neverwinter Woods, the Charwood, and the hills north of Port Llast, in search of an unnamed artifact of great power.

A young man by the name of Neva has apparently been kidnapped by bandits. According to his siblings, Tarran and Jaheel, he is being held near some standing stones by the entrance to the Charwood. Adventurers are to meet the siblings there to attempt a rescue.

Tomi began a tale of his exploits in Calimshan, focusing on his 'nemesis' of the time, Samuel Bumbleheart.
[NOTE: Tomi will continue the tale at another time, probably when you have gained a higher level of experience.]

Tomi continued to tell his tale of how Samuel attempted to thwart his popularity back in Calimshan.
[NOTE: Tomi may continue the tale... but only if you are a higher level of experience and have adventured with him enough in the past so that he considers you a friend.]

Tomi finished his tale of the jewel heist and the disappearance of both Sammy and the Star of Calimshan. He expressed a desire to someday track down the location of the jewel, wherever Sammy might have brought it.

Tomi is pleased that the Star of Calimshan has been recovered.
[NOTE: the item that Tomi gave to you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]
No dryad may stray far from her tree, which is both her home and her health. To a dryad, there is nothing more sacred or precious than this part of her living self.
Eltoora's Magical Sundries
An old and ragged golem rises from its tomb to clear away the undead.
Greetings! I am Arto, a Red Wizard of Thay. I have numerous arcane and magical items that I would be pleased to sell to you at semi-reasonable prices.
Yes, come again.
The Red Wizards are the masters of all that is arcane. We have enclaves throughout the Realms where we offer a variety of magical exports from Thay. I am one such merchant and member.
This is NOT my enclave, you hairless monkey. I am here from necessity. My enclave was destroyed by the High Captains, like much of this city. Once things calm down I will return.
Now, do you want to buy something or not?
Be sure that you purchase something. I prefer not to display my wares for oglers and rubber-neckers.
Goodbye.
Who these Red Wizard guys?
Who are the Red Wizards?
This you enclave? It pretty pathetic.
So this is your enclave? Impressive. No, really.
Me want see you stuff.
Let me see what you have.
Flesshh ones must die!
I... I see. I suppose there is... no reason why Evaine should be any more fortunate than anyone else in this city, is there?
Me gots news for you.... sister be dead.
Actually, I have news for you... Evaine is dead.
Watch yer back 'round here <lad/lass>. There's lots o' folks liable to stick a knife in it.
You look like the kind o' person who knows how to live in the shadows.
Sorry <mister/missus>. My mistake. Won't bother ya no more then.
It's just my business to notice these sorts of things. Ya might be in need of some helpful items.
In that case, I'm yer go-to guy! I've got the goods to make yer life easier.
Y'ever need something, ya just come to ol' Slider here. I'll take care o' ya.
Well, I'll tell ya what I can.
What do I look like, a bleedin' map or somethin'? I've got customers waitin' on some special goods, so are ya gonna place an order or not?
It's a mighty fine time fer folk like us. My business hasn't been this good in years, and in a town like Luskan, it's usually pretty good.
With the fighting between the High Captains, my business has been busier than ever. I sell to both sides and nobody'll touch me, 'cause they need my goods.
Several weeks ago things got much more interesting 'round here. I've been raking in the gold since then.
But look, I have other customers, so are ya plannin' to buy or not?
Just step o'er here into the shadows and I'll show ya.
Me not like what you say!
What you care?
What if me do?
I take offense to that.
What's it to you?
And what if I do?
No thanks.
Me want ask you questions.
Me want see your stuff.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Nevermind.
Me need you tell me where stuff be.
What be goin' on 'round here?
I need some directions.
What's going on around here?
Me think fighting make you hide.
What you mean?
I would have thought all the violence would drive you into hiding.
What do you mean?
Goodbye.
How long this go on?
How long has this been going on?
I would like to see what you have to offer.
Arto
Webber
Evaine, a fair-faced Luskan noble has paid a high price for her beauty. Kidnapped by High Captain Kurth, she met death instead of rescue at the hands of Kurth's killers.

Politics makes for strange bedfellows, it seems. Certainly, there is no love lost between Bela's brothel and the High Captains of Luskan. Bela suggests that enemies of the High Captains might benefit by seeking out one of her gals, Rhaine, who works upstairs...

Politics makes for strange bedfellows, it seems. One of Bela's bitter courtesans has informed you that Kurth's main base lies in the walled-off West Docks district, accessible through a gap in the western wall near Kurth's ruined tower. With the right key, however, one could access a back entrance that can be found within the ruined tower, itself. As for Baram, his own base lies in the sewers of the city. The main access is well-guarded and lies on a small island just north of the brothel. A back entrance, accessible with the right key, can be found just beyond a sewer grating found shortly west of the brothel.

Politics makes for strange bedfellows, it seems. One of Bela's bitter courtesans has informed you that Baram's base lies in the sewers of the city. The main access is well-guarded and lies on a small island just north of the brothel. A back entrance, accessible with the right key, can be found just beyond a sewer grating found shortly west of the brothel.
A strange outcast ghoul has been encountered in the sewers beneath Luskan. Rather than engaging him in parley, his miserable undead existence was quickly ended.

The city of Luskan rises and falls on the quarrels of its High Captains. Lately, those quarrels have become an all-out war for supremacy and the two remaining contenders, Kurth and Baram, have pulled out all the stops. Very recently, adventurers have laid siege to Baram's base, intent on assassinating him and bringing this bloody feud to its bitter end.
Not far within the boundaries of Baram's base, a yuan-ti was encountered who carried a parchment which appeared to contain instructions for some form of necromantic ritual to create undead. According to the writing on the parchment, those who perform the ritual will be protected from any sort of harm. Of particular note was the following: "Allow nothing to distract you. Ensure that the skeletal priests continue their worship unhindered and that the tablets remain intact or your ritual will be worthless." Who is performing this ritual and where is unknown... but no doubt answers lie nearby.

The city of Luskan rises and falls on the quarrels of its High Captains. Lately, those quarrels have become an all-out war for supremacy and the two remaining contenders, Kurth and Baram, have pulled out all the stops. Very recently, adventurers have laid siege to Baram's base, intent on assassinating him and bringing this bloody feud to its bitter end.
The yuan-ti necromancers performing their ritual have been killed, their sorceries stopped. On the body of one of them, a key has been found which will, no doubt, allow access further into Baram's base.
This module was designed for 1-4 players of levels 13 to 17.
Our leader is dead; haven't you hurt us enough?
You look like the kind o' person who knows how to live in the shadows.
Sorry <mister/missus>. My mistake. Won't bother ya no more then.
It's just my business to notice these sorts of things. Ya might be in need of some helpful items.
In that case, I'm yer go-to gal! I've got the goods to make yer life easier.
Y'ever need something, ya just come here. I'll take care o' ya.
Well, I'll tell ya what I can.
What do I look like, a bleedin' map or somethin'? I've got customers waitin' on some special goods, so are ya gonna place an order or not?
It's a mighty fine time fer folk like us. This war has been good for me.
With the fighting between Luskan and Neverwinter escalating, the goods I deal with are becoming rarer...and I can more readily set my price, if you get my meaning.
Just step o'er here into the shadows and I'll show ya.
Me not like what you say!
What you care?
What if me do?
I take offense to that.
What's it to you?
And what if I do?
No thanks.
Me want ask you questions.
Me want see your stuff.
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Nevermind.
Me need you tell me where stuff be.
What be goin' on 'round here?
I need some directions.
What's going on around here?
Me think fighting make you hide.
What you mean?
I would have thought all the violence would drive you into hiding.
What do you mean?
Goodbye.
I would like to see what you have to offer.
Press the yellow gem.
Press the blue gem.
Press the red gem.
Leave.
This pool swims with the colors of red, blue and yellow. There are gems embedded at the bottom of the pool.
Upon close examination you see a red, blue and yellow gem. It looks as if you could press one of the three.
The water of the pool changes to lemon yellow.
The water of the pool changes to sky blue.
The water of the pool changes to blood red.
Upon close examination you see a blue and yellow gem. It looks as if you could press one of them.
Upon close examination you see a red and yellow gem. It looks as if you could press one of them.
Upon close examination you see a red and blue gem. It looks as if you could press one of the gems.
The water in this pool is lemon yellow.
The water in this pool is sky blue.
The water in this pool is blood red.
Now shove off and leave me alone until after the trial or people might get suspicious! I don't want news of this to get back to Neurik.
You again? Listen, I already told you I'd vote to let that Uthgardt savage go free. I took the bribe and our business is done.

I guess we probably shouldn't talk to each other until after the trial, right? We don't want people to wonder what we're up to with this bribe and all. You better go before someone starts asking questions.
Wh- what do you want? You shouldn't be here - you'll get us both in trouble! Just... just do me a favor and leave me alone until after the trial.
Don't worry, I won't go back on our deal. I'll vote to find Rolgan innocent. Just don't talk to me anymore until after the trial.
**hic** Hey, I know you! You're one of them herosshh Gend hired to find them Words of Power, right! **hic** Shhure, that's you.
You hash to help me. That waitressh cut me off! She shays I'm drunk! She can't treat me like thish! I'm Lillian Cambridge! Aarin Gend wantsh my help to find them Wordsh of Power!
I used to have one of them Wordsh of Power, you know. It was inshide thish pretty shnow globe. *hic* But now shome hero went and got it out, and shnow globe is empty - empty and all alone.
I need another drink to get my shpirits up! *hic* If you shee the bartender tell him to bring me another bottle. Thish one's almosht empty.
You can't talk to me like thish! I'm not shome drunk - I'm a reshpected arche... archeolo... I'm a reshpected exshpert in my field!
Goodbye.
You tell me what you know 'bout Power Words.
What can you tell me about the Words of Power?
Hmmm... me think maybe me should get you another drink so you pass out and not bother me no more.
Maybe I should get you another drink so you'll pass out and quit your drunken babbling.
Me think you had too much booze, lady.
I think you've had enough to drink, Lillian.
You not worry. Me get you wifey and girl back here safe.
Don't worry - I'll bring them back safely.
Where can me find you family?
Where can I find your family, again?

I can't help imagining what horrible things might have happened to my family out there on our homestead! Until you bring them back here to the fort I don't know if I'll be able to think of anything else.
Please, hurry. I don't know what I'd do if it turned out you were too late to help them!
They're in the homesteads to the west of the Fort - past the Uthgardt war camps. They'd never make it safely to the Fort on their own.
Ah, welcome back, my <Lord/Lady>. Do you bring me news of Zokan Thunderer? Is the Uthgardt chieftain dead?
You are back, my <Lord/Lady>. Do you bring me news of the Uthgardt sub-chieftan, or is there something else you need?
Yes, my <Lord/Lady>, what can I do for you? Have you come to report on the six catapults bombarding the Fort, or is there something else you need?
Why have you come back? I already gave you the cure for the Elk tribe - what more do you want from me?

And if you go back into the past, you might find some way to weaken the guardian golems patrolling this complex so you can get to the Word of Power you told me you were looking for. Or do you tell me at our next meeting? Whatever.
You know - the golems. The invulnerable guardians of this complex... didn't we go over this at our next meeting? You could disable them by using the sundial to go into the past.
Golems?
Our tribe is saved! <CUSTOM201> has cured the people of the Elk from the Wailing Death!
You are a great hero, <FullName>! Through every generation the legend of how you saved the Elk people from the Wailing Death shall be retold.
The gongs! I know the secret... tell you I will and then free I'll be!
Die, mammal scum!

Uthgardt Map Note

Boddyknock spoke of his homeland, the isolated isle of Lantan, and how the god Gond washed up ashore there changed Lantan forever.
[NOTE: Boddyknock will continue his tale when you have reached a higher level of experience.]

Boddyknock continued to speak of Gond's appearance in Lantan during the Time of Troubles. He hinted at receiving guidance from Gond's clerics before his own arrival in the North, but was reluctant to speak of it.
[NOTE: Boddyknock will continue his tale when you have reached a higher level of experience... but only if you have traveled enough with him in the past so that he considers you a friend.]
Boddyknock told you of what the clerics of Gond requested he locate and bring back to Lantan: a dragon scale, untouched by magic.

Boddyknock was pleased to receive the dragon scale which he had been seeking.
[NOTE: the item Boddyknock gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Daelan spoke briefly of Aribeth, mentioning a link between her story and an old Uthgardt tale that he knows.
[NOTE: Daelan will continue his story when you have achieved a higher level of experience.]

Daelan regaled you with the ancient tale of the first warrior to lead the Uthgardt tribes.
[NOTE: Daelan will continue his story when you have achieved a higher level of experience... but only if you have traveled with him enough in the past so that he considers you a friend.]
Dalean completed his tale and mentioned his hope to locate the ancient artifact, Uthgar's Spear, that is so important to his people.

Daelan was overjoyed to receive Uthgar's Spear, the artifact which he had been searching for.
[NOTE: the item Daelan gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Grimgnaw spoke briefly of Aribeth and mentioned that he was eagerly looking forward to the upcoming war.
[NOTE: Grimgnaw will continue his story when you have achieved a higher level of experience.]

Grimgnaw spoke of his initiation within the Order of the Long Death... an initiation that was not complete, though he was reluctant to give details.
[NOTE: Grimgnaw will continue his story when you have achieved a higher level of experience... but only if you have adventured long enough with him so that he considers you a friend.]

Grimgnaw talked about his search for the one thing that would complete his initiation within the Order of the Long Death: a weapon blessed by one of the Order, themselves, to be used in their own assassination.

Now that Grimgnaw has received the weapon blessed by his Order, his initiation is complete.
[NOTE: the item Grimgnaw gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Linu began a tale of how she started in her life as a cleric for the goddess Sehanine Moonbow.
[NOTE: Linu will continue her story when you have achieved a higher level of experience.]

Linu continued her story about her experiences as a young acolyte within her church.
[NOTE: Linu will continue her story when you have achieved a higher level of experience... but only if you have traveled together enough in the past so that she considers you a friend.]
Linu finished her tale, mentioning that she seeks a volcanic oak... an extremely rare and mystical tree that is important to her people.

Linu was overjoyed to receive the volcanic oak that she had been seeking.
[NOTE: the item Linu gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

The seeds have been planted in the past and a magnificent Ultarg Tree has sprouted up in the present day.
Now Sapphira will be able to harvest the fruit she has so eagerly been waiting for.

Sharwyn suggested that she might tell you one of the tales from her bardic repertoire.
[NOTE: Sharwyn will continue when you have gained a higher level of experience.]

Sharwyn told you the beginning of the tale of Tamorlyn and the lost Song of Love.
[NOTE: Sharwyn will continue when you have gained a higher level of experience... but only if you have traveled enough with her in the past that she considers you to be a friend.]
Sharwyn finished her tale, and suggested that the lost Song of Love by Tamorlyn might actually exist and that she would be eager to discover it.

Sharwyn was extremely happy to receive the lost Song of Love.
[NOTE: the item Sharwyn gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

Zokan has explained that the Elk tribe have allied against the Lords' Alliance because of Commander Damas' terrible betrayal; the Commander infected blankets with the Wailing Death and gave them to the Elk tribe as gifts. These blankets are proof of his crime.
The Elk Tribe within the Fort will keep peace with you while you remain their emissary, but likely those further away will not have received word as yet.
If his people could be cured, Zokan would cease the alliance with the Luskan forces, and all the Elk Tribe would keep the peace.

Tomi began a story regarding his early (and presumably brief) apprenticeship with the wizard Halasahr.
[NOTE: Tomi will continue his story when you are a higher level of experience.]

Tomi continued his story about how his apprenticeship with Halasahr came to an abrupt end.
[NOTE: Tomi will continue his story when you are a higher level of experience... but only if you have adventured together enough in the past that he considers you a friend.]

Tomi ended his tale about his apprenticeship with Halasahr, mentioning that he would like to find the ashes of a great hero sometime during his journey... a gift for his former master to make up for the havoc he caused.

Tomi was overjoyed upon receiving the ashes of a great hero, which he had been seeking.
[NOTE: the item Tomi gave you in Chapter 1 has been upgraded.]

I do not want to speak with you right now. I am too worried about my little sister Leesa. I don't know what I'll do if I never see her again...
I alone am left of the champions of my people, but like my fallen companions I too have failed.
The Queen of the scaled raiders still lives, but the spell that brought me to this place grows weak. Soon it will fail and my spirit will be wrenched from this plane back to my homeworld of Azallah.
I will never reach Morag's inner sanctum, and the magical artifact forged by my people to slay the Queen will be wasted - unless I give the artifact to you.
My time here grows short. Quickly - take this amulet! It will help protect you against Morag and her people.
The fate of many worlds is in your hands. You must destroy the scaled Queen, or we are all doomed.
My time here grows short; perhaps I can help you to do what I cannot. But if you do not help me then my mission will have failed.
Me not listen to you no more!
Forget it. I'm not listening to you!
What this magic thingy do?
Okay, me take magic thingy from you and go kill Morag.
What does this artifact do?
Give me the artifact. I'll use it to help defeat Morag.
Rise Morag's fallen! Kill your slayer in Her name!
Die, slave! How dare you invade Morag's Inner Sanctum!

This module was designed for one, level 1 character.
Difficulty settings.
Okay.
Me lost. Me want you to tell about difficulty settings again.
I'm lost. Could you explain the difficulty settings again?
That seem simple. Even me get it.
That seems simple enough.
Okay.
Neverwinter has several difficulty settings you can choose from. I'll explain the main differences between the various settings, if you're interested.
In multi-player games the DM can adjust and control the difficulty settings. In single player games there are three settings you can choose from using the Options menu: Easy, Normal and Hardcore.

In the Easy setting enemies' damage against you is limited to a maximum of 50% of the normal total, and all your hits do a minimum of 50% normal damage to them. Also, your spells won't hurt your own party members.
In the Normal setting damage rolls are calculated normally, although enemies can't score critical hits on you. Your spells still won't hurt your own party members.

The Hardcore setting makes players vulnerable to critical hits and also gives enemies attacks of opportunity if you use ranged weapons or potions in melee combat. Your spells will now injure your own party members if they are caught in the area of effect.
<StartAction>THE GAME HAS BEEN BALANCED FOR THE NORMAL DIFFICULTY SETTING!</Start> Using the other settings may result in gameplay that is too easy or too difficult.
That's it for difficulty settings. Let's move on to the next part of the tutorial.
That's about all I can tell you about the difficulty settings.
Nodamage

Type of Feat: Item Creation Prerequisite: Spellcaster Level 3+. Specifics: The character can create a potion of any spell of 3rd level or lower that the character knows and that targets a single creature. Brewing a potion will cost a small amount of XP as well as some gold to cover the material cost. The costs for brewing a potion depends on the level of the spell as well as the level of the resulting potion: Some examples: A potion of bless (1) will costs 50 gp and 2 XP A potion of prayer (5) will cost 750 gp and 30 XP
Use: Selected (In order to brew a potion, the character has to cast the spell in question on an empty magical potion bottle).

Type of Feat: Item Creation Prerequisite: Spellcaster Level 1st+. Specifics: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know. Scribing a scroll costs a small amount of XP and gold, depending on the level of the spell to scribe. The costs for scribing a scroll depends on the level of the spell as well as the level of the resulting scroll: Some examples: A scroll of bless (1) will costs 25 gp and 6 XP A scroll of fireball (5) will cost 375 gp and 15 XP A scroll of chain lightning (11) will cost 1650 gp and 66 XP Use: Selected (In order to scribe a scroll, the character has to cast the spell in question on a specially prepared blank scroll)
