links
That red wizard spoke to you, eh. Well I've never trusted their type and I'm not about to start.
Does Drogan know his students have become so rude? I have a good mind to drag you up there and let you explain yourself to him.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Alright, don't hurt me - He can stay. I hope we don't all come to regret your rash action here today.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> That does it! Next time I see Drogan I'm going to have a word with him about you.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Oh now, <FirstName>. Don't you be trying Master Drogan's tricks on me.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> This is the red wizard I've been looking for.
He can stay.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You haven't been around as long as me, <FirstName>. You'll learn - the Red Wizards are not to be trusted. And you can tell him I said so.

Well - I tell you what. Crazy old Piper has gone a little off the deep end after the last kobold attack. He's scaring a few of the locals with his talk of doom. You take care of him and I'll maybe give the red wizard a chance.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start>Well alright - but I'll be watching him - you tell him he can set up shop on a provisional basis.
<FirstName>, it is good to see you! I was about to send someone down to check on everyone at Master Drogan's. I am afraid events are far out of hand around here.
Haniah! Did I ever <StartAction>[hic]</Start> tell you how helpful you are <StartAction>[hic]</Start>? You're the besht, Haniah, shimply the besht!
Uh... thank you, sir. You are a very good boss too... <StartAction>[mutter]</Start> usually...
Not exactly a party. I found the mayor this way in his home, after the kobold attack. He was hiding in his cellar with two empty wine bottles beside him.
Oh no! The mayor has been drunk on occasions, but never during a workday. I found him this way, after the kobold attack. He was hiding in his cellar with two empty wine bottles beside him.
I found the mayor this way in his home, after the kobold attack. He was hiding in his cellar with two empty wine bottles beside him.
I think the stress of the attack was simply too much for him and he lost control. I just hope that he will be better when he sobers up. I know it frightened me.
Luckily I was here and there were enough local farmers and townsmen to hold the kobolds off. They mostly just ran past, when they saw how many were in here.
So is everyone alright at the school?
Not Master Drogan! Oh, I can hardly afford to lose him. I was desperately hoping that he could help me deal with all of the problems that have cropped up after the attack.
Ah, I suppose that sounds awfully selfish of me, but I have only been here a short time, and now the mayor is completely useless!

Haniah's been like a <StartAction>[hic]</Start> daughter to me, I tell you, <FirstName>. No, better than <StartAction>[hic]</Start> better than a daughter. Oh, <FirstName>, good to see you. When did you get here?
Oh, <FirstName>, what do I do?
I will do whatever is in my power to help you and Master Drogan. I just am unsure how much help I can give right now.
I am sure you do, <FirstName>. And if there is anything I can do to help, you can ask. I doubt there is a lot of help I can give though.
You know <StartAction>[hic]</Start>, even though I am the Mayor, everybody respects Drogan more. Hey, toots, why don't you run <StartAction>[hic]</Start> and fetch me some more wine!
My name is Haniah, not Toots, and I am no tavern wench. I think you have had enough to drink, sir.
Bull droppings! I <StartAction>[hic]</Start>, I have barely just begun to drink. You go get me some... hey, why do I have four arms?
I am sorry, <FirstName>, but I have little time. Is there something you need?
Farewell, <FirstName>.
I find that in the last few minutes you have disillusioned me and encouraging you is the last thing on my mind.
I must admit, that in the last few years, I have had thoughts of you that go a step or two beyond friendship.
The only encouragement I can offer is the thought that someday we can get to know each other better. Perhaps as something more than just friends.
At the risk of sounding a little brazen, <FirstName>, if we get through these days and things can return to normal, I promise you a night of encouragement you will never forget.
But with all the problems we face right now, there is little else I can focus on. Is there anything else I can do for you?
You will have to speak to Farghan, the herbalist. His shop is right across the street. Anything else?
Ah, another one of the little problems. At least this one was easy to solve; I simply sent him packing. What did that red wizard have to say to you?
Foolish of me?!? How dare you sit in judgment of decisions I make for the good of our community? I suppose you would let a horde of orcs set up an encampment, if you saw a profit in it.
The Red Wizards of Thay are <StartAction>[hic]</Start> the evisht bunch of no-good-doers I've ever heard of. I will <StartAction>[hic]</Start> never allow one into the community. Not on my life.
You have spoken to him though. What makes you think I should allow him to set up an enclave?
Oh, there is no doubt that the majority are definitely evil. As for this particular wizard, I cannot be sure, but it seems very unlikely that he is any different from his superiors.
On what basis do you make this judgment?
That is a wise decision, but I am not sure that it will avail you greatly. Remember, evil rarely proclaims itself as such.
How dare you threaten an old, but dear man like Veraunt? You should be ashamed. Poisoned or healthy, Drogan will hear of this.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> That does it! Next time I see Drogan I'm going to have a word with him about you.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Alright, do not hurt the Mayor. Szaren can stay. Just leave us alone. Never speak to me again, <FirstName>. I will never forgive you for this insult.
That is not a funny joke. When it comes to violence, I have no sense of humor. I shall try to forget you said any such thing. Do you have a real argument to make?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Szaren is an ally and should remain here in Hilltop.
He can stay.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I fear you overestimate Szaren's goodwill. I doubt that he cares much how well we do, so long as it brings him profits.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You must not have heard the stories I have heard, <FirstName>. The Red Wizards are not to be trusted. And you can tell him I said so.
That may be so, but letting him stay could be a bigger mistake. You must trust me on this.
Thank you, <FirstName>. I knew I could count on you to come to the right decision.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start>You make a good point. I just fear that one day they might begin to corrupt our people with their influence.
Szaren can stay. I just hope we never come to regret this decision. I will make sure that the mayor draws up the correct paperwork, once he sobers up. You can go tell Szaren.
Worry not about the Mayor, I can smooth things over with him. I really need the Piper problem taken care of, so you just handle that.
If you can handle that situation diplomatically, I would be willing to trust your judgment about Szaren. Anything else?
Thank goodness you are still well, <FirstName>. I know Master Drogan holds you in high esteem and you have always been kind to me since I came to Hilltop.
The biggest problem right now is with Piper, small surprise there. He has always claimed to have prophetic abilities, but now people are beginning to listen.
A couple days ago, Piper claimed that death was coming in the dark and that only 'the chosen' would survive.
An old farmer, Hol Halstrom, called him an idiot, and Piper claimed Hol would be dead within the week.
That is exactly it. He makes those predictions so often, he was bound to eventually get one right.
I could not care less about Piper, except that he is starting to scare some of the more foolish townsfolk and farmers. They are scared and looking for answers, and Piper made an accurate prediction.
Hol's body was found near the edge of the village, with his throat slit so deep, his head was barely attached to his body.
Piper has a number of people convinced that the kobolds are just messengers for a new, powerful god. I stopped listening to him at that point.
Piper is spreading panic and chaos in our village, something we can ill afford if we are to rebuild and possibly fortify ourselves.
I feared that might be so. I do not blame you, for I am certain you must have many important things to do.
You know <StartAction>[hic]</Start>, I lost my wife only five years ago. <StartAction>[sob]</Start> I wish I could have her back again.
Yes sir, you told me she was killed by a burglar one night while you were at a gathering, here at the hall.
She would have liked you, Haniah. She <StartAction>[hic]</Start> would have found the daughter she always <StartAction>[hic]</Start> wanted. <StartAction>[sob]</Start>
I hope you jest, <FirstName>. If Piper truly were a prophet, you and your peers would have perished long ago. No, there is only madness in Piper.
I only have access to a small sum of gold, but I will see what I can find, should you do this for me. It would be a great kindness from you, <FirstName>.
I understand how one such as you might have trouble meeting... interested women, but I would never consider prostituting myself. Not even to keep my job.
<FirstName>, I cannot even begin to express how much that suggestion disgusts me. As if I would ever consider prostituting myself for a job.
You have no idea how often I dreamed of us together. Of course in my dreams you would never have suggested that I prostitute myself for my job!
Obviously you have a far lower opinion of me than I did of you. I ask that you never express such desires to me again.
Of course. I had hoped for better from you in these troubled times, but I see that you will stick to your mercenary ways, even when we need you most.
I can only promise you 50 gold. That is all we can afford, what with so much destruction and misery, it is really more than we can afford. So will you do this for me?
I am not asking you to hurt him or anything like that, but if he would just stop or go away, it would make my job much simpler.
Would you really, <FirstName>? That would be such a relief. I am not asking you to hurt him or anything like that, but if he would just stop or go away, it would make my job much simpler.
Is there anything I can do to help you?
Oh, hello <FirstName>. I spoke with your friend already, but I'm sure you would be a real help in the trials ahead.
I wish I could speak with you more, but I really do have a lot to deal with. Good luck.
Sir, please do not drink any more of that wine. You are going to make yourself sick.

Nonshensh! I'm a healthy as a <StartAction>[hic]</Start> as a bull. A little bit of wine never <StartAction>[hic]</Start> never hurt any... oh my... that didn't feel so good <StartAction>[belch]</Start>.
That is disgusting, sir. I am sorry, <FirstName>, but I have little time. Is there something you need?
Farewell, <FirstName>.
I find that in the last few minutes you have disillusioned me and encouraging you is the last thing on my mind.
I must admit, that in the last few years, I have had thoughts of you that go a step or two beyond friendship.
The only encouragement I can offer is the thought that someday we can get to know each other better. Perhaps as something more than just friends.
At the risk of sounding a little brazen, <FirstName>, if we get through these days and things can return to normal, I promise you a night of encouragement you will never forget.
But with all the problems we face right now, there is little else I can focus on. Is there anything else I can do for you?
You will have to speak to Farghan, the herbalist. His shop is right across the street. Anything else?
And what words of wisdom, or corruption, did the mage spill in your ear?
Ah, another one of the little problems. At least this one was easy to solve; I simply sent him packing. What did that red wizard have to say to you?
Foolish of me?!? How dare you sit in judgment of decisions I make for the good of our community? I suppose you would let a horde of orcs set up an encampment, if you saw a profit in it.
The Red Wizards of Thay are <StartAction>[hic]</Start> the evisht bunch of no-good-doers I've ever heard of. I will <StartAction>[hic]</Start> never allow one into the community. Not on my life.
You are back again. Does this mean that friend Piper is willing to settle down or go away?
Alright, but do please hurry. I am sure you have many concerns ahead of you.
Things are starting to smooth out, but until Piper is dealt with I will not be able to rest easy.
Thank you for asking though. I seem to spend much of my time just trying to calm people down. It is nice to have someone treat me as a friend.
I am impressed. I was wondering if anyone had the patience to deal with him.
You have shown excellent skill in diplomacy and good judgment. Szaren may set up his enclave. I hope you are choosing wisely in him.
Here is your reward. When Hol's widow heard that you were going to quiet Piper, she gave me an extra 10 gold to add to it. You are definitely deserving of it, <FirstName>.
I see blood, on your hands. You... you killed him! Get away from me, you butcher! I wanted no violence! Go!
It is good to see you again, <FirstName>. Life goes on as usual, though I am sad to tell you that the Mayor has not recovered from his binge and still drinks day and night.
I fear it will eventually be the death of him. I wish I knew what to do. But you must have other things on your mind. Is there some way in which I might help you?
Goodbye, <FirstName>.
Well, that's a relief. Thank you for telling me, I appreciate it.
I heard what you did for the refugees from Blumberg. That is the sort of heroic deed we need more of around here.
Fine, Szaren can stay, just keep away from me, butcher! Monster! Never return!
You are beneath my contempt! You disgust me. Go away and never speak to me again.
I want nothing to do with either of you. You have proven your evil ways, and the fact that you would try to convince me to help Szaren tells me that he cannot be trusted either.
Maybe you should go with him. Your ways are no better than his.
Yes, be gone, foul fiend.
Nothing thanks - just thought I'd bask in your greatness.
Szaren asked me to talk to you about letting him set up an enclave here.
<StartAction>[Intimidate]</Start> If you know what's good for you, you'll let the wizard stay.
<StartAction>[Seriously Intimidate]</Start> Listen mayor - you let the wizard stay or you'll be late... Late, as in the late mayor of Hilltop. Understand me?
<StartAction>[Leave]</Start>
<StartAction>[Pummel the mayor into submission]</Start>
Just kidding... hahhaha...
<StartAction>[Cast Charm]</Start> This is the Red Wizard you've been looking for.
He may stay...
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Really Hilltop would be better defended from stuff like these kobolds if the Red Wizards were here.
You're right - I'll run that bum out of town.
Whatever...Is there no way I can change your mind?
I'll see what I can do.
I got enough problems with crazy people at the moment - You deal with him.
Someone decided to throw a party?
Do you usually have to put up with that?
Is he drunk?
What's the matter with him?
No. The school was nearly destroyed and Drogan lies near death.
There was nothing I couldn't handle, but Drogan was poisoned.
We were attacked by the kobolds and Master Drogan has been poisoned.
If I can help Drogan, then maybe he could help you.
I have problems of my own to worry about.
That is all. Goodbye.
I could use a little encouragement.
I need some herbs to help Drogan.
I met a man called Szaren.
It is foolish of you to drive him away.
I think you should let him stay.
He was hoping you would reconsider his proposition.
I didn't know the Red Wizards are evil.
I have spoken to Szaren in length, and I think he should stay.
I shall go speak to him some more, so that I can make an informed decision.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> If you don't let the wizard stay, the mayor might have an accident.
<StartAction>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> Listen Haniah, you let Szaren stay or Veraunt dies!
<StartAction>[Leave]</Start>
Sorry, I only meant that in jest.
<StartAction>[Cast Charm]</Start> Szaren is an ally and should remain here in Hilltop.
He may stay...
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Szaren only wishes to bring us prosperity.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Hilltop would be better defended from attacks if the Red Wizards were here.
You are making a big mistake, Haniah.
I will tell him of your decision.
I shall make him leave a swiftly as possible.
About Piper...
Fine, tell me about your problems.
I am here to help you, Haniah.
What are these problems you are having?
Does he make a lot of these predictions?
This is your problem? A fool of a doomsayer?
Let me guess, Hol was killed by the kobolds.
I have no time to deal with a lunatic.
What if he really is a prophet?
What would you pay me to solve this problem for you?
Perhaps we could meet somewhere private to discuss... payment.
You are being too vague. Name a sum or forget my help.
I do nothing for kindness, Haniah. Speak to me with gold.
I guess I can help you.
I will speak to Piper for you.
That's all. Goodbye.
I could use a little encouragement.
I need some herbs to help Drogan.
I have spoken to Szaren again.
I met a man called Szaren.
It is foolish of you to drive him away.
I think you should let him stay.
He was hoping you would reconsider his proposition.
Tell me about your problems.
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
How is everything going?
I will go see about Piper.
Piper is no longer a problem.
Goodbye.
No, I don't think so.
I just wanted you to know that Drogan is well.
I met a man called Szaren.
Fine, I will tell him to leave.
Fine. Goodbye.
There are several magical wards on this chest which you cannot seem to penetrate.
This alchemist's lab is where Master Drogan creates the focus crystals that power the rings he gives to his apprentices. He showed you once how to operate it.
You start gathering up the proper elixirs and powders that Drogan adds to the gems to create the crystals...
The table is very cluttered, and you begin sifting through the various powders and vials to see if there is anything of use.
Each focus crystal requires one quartz crystal combined with any two of the following gems: phenalope, aventurine, fluorspar or amethyst.
Placing the proper three gems in the grinder should enable you to use the various potions and powders already in the lab to create a functioning focus crystal.
<StartAction>Leave the lab alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Create focus crystals.</Start>
<StartAction>Search the lab.</Start>
<StartAction>How do I create a focus crystal?</Start>
Ohhh - I feel weak..
The door to master Drogan's chambers are, as usual, sealed with an arcane lock spell to prevent some of his more curious pupils from poking around...for their own safety, or so Master Drogan says.
Don't bother with me, <FirstName>. I can't help you, though I wish I could.
Poor Master Drogan! I just can't wait until he's recovered.
I don't think those creatures are coming back. I shouldn't have to stay here guarding the house.
I wish I could go with you, <FirstName>! Whoever did this... well, I'd just like to... ooo!! It makes me so mad!
So you'll leave the school forever once this is done? I wonder if that means Drogan will find a new student.
There is going to be so much work to get all this back in order. Master Drogan will be furious!
I hope everything's going well, <FirstName>. I'd hate to think whoever was behind all this was going to get away with it.
You've changed so much during your adventure, <FirstName>. I... I barely recognize you, to be honest.
You seem like you're doing really well so far, <FirstName>. Master Drogan would be very proud of your progress, I think.
Thank Mystra! Master Drogan's looking so much better now. Ayala says that he's well on his way to a full recovery.
Oh, <FirstName>! I'm so worried about Master Drogan! Do you think he'll be alright?
You don't *care*?! That's a terrible thing to say!
I haven't been here very long, but Master Drogan has never said anything but the most glowing things about you, <FirstName>! The very least you could do is show him some compassion!
Oh, poor little <FirstName>! <He/She> has to pay back Drogan for his kindness! What ever will <he/she> do?
Sarcasm, Mischa? I'm surprised at you.
Oooo... sarcasm from Mischa. I am certain <FirstName> shall be forever scarred from this moment on.
Sarcasm, Mischa? I'm surprised at you.
Well, <he/she>... oh, never mind. Just... go and do what you must, <FirstName>.
I am surprised, as well. Pleasantly surprised!
Well, that's good to hear, for once.
You know what Xanos would like to hear? Less mewling from idiot babes.
Oh, dear! <FirstName>, you have offended the ears of our little flower. How *ever* did you manage it?
I agree. I suspect you wouldn't say those things if Master Drogan were conscious, now, would you?
Oh, that's awful! The thought of Master Drogan actually dying... I... I just can't bear it!
Don't worry so much, Mischa. <FirstName> may not be correct... there may be hope for Master Drogan, yet.
Oh, Dorna! Do you really think so?
I... don't know. 'Plan for the worst and hope for the best.' Wise words of Drogan, himself.
'Do you really think so?' It makes Xanos sick to his stomach. Surely Drogan will die just to be away from such mewling!
What a surprise. Poor little girl cannot face terrible reality. Shall we spread the news? The populace shall be shocked!
Oh, thank Mystra! I'll pray that those herbs get here right away, then. If only I could help, somehow... I feel so useless just guarding the place!
Don't get any thoughts in your head of leaving, Mischa. I need you here to guard your master... that is no small task, despite what you think.
Y-yes, miss. I understand.
Don't worry so much, Mischa. You're needed here... just as we're needed to find those artifacts and stop whoever's behind all this.
Oh, I suppose you're right. It just doesn't feel that way.
That is because you *are* useless, my little strumpet! Ha ha ha!
Oh, shut up, Xanos!
My my! The little girl shows heat! Perhaps you should take her along after all, eh, <FirstName>? Ha ha ha!
Bah! Your problem is that you are too generous with lessers, <FirstName>. That shall be your undoing.
We could speak about your problems, Xanos, but <FirstName> doesn't have all day.
Now why didn't I say that?
Monster bait? Bwah-ha haa!! Wonderful!!
Fine. Laugh at me, if that's what you want. Just help Master Drogan and I won't care at all.
That's nice of you to say. I just hope it's the truth.
So many people just try to shield me from the truth, sometimes. If I'm ever going to be a paladin, I'll... have to face these things one day, won't I?
I suppose all I can do now is pray for him. Good luck, <FirstName>.
I'm sure we'll do everything we can to help Drogan, Mischa.
What, you don't believe <FirstName> now? You are accusing <him/her> of being a liar?
I... I said no such thing! That's not what I meant at all!
Ha ha ha! You are still such a little girl! Mystra's warrior, indeed!
What do I care? Stop bothering me.
I just want out of here, that's all.
I'll say whatever I like, girl.
I suppose you're right.
Probably not. It looks pretty grim.
Ayala says he just needs some herbs and he'll recover.
Knock it off, both of you.
Take her along? As what? Monster bait?
Leave her alone, Xanos.
He should be fine. Don't worry about it.
I hope you're not here to stir up trouble, <FirstName>. We've enough problems.
Hello, <FirstName>. On an errand for Master Drogan, I take it?
Hello again, <FirstName>. Everything's going well, I hope?
I've heard there's still some kobolds in Hilltop. Why aren't the guards being gathered together to search around?
I hope this doesn't mean the caravan lines are being attacked again. We can't afford to go without supplies this late in winter!
We should get everyone together and make sure everyone's alright. Maybe Drogan could help us out?
This is terrible. I used to feel safe here in Hilltop. I can't believe those creatures were so bold!
I wonder if Blumberg is alright? It's a much smaller village... if they were attacked, they might all be killed!
Master Drogan is alright, I hope? He's done a lot of good things for Hilltop.
You just stay away from me and mine, <FirstName>. You would have thought Drogan would have picked a better sort to train.
There's no need for you to be wandering around Hilltop, <FirstName>. Why don't you go back to Drogan's?
Oh, it's you, <FirstName>. You watch yourself around here... we had enough bad business with them kobolds.
I think that Drogan has done a fine thing training such a good-natured <lad/lass> such as yourself.
Thank the gods we have people like you in Hilltop, <FirstName>. I can only imagine what the kobolds might have done here, otherwise.
Always a pleasure to see you in town, <FirstName>. I certainly hope those kobolds didn't hurt anyone at your school.
I heard that you're close to graduating from Drogan's school. You're... not thinking of leaving Hilltop, are you? We'd all miss you greatly.
It's certainly nice to know that the kobolds didn't hurt you at all. Not that a man like yourself needs to worry about them, I suppose.
You know, I've always said to my friends that it's too bad Drogan doesn't let <FirstName> come into town more... and here you are!
It's certainly nice to see you in town, <FirstName>. How you can stand to be cooped up in that house all day, I can't imagine.
It's good to see you're alright, <FirstName>, and that those nasty kobolds didn't hurt you. I'd hate to hear anything bad happened to you.
You know, I've always thought that Drogan was one lucky dwarf to have such a charismatic follower.
You're Drogan's apprentice, aren't you? You know, I've heard a little about your barbaric background. Quite interesting.
I've heard you're quite the brute with an axe in your hand. Wish you'd been here to plant one in the heads of some of them kobolds, earlier.
You and that other apprentice of Drogan's... Dorna?... you're both from far up north, right?
I wouldn't have minded having a few spells to fight off those kobolds. I saw a few of them casting magic, themselves... it just seemed so unnatural.
Can't say that I know too much about magic and all... although it seems that your Master Drogan is a kind enough fellow. For a dwarf.
<FirstName>, isn't it? I've heard that you're some kind of mage, just like Master Drogan.
You know, it's good that at least one of Drogan's students is a holy <man/woman>. Makes up for that rude half-orc he harbors.
You might want to say a prayer for our little town, <FirstName>. If the kobolds are bold enough to attack, who knows what manner of beast will be next?
You know... I've told Mayor Verant a thousand times that we should build a proper church in Hilltop. That's why the kobolds attacked us! The gods are angry!
Thank the gods you're here, <FirstName>. I wish you were about earlier with that weapon of yours when the kobolds were everywhere.
Does Master Drogan tell you to walk around with your weapon swinging about? It's quite distracting.
You can put your weapon away, now. I, um... I think all the kobolds have been driven out of Hilltop.
You know, I have a cousin in Sundabar whom everyone says is slow. Frankly I think that's quite a rude thing for them to say.
Thank goodness one of Drogan's apprentices is here. How is Master Drogan? Alright, I hope?
Hmmm. You're one of Drogan's apprentices, right? Quite nice of him to take pity on such a... well, that is... never mind.
I see you were in quite the tussle. Do those wounds hurt much?
Oh dear, did you get attacked by kobolds? You look quite beat up, there.
Oh my... you're bleeding! You should go and see Gilford right away. He can heal you up, good as new.
Err... did you lose your clothes somewhere? Or doesn't Drogan supply you with any?
Either the kobolds went and stole your clothes or you've gone as mad as old Piper, there.
Are you mad? Running around in the middle of winter with no clothes on?
Thank you for healing me.
I was so afraid for Blumberg and it turns out I was right. They didn't stand a chance.
We can barely take care of our own people. How are we supposed to care for all these refugees?
I used to go to Blumberg all the time. I can't believe it's gone.
Someone told me that Master Drogan is better, now. That is the best news I've heard all day!
Surveying the carnage, you discern that the gnolls and kobolds fought each other here. The battle is long over, however, and who the victors were and where they went is a mystery.

By examining the bodies, it seems obvious to you that the kobolds and gnolls fought each other here... although who attacked whom and why are a mystery. You are fairly sure that the gnolls won the battle.

By examining the bodies in the area and the tracks nearby, it is obvious to you that the kobolds were ambushed by a group of gnolls as they passed. You suspect that the gnolls were victorious, though it seems equally likely that many of the kobolds fled during the melee.
The chicken seems very indignant and excitable, but even you are uncertain as to what she's trying to say exactly.
The chicken tells you a lame joke about crossing some road and then clucks endlessly in laughter.
The chicken excitedly asks you to tell the dogs to stay away from their pens. It thinks the dogs are very frightening with their big teeth.
The chicken whispers to you in conspiratorial tones that it believes the human farmer may indeed be... an axe-murderer!
The chicken clucks in outrage, explaining to you its belief that the humans have been systematically stealing her unborn children.
The chicken launches into a story about how it had been very much startled by a stick the previous day.
The chicken tells you in hushed clucks that one of its brood-sisters swallowed an odd stone and then coughed it up in the water trough just this morning.
<FirstName> is a nice name. Are you going to be famous some day? Like Elminster the Sage?
My daddy says he could beat you in a fight any day. Is that true?
Do you have lots of money? Daddy says adventurers get lots of money.
I want to be a <race> adventurer someday, just like you! Um... I think...
Is Master Drogan really a dwarf? I think he's really hairy.
Do you have to learn a lot at that school? Like, um... numbers and stuff?
I know you! You're <FirstName>!
Kobolds are scary. Are you going to kill some?
What's a kobold? My sister says I look like one when I get mad.
Oooo... can you cast any spells? My mother says she saw Drogan cast one, once.
Have you ever been on a real adventure? Are you on one now?
My mother says that adventurers just get themselves killed a lot. Is that true?
I saw that Drogan once, you know. He's really short.
You're <FirstName>, aren't you? I want to be an adventurer someday just like you!
The cow stares at you with disinterested cow eyes.
The cow looks at you with vague disinterest, sending empathetic messages of discomfort in the cold and an interest in finding hay.
The deer stares at you alertly, ready to bolt should you approach it further.
The deer appears skittish and suspects you are a vicious kobold, ready to eat it. It has little interest in communicating with you.
The dog bares its teeth and growls, obviously alarmed by your approach.
The dog wags its tail with obvious uncertainty and shies away from you.
The dog looks at you curiously. It seems friendly enough.
The dog responds gladly to your approach, excitedly wagging its tail and accepting your touch.
At your command, the dog happily bounds off to return to its normal routine.
The dog is overjoyed at the information, ecstatic that he will finally be able to impress Bethsheva enough to become her mate.
The thoughts he sends to you are of thanks as he quickly runs off towards the herbalist's home.

The dog has difficulty understanding what you might find useful... though it happily informs you that the Bubbling Cauldron is a wonderful place to beg for food. Or it was: now it smells rank of kobolds.
Beyond that, the dog states only that Bethsheva might know something interesting. The dog's thoughts indicate that it finds Bethsheva most interesting.
The dog responds happily that Bethsheva is a wonderfully smart and beautiful wolf-bitch that resides with the human druid, Farghan.
The word amongst the dogs in town is that Bethsheva buried something valuable in the village, but none of them can find it.
The dog thinks that is most clever of the she-bitch and wishes he could mate with her.
He believes that another dog has recently mated with Bethsheva and shoots jealous thoughts in that lucky dog's general direction.
The dog responds to your empathic communication with images from its mind. It dislikes the smell of the kobolds and hid from the cruel creatures when they passed.
The dog believes that the kobolds ran south along the path, heading for the place where the human wall opens up.
You fish into your pack for a few strips of dried meat. The dog gulps them down happily and wags its tail in thanks.
<StartAction>Send the dog on its way.</Start>
<StartAction>Tell the dog where Bethsheva buried the item.</Start>
<StartAction>Ask the dog for any useful information it might have.</Start>
<StartAction>Ask the dog about Bethsheva.</Start>
<StartAction>Ask the dog for information on the kobolds' passing.</Start>
<StartAction>Give the dog a snack.</Start>
We have to guard the gate until the reinforcements come. Damn kobolds broke it down somehow. Anyway... if you're going out there, be careful.
I wouldn't suggest you leave town just yet, <FirstName>. It's dangerous out there. Your choice.
Greetings, <FirstName>. Err... you're not thinking of heading beyond the wall, are you? With all them kobolds out there?
Right. Because you adventurer-types are so much more superior than us regular folk. Ahhh, do what you like.
Fine. Go get yourself killed. It's all the same to me.
You think so, do you? Yeah... maybe you're right. You're Drogan's apprentice and all that, after all.
Gone from Hilltop, yes, but who knows what they're up to out there? Kobolds are usually cowards, but these ones... they could be up to anything.
You're going to go looking for them? Well, that's a switch.
At any rate, if you're going out there, be careful. There's no telling what you'll encounter on the road this time of year.
At any rate, you might want to think twice before you leave Hilltop. I would suggest you get some decent equipment and maybe a little experience first.
I'm told there's probably some folks in town who could use some help. We can't do anything until the reinforcements from Blumberg get here... maybe you could?
It's just a suggestion, anyhow. I won't stop you from leaving, if that's what you're intent on.
Mind your own business, cretin.
I can handle myself.
Aren't the kobolds long gone?
I have no choice. I need to find those kobolds.
Sorry, but I can't chat right now. There's only a few of us left after that attack and the mayor wants us on double-duty... just in case.
It might be safer if you went back to the school. There's only a few of us guards left right now to watch for any more attacks.
You be careful, <FirstName>. There's no way to be sure all the kobolds are gone, and more could arrive.
<FirstName>? Is everything alright at the school? How is Drogan doing?
What are you doing here? I'm watching you, <FirstName>, just so you know.
Shouldn't you be back at your school? Drogan's there, isn't he? How is he doing?
I don't want any trouble out of you, <FirstName>. We've got enough problems in Hilltop right now.
Eh? Err... no, not this second. I have to watch for the reinforcements to arrive from Silverymoon. How about you? Everything okay with Drogan?
And more than any of us need right now. There were plenty of people hurt by the kobolds, not that you'd care.
Hmph. I don't know what Drogan sees in you. Well, do what you like. I have other things to worry about.
Oh? Everything okay at the school? Drogan is alright?
I've heard enough about your exploits, <FirstName>. Just watch it, that's all.
Well... maybe I'm being a bit harsh. I've just heard stories about you.
It's good to see you, <FirstName>. Something I can help you with?
You be careful there, <FirstName>. We're not certain all the kobolds are gone from Hilltop just yet.
It's good to see that you're okay, <FirstName>. We were worried about you and Drogan up at the school. How is Drogan doing?
Oh. I, ah... hope the old dwarf is alright, anyway. Those kobolds took us by surprise.
Something I can help you with?
Be careful.
Farghan's in his shop across from the tavern. But what am I saying? Of course you know where his shop is.
Not personally, no. Fiona's in her smithy, however... I'm sure she can supply you whatever equipment you need at a decent price.
I can't. The mayor wants the few of us that are left watching out for any new attacks. When we get reinforcements from Silverymoon, we'll do a house-to-house search.
Yes. We've already sent out a messenger to them, asking for help. Hopefully they weren't attacked as well.
The ones that ran away? They went south, by way of the town gate. You intend on chasing after them? If so, they've got quite a head start on you.
So they must have killed her right after they escaped. That's a sad, sad shame. Thank you for telling me... I'll let everyone know.
They did? But... I thought Lodar reported that he had everything under control there, short of a stand-off with a few kobolds in the kitchen.
Blast! The mayor should have let us go and help those poor souls. Ahhh, well... thank you for bringing me the news, <FirstName>, bad as it is.
Well, you might want to talk to Haniah over at the town hall. I heard the mayor's so drunk he can barely stand... so she's got her hands full, I bet.
Beyond that, if you could check around to make sure the kobolds aren't still bothering the locals, we'd appreciate it.
I'd gladly do that myself, but as long as we're this short-handed none of us can spare the time from keeping watch before help arrives.
That's a relief. It's always been a point of pride amongst the people here that we have our own resident wizard, you know.
Damnable reptiles! Took us by surprise, they did. I hope Drogan recovers. If he died, that would be a real loss for all of us.
Poisoned? Then you'd best get to Farghan's as soon as possible. He was in his shop the last I saw.
That's good to hear. Thank you for letting me know, I'll pass it on.
I wish we could have. We were taken by surprise and had our own battles to fight. We lost several men, I'm afraid to say.
I can't say that killing Piper was the right thing to do, but I guess it's on your conscience now, isn't it?
So you killed Piper, did you, <FirstName>? I can't say it wasn't coming for him, all things considered.
I cannot believe that Blumberg is burnt to the ground. I sure am glad we were better defended. You did a good thing, rescuing those refugees.
Is there something you need help with, sir?
I'm more trouble than you can handle!
I could not care less what you think of me, fool.
I'm on important business.
And why would I be any trouble?
Who cares? I have other things to worry about.
I've got to go.
I need to find the herbalist.
I need some equipment. Can you help me out?
There are still some kobolds in Hilltop. Will you help with them?
Reinforcements from Silverymoon?
Do you know where the surviving kobolds went?
I wanted to report that I found Mara... dead. Just outside Hilltop.
I thought you should know... the kobolds killed everyone in the tavern.
Is there anything in Hilltop I can do to help out?
He was alive, last time I saw him.
He's not good. He was poisoned by kobolds.
He was poisoned by kobolds, actually. I need to get some herbs for him.
He was poisoned, but he's recovering now at the school.
We could have used your help when the kobolds attacked, you know.
You should talk to Katriana if you have any questions.
Thank you for healing me.
You notice some humanoid tracks beneath the cliff, but are unable to determine what creature made them or any information about them.
A large group of humanoids seem to have come down the cliff face and headed south out of town.
These appear to be kobold tracks. A large group of them, at least 30, seem to have come down the cliff face and headed south out of town.
Oh, thank the gods; Adam called down and said you returned the baby to him.
Leave me be! My home is broken, no thanks to you!
Where are they? Where are Adam and Tynan? Did you find them?
Oh, please hurry. I have the worst feeling of dread for my innocent child.
<StartAction>[sob]</Start> No, no, gods no! Do not say they are dead! No! I cannot take this! Death take me; death take us all.
What is it? Please, tell me what has happened!
No! Not sweet Tynan! <StartAction>[Sob]</Start> How could the gods be so cruel? Oh, Adam!
Bring him to me, please!
Oh thank the gods, and you too, <FirstName>. I will go up and nurse him right away. That always soothes him so.
What? No! Please, do not say such a thing. What good could come from taking him? You cannot mean this!
I do not trust you. Give my child back and I will pay you. You are stronger than I am, so you do not have to worry about me double crossing you.
No! I will kill you, you villain!
Thank the gods, and you too, <FirstName>. Oh, Tynan, you precious little boy. How I feared you were dead.
But where is Adam? He... he is still alive, isn't he? Please, tell me I am not a widow.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Your mouth says he lives, but I can see it in your eyes. My Adam is gone! Why would you lie to me about such a thing?
You killed him! Yes, that is the only reason for you to lie to me. Well, you won't kill me too! You can't have my baby! No! Help, murder!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, thank you. I will go to him right away. First though, you deserve a reward. The only thing of value I have is my wedding ring.
No! No, poor, brave Adam. Those monsters murdered him! How can the gods be so cruel? At... at least I have Tynan, a small piece to remember Adam by.
I have my home and my wedding ring, as well. Of course, without Adam to support me, I guess I will have to sell the ring; just to help me until I can find a job.
Oh, <FirstName>, I could not ask that of you. If not for you my child would be dead too. I mean... it would be helpful, but I am sure I can survive if I sell my wedding ring.
<StartAction>[Gasp]</Start> I would never have believed that anyone could be so kind. Be assured that Tynan will be raised to know who his savior was.
Oh, <FirstName>, that is so kind of you. Be assured that Tynan will be raised to know who his savior was.
I will sing your praises in his ear and someday, if I raise him properly, perhaps he will grow to emulate you. Good luck to you, <FirstName>. And thank you again.
No, please, leave Tynan alone. He is so small and helpless. Take my ring, just leave my babe alone!
But, I have nothing to give you. I need to sell my ring, or my child and I will starve to death before winter's end.
Thank you again, <FirstName>. I will pray to the gods to keep you safe.
Oh, thank you. I will go to him right away. I have a healing potion hidden upstairs, where no one could find it.
First though, you deserve a reward. The only thing of value I have is my wedding ring. It's nothing special, but you might get a few gold for it.
I am sorry; I wish I had more to offer. I hope all goes well for you. I had better go see to my husband. Thank you again, <FirstName>.
Really? Oh, <FirstName>, that is so kind of you! When Adam and I have our next child, we will name it <FirstName>.. after you! Thank you so much.
Be careful in your journeys. We wouldn't want to lose a hero like you.
Please, I can still hear my child crying. Save Tynan!
My family is doomed! Oh, why will you not help me? Please!
Help me! Somebody help me! Oh, <FirstName>, thank the gods you are here! You must help me, please!
Kobolds attacked our house. Adam and I were still in bed when they burst into our room. We climbed out the window and Adam helped me down, then he went back in the front door.
He went to save little Tynan, but he hasn't returned. Tynan is only two months old. Oh, please, <FirstName>, you must save them!
But... but... you have been trained to do things like this. I would be slaughtered! Please, do not be so cruel! Save my family!
You are a horrible <man/woman>. Do not think that others will not hear about your cowardice! If my love and my child are lost, your name will become a curse upon every tongue in this town!
Questions? My family is about to be slaughtered, or may already be dead. How can you ask questions? This is no time for a friendly visit!
Please hurry and save my family!
What? Why would you need to know that? We have very few valuables. I am wearing my wedding ring, and that is the only thing of real value I own.
I... I... I cannot. If my husband is dead, I would have nothing else to remember him by. If you save him, I will give it to you. Just please, save my family!
Oh, I guess that is important to know. He is just upstairs in a side bedroom. Please, you must save him. I cannot imagine life without him.
I was climbing out the window, fleeing them. I didn't stop to count them! There must have been quite a few though. Adam is a strong man, and one or two would not be enough to stop him.
Payment? My husband and child may only have a few seconds to live! They might be dead already! Go now, please. I am sure we can come up with some reward, just go now!
Oh, thank you, <FirstName>, please hurry!
You'll always have a place in our hearts, <FirstName>. My poor Adam..
You lied to me. How could I have ever trusted you? For all I know, you killed Adam! Get out of my home and never return!
We shall starve, I fear. I am glad to have my babe back, but I do miss Thomas.
Not yet.
You weren't terribly attached to your family were you?
I have some terrible news for you.
I have some good news and some bad news.
Let's just say you and your husband will have time to make a new kid.
I rescued your husband, but was too late to save your baby.
Adam lives, but your child was killed by a kobold.
I rescued your baby.
Your baby is fine, but Adam was killed.
The baby is fine, but I do not have him on me.
I put Tynan back in his crib. He is safe.
I am keeping your child.
I don't need to explain. Goodbye.
I will think of something. Goodbye.
I will sell him as a slave to the Thayvian wizard.
Give me something now, if you want him back.
Then I am keeping him.
I was kidding. Here he is.
Here is your young babe.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Lie]</Start> He is alive. He is just waiting inside for you.
I am afraid Adam didn't survive.
Would it help if I gave you some gold?
I guess you are right. Good luck then.
I insist. Here is fifty gold.
I insist, here is ten gold.
Give me that ring, or your babe will follow his father to an early grave.
I think I deserve a reward for saving your baby.
Yes, well, I will be going then.
Adam is well. He waits inside for you.
Adam lives, but you will need to get him a healer.
That's it? I deserve more than that for risking my life.
I guess it will have to do then.
I don't need a reward. I was glad I could help.
Thank you. That is very generous of you.
I have my own problems. Why don't you go save them?
No, Goodbye.
Sorry, I don't know what I was thinking. I will help.
I guess I can try.
I have to ask you some questions first.
That's all my questions.
I will save them.
Where do you keep your valuables?
If you want your family to live, give me that ring!
Where is the baby?
How many kobolds are there?
Before I do anything, let's discuss payment.
There is no time then. I will do my best.
The ox stares at you with disinterested ox eyes.
The ox looks at you with vague disinterest, sending empathetic messages of discomfort in the cold and an interest in finding hay.
The rat watches you warily, concerned only with its gnawing hunger as it shivers from the cold.
So what did the mayor and his beautiful assistant have to say?
Was there anything else you needed then?
Yes, good luck to you, <FirstName>.
Ah, violence should always be a last resort, but sometimes it is necessary. As you seem to be good a problem solving, I think we shall become fast friends.
You have been of great assistance, <FirstName>. When I return, I shall remember the help you lent, and you shall have the finest discount I can offer.
Here is your one hundred gold, as promised. I am sure you will do very well. Drogan has trained a fine adventurer. Good luck, <FirstName>.
You disappoint me, <FirstName>. I had hoped you might have more sense than that. Someday you too will be the victim of close-minded bigotry. I hope you remember our conversation on that day.
So be it. I thank you for trying to help me. You are a fresh breeze in a town full of the stench of prejudice. Good luck, <FirstName>.
An ill wind accompanies this ill-fated day. And does this blasted cold ever end? How can civilization possibly exist in such a tormented landscape?
I wish it were truly that simple. I would like nothing better than to return to my home in Eltabbar, where temperatures are more moderate, and the seasons are of a reasonable length.
But, one does not say no to a command from Tharchion Dmitra Flass. Not if one wishes to survive, at least.
Now, judging from your uncouth demeanor, one could only suppose that you are one of Drogan's charges. I must then assume that you would be <FirstName>, the <class>.
That is unfortunate for both of us. I had hoped that a short discussion might be mutually beneficial. Alas, we shall never know.
Goodbye.
I overheard a conversation at the town hall that described you in fair detail. Apparently there are those who feel that you will continue on Drogan's legacy as an adventurer.
I thought it might be worth getting a look at you before I left town. Perhaps we could talk about something of mutual benefit.
The one who told a stranger to shut up and leave, simply for expressing an opinion about the weather. Granted, that is far nicer than you might have gotten in my homeland.
But most of my peers would have been more polite, before they warmed you up with a fireball.
Odd, I would think it hard to cut someone's purse strings with numbed fingers from the frigid air. Such a short time here and already I have heard of you, <FirstName>, the <class>.
Odd, I would think it hard to be a druid while all around you nature sleeps. From the looks of you, I would guess you are <FirstName>, the <class>.
Odd, I would think it hard to control your weapon when the frigid air numbs your fingers to the quick. Young and bold; let me guess, you must be <FirstName>, the <class>.
Odd, I would think it hard to voice your prayers with frigid air blasting down your throat. From the looks of you, I would guess you are <FirstName>, the <class>.
Odd, I would think it hard to keep your body flexible in such frigid weather. From the looks of you, I would guess you are <FirstName>, the <class>.
Odd, I would think it hard to cast your spells when your fingers are numb from the frigid air. Not a lot of magic users in a small village like this, so you must be <FirstName>, the <class>.
Odd, I would think it hard to pluck the strings on a lute in such a frigid temperature. Such a short time here and already I have heard of you, <FirstName>, the bard.
Yes, I suppose it must be hard to cut someone's purse strings with numbed fingers from the frigid air. Such a short time here and already I have heard of you, <FirstName>, the <class>.
Yes, I suppose it is hard to be a druid while all around you nature sleeps. From the looks of you, I would guess you are <FirstName>, the <class>.
Yes, it must be hard to control your weapon when the frigid air numbs your fingers to the quick. Young and bold; let me guess, you must be <FirstName>, the <class>.
Yes, it must be hard to voice your prayers with frigid air blasting down your throat. From the looks of you, I would guess you are <FirstName>, the <class>.
Yes, I suppose it must be hard to keep your body flexible in such frigid weather. From the looks of you, I would guess you are <FirstName>, the <class>.
Yes, it must be hard to cast your spells when your fingers are numb from the frigid air. Not a lot of magic users in a small village like this, so you must be <FirstName>, the <class>.
Yes. I suppose it must be hard to pluck the strings on a lute in such a frigid temperature. Such a short time here and already I have heard of you, <FirstName>, the <class>.
I suppose small villages must brag about any potential hero, though I would have thought they would wait until you graduated from this... school you have attended.
My name is Szaren and I am a wizard of Thay. And quite honestly, if that admission is not enough to make you turn around and walk away, then I would say we are off to a great start.
Now that is the attitude I have come to expect, particularly in such a small, unimportant village as this. Yet here I am.
What is it that makes people ignore what is in their best interests, simply so they can hold on to their prejudices? No, do not answer. It is simply too bad that we could not come to an arrangement.
Yes, I hope you have a pleasant day as well.
Straight to business then? Well, that is a better attitude than I have been met with so far.
The very attitude I was desperately hoping to find. I have been met only with prejudice and an unforgivable lack of courtesy.
My good Mistress, Lady Dmitra Flass, Tharchion of Eltabbar, has been working very hard to end the strife within Thay, as well as the costly and detrimental wars between Thay and her neighbors.
Please, do not mistake her goals as being altruistic. Thayvians crave two main things in life: gold and power.
Part of her plan is to show the other rulers of our country how much can be gained through peace. Thay has begun to set up magical enclaves in cities throughout Faerun.
These enclaves sell magic items of various sorts to anyone with sufficient gold. So far the enclaves have been very successful and Lady Flass has gained much prestige.
Overly impatient are we? I will try to make this succinct then.
Your mayor is shortsighted and refuses to allow me to set up an enclave in Hilltop. Our goal was to prove our worth here in the Silver Marches, then expand once trust is earned.
As one of Drogan's students, you command some respect around here. I hoped you might be willing to convince the mayor that my presence could only be a benefit here.
Of course, information is power. I will tell you what I can, so you may judge us fairly.
Then I bid you farewell and hope that you will return soon bearing good news.
Good luck, friend.
So, have you made your judgment? Will you try to help me?
I am afraid I left behind anything I did not feel would be necessary for this trip. Should I be allowed to return, I would bring some supplies with me.
The rest of the supplies, guards and workers would have to come by caravan, so they would take a while longer.
But there would be many arrangements to take care of before I could return, so I imagine it will take me a couple of weeks.
That is often the case, and yet we have found that our practice of slavery is not accepted in this part of the world, and so I left my slaves and came here using magic to transport me.
I even came without guards, for it made the travel easier. I did not expect much resistance, but you can understand how I was not quick to run out and attack the horde of kobolds all by myself.
If I am able to set up an enclave here, I would bring guards and slaves, though I would keep the slaves in the compound, so as not to offend the other residents.
Yes, the benefits to both would be great, although I doubt my profits will be as good as those enclaves in larger centers.
Still, there are many adventurers in these northern territories; I should do a fair trade.
I could hardly run a profitable business if the village was overrun with monsters, now could I? My guards and my magical abilities would be a true asset for Hilltop.
The enclave would be considered Thayvian soil, and I would not traffic in slaves, neither to buy nor sell. They would remain in the compound and belong only to me.
Besides, I guarantee that their lives would be far better out here than if they remained in Thay proper. I do not mistreat my slaves; it is not economical.
The Red Wizards are the rulers of Thay. When a child is still young, he or she is tested for power in the magical arts. Children who prove adept are taken to schools.
The schools teach us to use our powers to the fullest, which means that many youth die before they can become Red Wizards. The teachers are harsh, your fellow students are even worse.
Even reaching the status of Red Wizard guarantees nothing more than that you will be treated a little better than a slave. It takes many years for a powerful practitioner to reach high status.
It is better than the lot some face. There are benefits to being a Red Wizard, and I wouldn't want to live the life of slavery that my parents did.
It is minds like yours that start wars when there is room for peaceful prosperity.
I can see that we shall not be seeing eye to eye. Therefore, I shall depart and you can keep the stench of your provincial, small town. I refuse to spend even another minute here.
I hope these kobold invaders destroy your entire village.
I am not whining, I am simply responding to your question. There are benefits to being a Red Wizard, and I wouldn't want to live the life of slavery that my parents did.
What choice are we given? You do or you die, such is life. There are good points to being a Red Wizard, and I wouldn't want to live the life of slavery that my parents did.
Not that I remember my parents, but I certainly know what the life of a slave in Thay is worth. No I would not trade my upbringing for any other in Thay.
But enough about that. Do you have any other questions?
That is unfortunate. To have invested so much time here with no results will make my mistress very angry. The disgust for you and your people that we Thayvians hold appears to be well founded.
When the day comes that Szazz Tam and his armies prevail over my Mistress and her commerce, then you shall rue this day and the mistake you made.
I leave behind the stench of this village and its intolerant attitude.
I can afford to pay you one hundred gold. I would imagine that in a small village like this, that would be enough to buy you a small farm, and possibly the farmer too.
That is all I can afford. If you will not do this, I shall simply move on to the next village, and then the next, until I find someone willing to listen to reason.
I know that the weather up here is frightfully cold, but certainly there must be someone left whose wits have not been fully frozen.
That is all I ask. Thank you for doing such a kindness for a stranger. You shall be well rewarded.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> What do I look like, some kind of charity? Gold is a reward for a job well done. So go do your job, as you promised.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> It is always good to establish a rapport with those you deal with. I find gold helps speed the bonding.
Here is ten gold. I might even be willing to forget I gave you an advance, if you do a good job.
Best of luck to you, my young friend.
You must understand that normally we only set up an enclave in large cities, where commerce is strong and profits are high.
Unfortunately, we have had a very difficult time getting permission from local lords and rulers in the northwest. I am afraid our reputation precedes us.
You have never heard of the Red Wizards of Thay and how we are all evil, murderous villains, who sell our souls to demons in trade for more power?
What do they teach you in these adventuring schools? Why, it is almost refreshing, and yet, vaguely frightening.
I must go now.
Nothing yet.
No, farewell.
The mayor and his assistant are dead and will not stop you.
The mayor said it was fine for you to stay.
I am here to run you out of town, evil mage!
I am afraid my appeal changed nothing.
I fear that the mayor is no longer listening to my advice.
If you don't like it, shut up and leave.
I don't want to talk to you.
Goodbye.
What do you mean by that?
How do you know that?
Who are you calling uncouth?
How did you know who I was?
Actually I like this invigorating weather.
I couldn't agree more.
Who are you?
A Red Wizard in Hilltop? Be gone before I strike you down!
Good riddance.
What do you mean by that?
What is a Red Wizard doing in Hilltop?
I would hear more before I judge you.
You expect me to believe that?
Tell me more.
Sounds awfully noble.
Get to the point where I'm supposed to be interested.
I would like to ask you some questions.
That's all the questions I have.
I will end your evil existence right now!
I will not help you. You must leave our village alone.
I will return.
Do you have anything for sale?
Don't the Red Wizards usually travel with slaves?
Sounds like a lucrative prospect for you and the village.
I cannot allow you to bring slaves to this village.
So would you help defend the town if you had an enclave here?
So you plan to bring slavery to Hilltop?
No, I will not help you spread your evil!
What exactly are the Red Wizards?
That sounds like a horrible childhood.
The more Thayvian that die, the better off the world is.
Quit your whining; life is hard all over.
If it is so hard, why do it?
I have no interest in helping you.
How much is this worth to you?
That's not enough.
I'll see what I can do.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> How about some gold upfront?
I will be back.
Why would you come to such a small village?
Is that why you are here?
Why would I walk away?
Greetings, m'lady! Might I say that it's a fine thing to be greeted by such a fair face as yours on such a cold day.
Why hello there! Such a pretty face, even on a big folk such as yourself, is a treat to warm the heart on a cold, cold day.
Ah, but it's the tall ones that make the finest catch! You'd be surprised the things a halfling can make up for when he's caught a foot or two short, m'lady.
Mmm. On such a chilly day, it's a pleasant treat to meet such a pretty halfling lass as yourself.
Now, now, no need to get violent. Unless, um... well, no, never mind that. Can't blame a lad for trying, can you? Heh heh.
Ah, well, you can't blame a man for trying, can you? A woman like yourself no doubt has the lads throwing themselves at your feet... I can only do the same.
Ha! A compliment, is it? Well, that certainly beats the odd slap I've gotten as of late. Perhaps my luck is turning about.
Oh-ho! We've only just met and here you've gone and figured me out already. It seems I'm as uncomplicated as halflings come, eh?
My name is Torias. A pleasure to meet you. Might I have the honor of knowing your name?
Hard to get, is it? Have it your way, m'lady. I'll but gladly play along.
Ahhh, yes, the dwarven wizard. I remember him from our last visit. Fine fellow. Good to know he keeps such excellent company.
<FirstName>, is it? A beautiful name for a beautiful lady.
Why, hullo there. I don't suppose you've a rum-tipped cigar on you, by chance?
Ah, well. I grew attached to them in Amn, you see, and have only recently run out. Too bad. Grey days ahead, I suppose.
A rum-tipped cigar. It's... well, never mind. Simply something I grew attached to in Amn, and I've recently run out. Ah, well.
Pardon my manners, sir. I am called Torias. And you are...?
Oh. Well, then, a good day to you.
Oh, I see. A <man/woman> of mystery, eh? Fair enough.
Then I am very pleased to meet you, <FirstName>.
Is there something that Torias might do for you today?
I see. A good day to you, then.
Well... I would gladly answer questions, dear <man/woman>, but I'm sure that Katriana would have my hide. I have to be on watch for more kobolds, you see.
There were some other kobolds that came running past well after everything seemed settled. Scared us but good, but they ran on south through the gate.
I've no idea where they came from or what they were up to. Large group, actually.
Yes, indeed. The little fellows crept up on us and took us all rather by surprise. Made off with a good amount of our supplies, too.
Unlike the other kobolds which fled Hilltop by the gate, these ones ran north of here to an old farm. I followed them but I didn't dare go inside as I was alone.
Some of them jumped into the river to the east, but others might still be in there. They may even still have some of our equipment, I don't know.
Alas, I cannot. I have to stay with my fellows until they're better. No running off to adventure for me.
If you're thinking of going up there, I might suggest you speak to Katriana first. She might have a boon to ask of you. Beyond that... good luck.
Hmm. Well, Katriana would tell you that no, it doesn't... at least not at the moment. We came to Hilltop to stock up, and the kobolds made off with a lot.
At least... they made off with our public goods. We have some... private goods, if you know what I mean. Black market stuff.
Not necessarily, no. Just goods that might appeal to those of a, ah, more subtle nature: the workings to build traps, tools... those sorts of things.
Mmm... oh, of course, of course. What else can Torias do for you, my dear <man/woman>?
Certainly. Give me but a moment to find what I have...
Not necessarily, no. Just goods that a, ah, experienced rogue might appreciate. Like yourself, for instance... I can spot the type anywhere.
Greetings once again! Is there something Torias can do for you?
Good gracious me! Those are Daschnaya's cards! My, my, but will she ever be delighted that you've found them.
Please... go and show these to Katriana. She'll let you in to see Daschnaya, I'm sure. We've all been worried sick about the poor woman ever since these cards were stolen!
Greetings, my good <man/woman>!
Katriana tells me that you were able to retrieve Daschnaya's cards. For that I am most grateful.
I hear that you're going to be coming with us to the desert, eh? Well, welcome aboard!
Care to be greeted by the back end of my fist?
How about I treat you to the back end of my fist?
I'm a little tall for a small man like you, don't you think?
Care to meet the back end of my fist?
Whatever you're thinking, don't get your hopes up.
You're not so bad for a halfling lad, yourself.
Flatterer.
Forget it.
My name is <FullName>, apprentice to Master Drogan.
It's <FirstName>.
No. Not that I would hand them out to strange halflings if I did.
Err... can't say that I do.
A rum-tipped what?
Leaving.
Someone who doesn't introduce <him/her>self.
My name is <FullName>, apprentice to Master Drogan.
I'm called <FirstName>.
I should go.
Can I ask you a few questions?
More kobolds?
You were attacked, I take it?
Why are you on watch for more kobolds?
I might head up that way. Care to join me?
Does this caravan sell anything?
You mean illegal goods?
Maybe later.
I'm not interested.
Let me see what you have, then.
Do you know what happened to the kobolds that attacked you?
I found these cards... do they belong to you?
I'd like to see your goods.
You are unable to determine what creature made these tracks or any information about them.
These appear to be kobold tracks. Several of them seem to have gone into the barn, but not come out.
These appear to be kobold tracks. Two of them seem to have gone into the barn, but not come out.
Is there something I can do for you, <FirstName>?
Then I wish you well.
With the kitchen in such a mess, no, I'm afraid not. You'll have to come back after the tavern re-opens if you want something.
Thank you so much for rescuing me! It's very fortunate you came along... I was certain those little beasts were going to kill me!
I might. If the kobolds didn't get into them, there's probably some in the pot on the stove. Help yourself.
That's very noble of you. I'm sure Drogan would be very proud.
Err... very grateful, of course. Why do you ask?
I do wish I could do more than merely thank you, <FirstName>. You were the only one who could save me, and for that I'll always be grateful.
Ha ha! I'd gladly cook you up the best meal you've ever eaten if my kitchen weren't a total wreck.
Tell you what. Come back here once we've had a chance to re-open the tavern and I'll do just that. You won't be sorry!
Ha ha! Do you say that to all the girls you rescue, or just me?
I have a whole kitchen to start cleaning here, <FirstName>. Maybe come back some other time and, ah... I'll see what I can arrange.
You know... I always had a fantasy about a brave adventurer sweeping me off my feet one day. This isn't it.
Now then. If you manage to get your head out of the gutter long enough, please take it outside. I've got a kitchen to clean.
I... have a few coins, but that's all. I'm not wealthy by any means. Surely you don't have need of them!
Thank you. I do wish I could give you the reward you deserve, <FirstName>. I will always be grateful, I hope you know that.
Alright, then, take them. I'll have to work twice as hard now to open the tavern back up, so please excuse me.
Oh. Well, if you put it that way, here... take the coins. Now please leave, as I've got an entire kitchen to clean up.
Please, help us! Get those kobolds out of here! Somebody has to do something!
Please, help me! They... they're going to kill me for certain!
I'll be on my way.
Do you have anything to eat around here?
Actually, I came here looking for Helmthorn berries. Do you still have some?
You're welcome.
It was nothing more than my duty.
So... just how grateful are you?
It took a lot of effort to rescue you, that's why.
I'm hungry. Are my efforts worth a good meal?
Would the fair damsel deign to reward her rescuer with a simple kiss?
You're a pretty girl. Surely I don't have to spell it out for you.
I want a reward, of course. You must have some coin on you.
No. Keep them, then.
They'll have to do. Hand them over.
I can think of another way for a pretty girl like you to reward me...
I actually need some Helmthorn berries. The herbalist said you might have some.
**yip** **yip**
Okays! You back - what you want now? You helps us leave?
Yip! Who you be? We wants no more fights! Yip yip!
You lets us go! Yip! Or we kills cook-woman!
You hears that? You lets us go! We no fight, we takes cook-woman with us! We smarts, you not tricks us!
Really? But we just gets started! Yip!
You shuts up! Just makes it go away!!
Okay, you goes away now! You lets us leave or we kills cook-woman! We be very serious!!

An outrage! We are betrayed!!

You not trusts it! No deals! No deals!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oooh... looks at all the pretty lights...
Quick! Get them now while they are distracted!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> AAAAHHHH! YIP YIP YIP!! WE SURRENDERS!!

WE SURRENDERS! WE SURRENDERS!! NO HURTS!! NO HURTS PLEEEASE!!
<StartHighlight>[Success]</Start> What you do with hands? What <he/she> doing?!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Me trusts you. Me trusts you lots. Okay, we comes.

<He/She> be okays. <He/She> not hurts us. We go out now! Yip!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, you surrenders!
You surrenders! We gots cook-woman! You not gots cook-woman!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Umm... me not like sounds of that...
It lets us lives! We not dies! Yip yip! Takes it, takes it!
Okays, we comes out now. Yip! You no hurts us, okays?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> We not believes you! You tries to tricks us!!
Yip yip! Now you lets us go! We leaves with cook-woman and you not stops us!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> What this? Yip? You no tricks us?
But <FirstName>...! You can't just let them leave with Mara!
Yip! You no lets us go? What we do now then?!
You lets us go!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... ah, that is... of course. I suppose you do know what's best, <FirstName>...
I... I see. Why, yes, I... we will follow your lead, <FirstName>. Of course.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No! No, I won't allow it! Find another way!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... I suppose you know what's best...
We gets to leave? Yip yip yip! We go! We go now!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Umm... you not tries to trick us?
<He/She> be much important! Much better hostage! We takes, we takes!!
Yip yip yip! Okays! We takes you, gives away her! You be much betters! You not try to tricks us, now...
Mmmm... yip... okays, maybe. But if you comes in, you comes alone! You gots friend they waits out theres!
Yeah! Yip yip! <He/She> comes alone! Only alone!!
See! Me tells you! <He/She> just tries to be tricksy! You lets us go now!!
No! Do not be a fool, <FirstName>! Why risk your life for the sake of a stupid girl?!
It will be alright, <FirstName>. I'll wait here and watch for your lead.
Grrr! Me not knows... you gots beastie. We takes you hostage, you sends beastie away! Yip yip!
Okays! Now you be our hostage! Yip yip!
Err... what we do with it?
Me not know. Maybe it cooks? You cooks something goods to eat! You cooks now! Yip yip!
Yip yip yip! Betrayed! Betrayed!!
You is so dumb to takes new hostage! Fight! Yip yip! Fight!!
Umm... that sounds good. Yip. Is you serious?
Yip yip! Then you gets to cooking! Me be hungry!!
You not trusts it! No deals! No deals!!
We fights! Fights!! Yip yip yip!!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You is hostage! You be quiet!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> We leaves, we takes you with us! You be hostage!!
Erm... maybe we just goes? <He/She> maybe not be good hostage...
You is right. Yip. Okays, we goes. But you no tricks us... we be smart!!
Please - no hurts us!
Yip yip! You helps us kobolds. We be very happy! We gives you reward!
You takes this. We thanks you, but gots to run now! Yip yip yip! We go!!
Err... okays. You is strange. Yip yip yip! We go!!
Yip yip yip! Betrayed! Betrayed!!
I've talked to you long enough.
How about I help you kobolds fight your way out of here?
Of course. Let's do it now!
Maybe... for the right price.
No, forget I mentioned that.
<StartCheck>[Perform]</Start> <StartAction>[Attempt to fascinate the Kobolds]</Start>
<StartAction>[Cast Bane on the Kobold]</Start> Just surrender now and you won't get hurt!
<StartAction>[Cast Scare on the Kobold]</Start> Just surrender now and you won't get hurt!
<StartAction>[Cast Sleep on the Kobolds]</Start>
<StartAction>[Cast Charm Person on the Kobold]</Start> Just put your weapons away and give yourselves up. You can trust me.

<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> All right, you win. We'll let you go.

<StartAction>[Whisper]</Start> We will ambush them when they come out!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Don't worry about it. I will rescue her later, if I can.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Take me as a hostage, instead, and let the woman go.

I agree. I will come alone.
Forget it. I won't do that.

Now that the cook is safe I can kill you properly!
Now that I'm on this side... how about I help you get out of here?
No. Forget I said anything.
Here! Eat hot death, kobold!!
Maybe. If the price is right.
Absolutely. Let's attack them now!
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> Absolutely. Let's attack them now!
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> I'm much stronger than the cook. Surrender now and you won't get hurt.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Look... you can leave now. Just go and nobody will hurt you.
A reward? Sounds good to me.
Just get out of here, vermin. I don't want your reward.
Actually, I just like to kill. And you're next!
Please... talk to those kobolds, if you can. Just don't get Mara hurt, I beg you!
Go on, then. If you're not going to help us, we'll wait for someone that can!
Look at this place! Those damnable kobolds tore in here a while ago, looking for a fight, and now they've barricaded themselves in the kitchen!
We certainly do. The problem is that they're holding my cook hostage in there. If we try to push past the barricade, they'll kill her for certain.
Then we'll have to wait until the town guard can help us. Go on! Get out of here, then, if you won't be of any use!
Thank you, <FirstName>. Just... please make sure Mara isn't hurt.
Why you should...? I can't believe I'm hearing this! You're Drogan's apprentice, aren't you? Drogan would help us in an instant!
